original: mi 'tshe ba'i bsam pa ni zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mi 'tshe ba'i bsam pa ni zhes bya ba la /
translated: The thought of nonviolence.

original: kha cig skye ba ji srid par rang bzhin gyis srog mi gcod pa yod kyang de sdig pa mi byed pa zhes bya ba'i gnyen po'i phyogs la legs par spyod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: kha cig skye ba ji srid par rang bzhin gyis srog mi gcod pa yod kyang de sdig pa mi byed pa zhes bya ba'i gnyen po'i phyogs la legs par spyod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Some say: As long as one is born in this world, one naturally does not kill, but that is not the proper practice of nonvirtuous action.

original: de'i phyir spong bas bsdus pa'i legs par spyod pa gzung ba'i phyir mi 'tshe ba'i bsam pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir spong bas bsdus pa'i legs par spyod pa gzung ba'i phyir mi 'tshe ba'i bsam pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, in order to include the proper practice subsumed by abandonment, the thought of nonviolence is mentioned.

original: srog gcod pa las sog pas tshe ring bar 'gyur ro zhes mdo las bstan to//
analyzed: srog gcod pa las sog pas tshe ring bar 'gyur ro zhes mdo las bstan to//
translated: The sutras state: Through abandoning killing, one obtains a long life.

original: snang ba dang / gos gtsang ma sbyin pa ni zhes bya ba ni /üîΩmar me sbyin pas mig thob 'gyur //
analyzed: snang ba dang / gos gtsang ma sbyin pa ni zhes bya ba ni / mar me sbyin pas mig thob 'gyur //
translated: Giving light and clean clothes.üîΩThe sutras state: Through giving lamps, one obtains eyes.

original: zhes mdo la la nas bstan pa snang ba sbyin pa gsungs pa yin no //üîΩsnang ba sbyin pas kha dog snang bar byed pa'i phyir kha dog dang ldan par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: zhes mdo la la nas bstan pa snang ba sbyin pa gsungs pa yin no // snang ba sbyin pas kha dog snang bar byed pa'i phyir kha dog dang ldan par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: This is the teaching on giving light.üîΩThrough giving light, one obtains a beautiful complexion because it illuminates the color of one's body.

original: gos sbyin pas ni kha dog mdzes //
analyzed: gos sbyin pas ni kha dog mdzes //
translated: Through giving clothes, one obtains a beautiful color.

original: zhes la la nas bstan pas de'i phyir bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes la la nas bstan pas de'i phyir bstan pa yin te /
translated: Some say: It is taught in this way because it is taught.

original: gos byin pas gsang ba'i gnas rnams bkab pas mdzes par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gos byin pas gsang ba'i gnas rnams bkab pas mdzes par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: By giving clothing, one becomes beautiful because the secret parts of the body are covered.

original: sar pa smos pa ni kha dog ldan pa'i gos byin par bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sar pa smos pa ni kha dog ldan pa'i gos byin par bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: The term new indicates that one gives clothing of good color.

original: dri ma med pa'i gos sbyin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dri ma med pa'i gos sbyin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the term is one gives stainless clothing.

original: thams cad du tshul khrims dang ldan pa'i rang bzhin yin no zhes bya bar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: thams cad du tshul khrims dang ldan pa'i rang bzhin yin no zhes bya bar rig par bya ste /
translated: One should understand that they are all by nature moral beings.

original: tshul khrims ni bde 'gror skye ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dang / de dag ni 'phangs pa'i rnam par smin pa'i rgyu'i khyad par las byung ba'i phyir te /üîΩgcig gis gcig ni 'phangs pa las //
analyzed: tshul khrims ni bde 'gror skye ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dang / de dag ni 'phangs pa'i rnam par smin pa'i rgyu'i khyad par las byung ba'i phyir te / gcig gis gcig ni 'phangs pa las //
translated: Because morality is the cause of birth in happy realms and because they arise from the special cause of projected karmic maturation.

original: du ma yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya bas so //
analyzed: du ma yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya bas so //
translated: Many are completed from the projection of one.

original: nga rgyal nges par bcom pa zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims dang ldan pa ni nga rgyal bcom pa nyid kyis rigs mthon po'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: nga rgyal nges par bcom pa zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims dang ldan pa ni nga rgyal bcom pa nyid kyis rigs mthon po'i rgyu yin te /
translated: The line ‚Äúhe definitely conquers pride‚Äù means that one who is endowed with moral discipline is the cause of a high family due to having conquered pride.

original: bla ma dang bla ma'i gnas rnams la phyag 'tshal ba dang / 'dud pa dang / gzhan dag la yang gus pa'i sems kyis 'dud pa dang / bran dang 'dra ba dang ; gdol pa dang 'dra bar 'jig rten shes pas rjes su 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: bla ma dang bla ma'i gnas rnams la phyag 'tshal ba dang / 'dud pa dang / gzhan dag la yang gus pa'i sems kyis 'dud pa dang / bran dang 'dra ba dang ; gdol pa dang 'dra bar 'jig rten shes pas rjes su 'jug pa'o //
translated: He bows to gurus and those worthy of honor, and he bows with a respectful mind to others as well. He acts in the world as if he were a servant or an outcaste.

original: des ni rigs mtho zhing che ba rnams su so sor skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: des ni rigs mtho zhing che ba rnams su so sor skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: Because of that, he is reborn in high and great families.üîΩThe sutra teaches:

original: nga rgyal nges par bcom pa yis //
analyzed: nga rgyal nges par bcom pa yis //
translated: Through definitely conquering pride,

original: mthon po'i rigs su skye par 'gyur //üîΩzhes mdo las bstan pa'i phyir ro //üîΩdbang phyug phun sum tshogs @45a * //
analyzed: mthon po'i rigs su skye par 'gyur // zhes mdo las bstan pa'i phyir ro // dbang phyug phun sum tshogs @45a * //
translated: he is reborn in a high family.

original: pa rnam pas gsum bstan pa'i rgyu 'dir bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: pa rnam pas gsum bstan pa'i rgyu 'dir bstan par bya ste /
translated: The causes for the teaching of the three perfections of lordship should be taught here.

original: gzhan gnyis kyang de'i khongs su 'dus pa'i phyir dang / de'i rjes su 'brangs pa'i phyir dang / gang la spyod pa dang / gang dag dang spyod pa dang / gang dag gis 'dus byas pa spyod pas de thams cad longs spyod ces byas nas dbang phyug phun sum tshogs pa'i rgyu ni sbyin pa yin par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gnyis kyang de'i khongs su 'dus pa'i phyir dang / de'i rjes su 'brangs pa'i phyir dang / gang la spyod pa dang / gang dag dang spyod pa dang / gang dag gis 'dus byas pa spyod pas de thams cad longs spyod ces byas nas dbang phyug phun sum tshogs pa'i rgyu ni sbyin pa yin par bstan pa yin no //
translated: The phrase the perfection of giving is the cause of the perfection of power is explained by the words because all of that is enjoyment.

original: slong ba rnams dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sbyin pa rnam pa gnyis bstan te /
analyzed: slong ba rnams dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sbyin pa rnam pa gnyis bstan te /
translated: The phrase to beggars and to those who do not beg indicates two kinds of giving:

original: don du gnyer ba dang / don du mi gnyer ba'o //üîΩ'dod cing gsol ba 'debs pa rnams la byin pa ni don du gnyer ba la sbyin pa ste /
analyzed: don du gnyer ba dang / don du mi gnyer ba'o // 'dod cing gsol ba 'debs pa rnams la byin pa ni don du gnyer ba la sbyin pa ste /
translated: giving to those who ask and giving to those who do not ask.üîΩGiving to those who ask is giving to those who are in need and who request something.

original: zas 'dod pa rnams la zas la sogs pa gang 'dod pa sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: zas 'dod pa rnams la zas la sogs pa gang 'dod pa sbyin pa'o //
translated: It is giving food and so on to those who want food and so on.üîΩGiving to those who do not ask is giving to those who are not in need and who do not request anything.

original: yo byad mi bdog pa rnams dang / phan 'dogs pa rnams dang / sdug bsngal ba rnams dang / yon gnas rnams la don du mi gnyer yang yo byad med par rang gis shes nas rdzas byin pas nye bar sdud pa yin no //
analyzed: yo byad mi bdog pa rnams dang / phan 'dogs pa rnams dang / sdug bsngal ba rnams dang / yon gnas rnams la don du mi gnyer yang yo byad med par rang gis shes nas rdzas byin pas nye bar sdud pa yin no //
translated: One attracts those who have no possessions by giving them material things. One attracts those who are helpful by giving them material things. One attracts those who are suffering by giving them material things. One attracts those who are worthy of worship by giving them material things.

original: de la don du gnyer ba la byin pas ni bdag nyid kyis nye bar longs spyod pa'i nye bar mkho ba rnams thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la don du gnyer ba la byin pas ni bdag nyid kyis nye bar longs spyod pa'i nye bar mkho ba rnams thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: By giving to those who seek something, one obtains the necessities for one's own use.

original: don du mi gnyer ba la byin pas ni nye bar spyad pa ma yin pa'i nor gyi phung po chen po thob pas de ltar longs spyod chen por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don du mi gnyer ba la byin pas ni nye bar spyad pa ma yin pa'i nor gyi phung po chen po thob pas de ltar longs spyod chen por 'gyur ro //

original: longs spyod bsags pa dang ldan pas longs spyod chen po nyid do //
analyzed: longs spyod bsags pa dang ldan pas longs spyod chen po nyid do //

analyzed: nor chen po dang ldan par 'gyur /üîΩlongs spyod chen po dang ldan par 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //

original: ngag gis nye bar spyod pa bzhi dang bral ba'i ngag yon tan lnga dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: ngag gis nye bar spyod pa bzhi dang bral ba'i ngag yon tan lnga dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /

analyzed: bdag ni rtag tu sdig pa'i grogs po dang bral dge ba'i bshes dang mngon par mi 'bral zhing //

original: de bzhin gshegs pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i sku'i gzugs brnyan bzhengs pa dang / sngar mi bzhugs pa'i sa phyogs su de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod rten bzhengs pa dang / mchod rten rnying pa la sogs pa gso ba dang / gnyis ka la yang me tog dang /

analyzed: bdag nyid kyi bla ma ni khyim pa'i phyogs la ma dang pha'o //
translated: In the case of householders, one's parents are one's gurus.

original: rab tu byung ba'i @46a * //
analyzed: rab tu byung ba'i @46a * //
translated: In the case of those who have gone forth,

translated: The stream of being that is perfumed by such virtues, based on the worship of the Three Jewels and the guru, becomes renowned for its great power through special causes and conditions.

translated: The cause of human birth is taught in terms of oneself and others, in two and two verses.

original: de lta bu'i skyas pa'i dngos pos 'dun pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / brtan pa dang / shes rab chen po la brten pa'i yon tan mthong nas mngon par dga' ba'i rang bzhin can du gyur nas gnas pa ni bdag gi dbang du byas pa'i rgyu dang po'o //

translated: Having seen the virtues based on great aspiration, effort, firmness, and wisdom of such a noble person, one becomes one whose nature is to delight in them. This is the first cause in terms of oneself.

analyzed: bud med du gyur kyang bud med kyi dngos po la smod cing mi mthun par blta la /

analyzed: gzhan la brten pa'i rgyu ni rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /

original: bud med du gyur cing bud med kyi dngos po la mngon par dga' ba rnams la sngar bstan pa'i bud med kyi dngos po'i nyes dmigs ston cing de las 'dun pa bzlog pa ni skyes pa'i dbang po rab tu thob par 'gyur ro //

translated: For those who have become women, such as the women of the M≈´la country, who are led around by men with their noses cut off, and for animals, he teaches the Dharma in a way that is appropriate.

original: rin gyis blu ba'am /
analyzed: rin gyis blu ba'am /

original: chos bstan pas de mgu bar byas nas thar bar byed kyi /
analyzed: chos bstan pas de mgu bar byas nas thar bar byed kyi /

original: stobs kyis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: stobs kyis ni ma yin te /

original: de ltar thar bar byed na skyes pa'i dbang po thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar thar bar byed na skyes pa'i dbang po thob par 'gyur te /

analyzed: bzhi po de dag ni skyes pa nyid thob pa'i rgyu yin no zhes brjod do //

original: sems can rnams kyi bya ba'i ngo bo ni bya ba byung ngo cog go //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi bya ba'i ngo bo ni bya ba byung ngo cog go //

analyzed: de'i bya ba ni byung ngo cog gi bya ba'o //

original: gzhan gyi las kyi grogs la 'gro ba zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: de dag la bdag nyid kyi nus pa dang mthun par grogs bya'o zhes bya bar ci nus ci lcogs zhes bya ba smos so //

analyzed: de lta bu'i gzhan dag gi bya ba la grogs byed pa dang lhan cig byed pas bya ba dag la 'gro ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i stobs kyi rgyur bstan te /

analyzed: da ni btung ba byin pas stobs dang ldan zhes bya ba'i mdo'i rjes su 'brangs nas rgyu gnyis pa bstan pa'i phyir /

translated: ‚ÄúProducing enthusiasm‚Äù means accomplishing those who are the cause of the activity of undertaking work.

analyzed: rgyu gsum gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /

analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i khyad par mngon par sgrub par byed pa la'o //

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /

original: yang na snga ma'i bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na snga ma'i bshad pa yin no //

original: rgyu gsum gyis sems snam par dag par rig par bya ste /üîΩrnam par smin pa la mi re @47a * //
analyzed: rgyu gsum gyis sems snam par dag par rig par bya ste / rnam par smin pa la mi re @47a * //

analyzed: bsam pa chen po dang ldan pa'i phyir drag cing ro gcig pa'i dga' ba'i shugs kyis las de dag nan tan gyis spyod do //

analyzed: de ltar rang la ltos nas sems rnam par dag pa rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: Thus, in relation to oneself, the mind is pure in two ways.

original: chos dang ldan par mtshungs pa dman pa dang 'bring dang mchog gi las de lta bu dang ldan pa mthong na las de dag la brnyas pa dang / 'gran pa dang / phrag dog gi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa mi skyed cing rjes su yi rang ba'i sgo nas mngon par dga' ba dang /
analyzed: chos dang ldan par mtshungs pa dman pa dang 'bring dang mchog gi las de lta bu dang ldan pa mthong na las de dag la brnyas pa dang / 'gran pa dang / phrag dog gi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa mi skyed cing rjes su yi rang ba'i sgo nas mngon par dga' ba dang /
translated: When one sees that others are endowed with similar virtues, but with inferior or middling or superior actions, one does not generate the secondary defilement of contempt, rivalry, or jealousy in regard to those actions. One delights in them by rejoicing in them.

original: mi nus shing stobs med na yang las de spyad cing nyams su blang ba'i dbang du byas nas yid kyi rjes su rnam par rtog cing rjes su dpyod pa las de mngon par 'dod pa ni sems rnam par dag pa'o //

analyzed: rtag tu bya ba'i sbyor ba dang / gus par bya ba'i sbyor ba'o //

analyzed: dus yun ring por goms par byed pa dang / skye ba rangs pa dang / nyin gcig pa dang / skad cig la sogs pa'i rgyun du sbyor ba dang / de dag gnyi ga la yang grims par byed pa ni gus par byed pa'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: The practice of respect is the practice for a long time, for a long life, for a day, for an instant, etc., and the practice of both of these with firmness.

analyzed: de ltar na bdag nyid kyi dbang du byas pa'i sbyor ba rnam par dag pa gsum yin no //
translated: Thus, there are three kinds of pure practice in terms of oneself.

analyzed: gzhan la brten pa'i sbyor ba rnam par dag pa rnam pa bzhi bstan pa ni /

analyzed: gzhan dag la yang yang dag par len du gzhug pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /

analyzed: las de la brtson 'grus brtsams pa'i sems can rnams yang dag par rab tu dga' ba bskyed pa'i phyir lhag par bsngags pa brjod pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The term excessive praise is used because it causes beings who are diligent in that action to generate perfect joy.

original: yang dge ba'i las de nyid la de dag rgyun mi @47b 'chad cing bar med par nges par sbyor bar byed pa dang mi 'dor ba'i sbyor ba la 'god par byed pa'o //

translated: It is the establishment of those who are not diligent in that virtuous action in the practice of uninterrupted and constant application and in the practice of non-abandonment.

original: de ltar ma zhugs pa rnams dang zhugs pa rnams dang / mi brtan par zhugs pa rnams la yang dag par len du 'jug pa dang / bsngags pa brjod pa dang / lhag par bsngags pa brjod pa dang / mi 'dor ba'i sbyor ba la 'god par byed pa bsal bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar ma zhugs pa rnams dang zhugs pa rnams dang / mi brtan par zhugs pa rnams la yang dag par len du 'jug pa dang / bsngags pa brjod pa dang / lhag par bsngags pa brjod pa dang / mi 'dor ba'i sbyor ba la 'god par byed pa bsal bar byed pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is the establishment of those who have not entered, those who have entered, and those who have entered but are unstable, in the practice of taking up, the practice of praise, the practice of excessive praise, and the practice of non-abandonment.

original: snod dang snod ma yin pa la rtog pa med do zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas nas byang chub sems dpa'i bsam pa dang sbyor ba las ma gtogs pa'i zhing gzhan ni med do //
analyzed: snod dang snod ma yin pa la rtog pa med do zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas nas byang chub sems dpa'i bsam pa dang sbyor ba las ma gtogs pa'i zhing gzhan ni med do //
translated: With regard to the statement without considering who is a suitable recipient and who is not, it is said that there is no other field than the intention and application of the bodhisattva.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /

analyzed: khyod la mngon du phyogs 'di rnams //

translated: Correct practice means practice at the proper time.

translated: The result of such correct practice is the state of giving the result when it is certain that the result will be given. This is called the pure field.

translated: Because of the similarity of the Dharma of giving the result, which is certain to be given, the bodhisattva who is established in the result and the one who is established in the result, who is the master of the result, both of them should be known as the result of evolution.

original: de bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bstan pa'i phyir /

translated: Each method is able to accomplish the benefit and happiness of immeasurable beings. This is called ‚Äúability‚Äù and ‚Äúcapacity.‚Äù

original: yang na lus dang sems kyi stobs dang ldan pa ni nus shing lcogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na lus dang sems kyi stobs dang ldan pa ni nus shing lcogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Or else, the one who is endowed with the power of body and mind is said to be ‚Äúable‚Äù and ‚Äúcapable.‚Äù

original: rnam par smin pa brgyad po 'di dag gi stobs kyis ji ltar rigs par 'dul bar bya ba de dag la rjes su mthun par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa brgyad po 'di dag gi stobs kyis ji ltar rigs par 'dul bar bya ba de dag la rjes su mthun par 'gyur ro //
translated: By the power of these eight fruitions, he becomes suitable for the disciples to be tamed as appropriate.

original: ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du bya ba dag la bsgo ba nyan par 'gyur ba yang ji skad bstan pa'i rjes su bstan pa'i sbyor ba dang ldan pa las ji lta ba bzhin du byed pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du bya ba dag la bsgo ba nyan par 'gyur ba yang ji skad bstan pa'i rjes su bstan pa'i sbyor ba dang ldan pa las ji lta ba bzhin du byed pa'o //
translated: He becomes one who listens to the advice to do as he wishes, because he is endowed with the application of following the instructions as taught.

original: de'i phyir rang gi don bya ba yan chad la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gi don bya ba yan chad la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚Äúfrom the performance of one‚Äôs own aim and so on.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir 'di gnyis las gang yang rung ba cig ma tshang na yang mi 'grub par bstan pa'i phyir ;
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di gnyis las gang yang rung ba cig ma tshang na yang mi 'grub par bstan pa'i phyir ;
translated: Therefore, in order to show that if either of these two is incomplete, it is not accomplished,

original: don che ba yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni don rnam pa sna tshogs pa mang po byed mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: don che ba yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni don rnam pa sna tshogs pa mang po byed mi nus pa'o //
translated: it is said, ‚Äúgreat aim‚Äù and so on. It is not able to perform many different kinds of aims.

original: don khyad par can byed pa med pa'i phyir mthun pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: don khyad par can byed pa med pa'i phyir mthun pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is not suitable because it does not perform a special aim.

original: ji ltar ji ltar gzhan gyi don la 'bad pa chung ba de lta de ltar gzhan gyi don yongs su rdzogs par byed mi nus so zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar ji ltar gzhan gyi don la 'bad pa chung ba de lta de ltar gzhan gyi don yongs su rdzogs par byed mi nus so zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the more one's effort for the sake of others is small, the more one is unable to perfect the welfare of others,

original: des na des gzhan gyi don byed mi nus so zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des na des gzhan gyi don byed mi nus so zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: he says, Therefore, he is unable to accomplish the welfare of others.

original: bdag nyid nus pa dang bral bas ni gzhan gyi don bya ba la don chen por mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir bdag nyid kyis mi dus shing mi lcogs la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: bdag nyid nus pa dang bral bas ni gzhan gyi don bya ba la don chen por mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir bdag nyid kyis mi dus shing mi lcogs la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In order to demonstrate that one who is devoid of ability does not become greatly involved in the welfare of others, he says, He is not able to do what is to be done for the sake of others.

original: de lta na yang gzhan gyi don yongs su rdzogs par bya bar mi nus pas gnyi ga'i yan lag tshogs na gnyi ga'i don 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta na yang gzhan gyi don yongs su rdzogs par bya bar mi nus pas gnyi ga'i yan lag tshogs na gnyi ga'i don 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that even so, one is unable to perfect the welfare of others, and that when the two factors are assembled, the welfare of both is accomplished, he says,

original: de ltar gyur na byang chub sems dpa' des zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de ltar gyur na byang chub sems dpa' des zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In that case, the Bodhisattva...

original: bdag nyid kyang nus shing lcogs par gyur /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyang nus shing lcogs par gyur /
translated: He is able and ready himself means that he is able and ready to accomplish the welfare of others.

original: sems can rnams kyang bsgo ba bzhin du nyan par gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyang bsgo ba bzhin du nyan par gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: and sentient beings listen to his instructions.

original: bdag nyid nus pa dang ldan pas ni sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams yongs su smin par byed la /
analyzed: bdag nyid nus pa dang ldan pas ni sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams yongs su smin par byed la /
translated: By being able to do this, he brings the qualities of a Buddha to maturity.

original: sems can rnams bsgo ba bzhin nyan pas ni theg pa gsum la myur du yongs su smin par byed de /üîΩsangs rgyas @50a * //
analyzed: sems can rnams bsgo ba bzhin nyan pas ni theg pa gsum la myur du yongs su smin par byed de / sangs rgyas @50a * //
translated: By causing sentient beings to listen to his instructions, he brings them to maturity in the three vehicles.üîΩWhen the qualities of a Buddha have matured,

original: kyi chos rnams myur du yongs su smin par gyur pa la ni rang nyid bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kyi chos rnams myur du yongs su smin par gyur pa la ni rang nyid bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par 'gyur ro //
translated: he himself becomes fully enlightened in unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: sems can yongs su smin par gyur pa las ni rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par gyur pa las ni rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When sentient beings have matured, he becomes liberated.

original: de lta bas na rnam pa 'di dag gis rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu rnam pa brgyad kyis sems can rnams la phan pa dang bde ba yang dag par sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: de lta bas na rnam pa 'di dag gis rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu rnam pa brgyad kyis sems can rnams la phan pa dang bde ba yang dag par sgrub par byed do //
translated: Thus, by these eight kinds of results of evolution, he accomplishes the benefit and happiness of sentient beings.

original: de'i phyir na sems can rnams 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor ba na 'khor ba'i tshe sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang phrad par gyur na phan pa thob pa 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i phyir na sems can rnams 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor ba na 'khor ba'i tshe sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang phrad par gyur na phan pa thob pa 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, when sentient beings are revolving in the five courses of existence, if they encounter the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas, they will obtain benefit.

original: bde ba dang phrad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bde ba dang phrad par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will encounter happiness.

original: de lta bas na 'khor ba 'bras bu dang bcas par 'gyur /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'khor ba 'bras bu dang bcas par 'gyur /
translated: Thus, the cycle of existence will have a result.

original: don dang bcas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don dang bcas par 'gyur ro //
translated: It will have a purpose.

original: de dang bral bar gyur na 'bras bu med par 'gyur /
analyzed: de dang bral bar gyur na 'bras bu med par 'gyur /
translated: If they are separated from them, it will be without result.

original: don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: It will be purposeless.

original: bsod nams dang ye shes bstan pas bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi 'bras bu yang bstan par nus pas /
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes bstan pas bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi 'bras bu yang bstan par nus pas /
translated: Since the result of merit and knowledge is also able to be shown by the teaching of merit and knowledge,

original: de la bsod nams ni gang yin /
analyzed: de la bsod nams ni gang yin /
translated: what is merit?

original: ye shes ni gang yin zhes bya ba smras so //üîΩpha rol tu phyin pa gsum ste zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid rnam par gzhag pa'i dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes ni gang yin zhes bya ba smras so // pha rol tu phyin pa gsum ste zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid rnam par gzhag pa'i dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: What is knowledge?üîΩThree perfections are merit, three are knowledge, and one is both.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa gsum gyi ngo bo ni bsod nams zhes brjod de /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa gsum gyi ngo bo ni bsod nams zhes brjod de /
translated: The essence of the three perfections is said to be merit.

original: dngos po nyid dang / 'bras bu nyid kyis so //
analyzed: dngos po nyid dang / 'bras bu nyid kyis so //
translated: by the very nature of the entity and by the very nature of the result.

original: dngos po nyid ni bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po gsum zhes bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dngos po nyid ni bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po gsum zhes bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: The very nature of the entity is taught by the three entities of merit.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams so //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams so //
translated: The perfection of giving is merit that arises from giving.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni tshul khrims las byung ba'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni tshul khrims las byung ba'o //
translated: The perfection of morality is that which arises from morality.

original: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni bsgoms pa las byung ba'i bsod nams so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni bsgoms pa las byung ba'i bsod nams so zhes bya ba la /
translated: The perfection of patience is merit that arises from meditation.

original: bzod pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: bzod pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Patience is also of two kinds:

original: so sor brtags pa'i stobs kyis yang dag par bsdus pa dang / bsgom pa'i stobs kyis bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: so sor brtags pa'i stobs kyis yang dag par bsdus pa dang / bsgom pa'i stobs kyis bsdus pa'o //
translated: that which is included by the power of analysis and that which is included by the power of meditation.

original: bsgom pa'i stobs kyis bsdus pa ni byams pa bsgom pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i stobs kyis bsdus pa ni byams pa bsgom pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
translated: That which is included by the power of meditation is the essence of the meditation on love.

original: gnod sems spangs pas bzod pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur bas gnod sems spangs pa ni byams pa bsgom pa yin no zhes byas nas so //
analyzed: gnod sems spangs pas bzod pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur bas gnod sems spangs pa ni byams pa bsgom pa yin no zhes byas nas so //
translated: Since the perfection of patience is completed by abandoning malice, the meditation on love is the abandonment of malice.

original: de lta bu ni re zhig dngos po nyid do //
analyzed: de lta bu ni re zhig dngos po nyid do //
translated: Such is the nature of things.

original: 'bras bu nyid ni rang gi rgyud kyi longs spyod dang / bdag gi dngos po dang / 'khor gyi 'bras bu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu nyid ni rang gi rgyud kyi longs spyod dang / bdag gi dngos po dang / 'khor gyi 'bras bu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The result is the result of one's own continuum, of one's own self, and of one's own retinue.

original: ye shes dang shes rab ni don gcig pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang @50b bzhin nyid ye shes so //
analyzed: ye shes dang shes rab ni don gcig pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang @50b bzhin nyid ye shes so //
translated: Since wisdom and knowledge are synonymous, knowledge is the nature of the perfection of wisdom.

original: rab tu shes pa'i phyir shes rab ste /
analyzed: rab tu shes pa'i phyir shes rab ste /
translated: Wisdom is for the sake of understanding.

original: ji lta ba bzhin du nges par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du nges par rtogs pa'o //
translated: It is the realization of things as they are.

original: ye shes ni the tshom gyi gnyen po'i phyogs su gyur pa'am /
analyzed: ye shes ni the tshom gyi gnyen po'i phyogs su gyur pa'am /
translated: Knowledge is the antidote to doubt,

original: yang dag par gtan la 'bebs pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag par gtan la 'bebs pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: or it has the nature of correct ascertainment.

original: bsod nams dang ye shes dang rjes su mthun pas de dag gi rnam par gzhag pa bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes dang rjes su mthun pas de dag gi rnam par gzhag pa bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to show the arrangement of merit and knowledge in accordance with that, he said:

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The perfection of effort, etc.

original: yang na byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi tshogs ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: yang na byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi tshogs ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Or else, the accumulations of the bodhisattvas are of two kinds:

original: bsod nams kyi tshogs dang / ye shes kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: bsod nams kyi tshogs dang / ye shes kyi tshogs so //
translated: the accumulation of merit and the accumulation of direct intuition.

original: des na pha rol tu phyin pa drug po nyid byang chub kyi tshogs su rnam par gzhag go zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: des na pha rol tu phyin pa drug po nyid byang chub kyi tshogs su rnam par gzhag go zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Thus, the six perfections are respectively determined as the accumulation of enlightenment.

original: gal te pha rol tu phyin pa gsum ni bsod nams kyi tshogs su 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te pha rol tu phyin pa gsum ni bsod nams kyi tshogs su 'gyur la /
translated: If three perfections are the accumulation of merit,

original: gcig ni ye shes kyi tshogs su gzhag na /
analyzed: gcig ni ye shes kyi tshogs su gzhag na /
translated: and one is determined as the accumulation of direct intuition,

original: de ltar na pha rol tu phyin pa gnyis gang gi khongs su 'du bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar na pha rol tu phyin pa gnyis gang gi khongs su 'du bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: then in that case, in which of these two are the two perfections included?

original: smras pa / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: smras pa / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: He says: the perfection of effort, etc.

original: yang brtson 'grus ni dge ba'i sa chen po ba ste /
analyzed: yang brtson 'grus ni dge ba'i sa chen po ba ste /
translated: Moreover, effort is the great ground of the wholesome,

original: thams cad du brtson 'grus med na dge ba mi 'byung ba nyid de /
analyzed: thams cad du brtson 'grus med na dge ba mi 'byung ba nyid de /
translated: because in all cases, if there is no effort, the wholesome does not arise,

original: dge ba la sems spro ba ni brtson 'grus so zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba la sems spro ba ni brtson 'grus so zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: for it is taught that effort is the mental exertion in the wholesome.

original: yang na brtson 'grus ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad kyi gnyen por gyur pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang na brtson 'grus ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad kyi gnyen por gyur pa'i phyir /
translated: Or else, since effort is the antidote to all the counteragents to the perfections,

original: brtson 'grus ni pha rol tu phyin pa lnga'i rjes su 'jug par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: brtson 'grus ni pha rol tu phyin pa lnga'i rjes su 'jug par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: effort is the forerunner of the five perfections.

original: mdo'i rjes su 'brangs nas kyang 'di dag rnam par gzhag par bye ste /
analyzed: mdo'i rjes su 'brangs nas kyang 'di dag rnam par gzhag par bye ste /
translated: They are also established in accordance with the sutras.

original: mdo sde las bstan pa /
analyzed: mdo sde las bstan pa /
translated: The sutra teaches:

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa gtong ba na pha rol tu phyin pa drug bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa gtong ba na pha rol tu phyin pa drug bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te zhes bya ba nas /
translated: When the bodhisattva practices generosity, the cultivation of the six perfections is completed.

original: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa'i bar du'o //
translated: In the same way, up to the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom.

original: de'i phyir thams cad la pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad yod pa nyid du mtshon par byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir thams cad la pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad yod pa nyid du mtshon par byed pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, it is shown that all of them have all the perfections.

original: de ltar na yang ngo bo nyid dang rjes su mthun pa'i dbang du byas nas bsod nams dang ye shes su rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na yang ngo bo nyid dang rjes su mthun pa'i dbang du byas nas bsod nams dang ye shes su rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: However, in accordance with their essential natures, they should be understood as being established as merit and wisdom.

original: de'i phyir brtson 'grus la brten nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de'i phyir brtson 'grus la brten nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚Äúbased on effort, etc.‚Äù

original: tshul khrims yang dag par len pa ni sdom pa yang dag par len pa'i dus su'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims yang dag par len pa ni sdom pa yang dag par len pa'i dus su'o //
translated: The taking up of morality is at the time of taking up the vow.

original: bsrung ba ni de'i rjes la yan lag lnga bag yod pas bsdus pa yongs su sbyor ba'o /
analyzed: bsrung ba ni de'i rjes la yan lag lnga bag yod pas bsdus pa yongs su sbyor ba'o /
translated: The guarding is the subsequent thorough application of the five branches included in heedfulness.

original: byams pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni @51a * //üîΩtshad med pa rnams bsgom pas ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: byams pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni @51a * // tshad med pa rnams bsgom pas ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te /
translated: The cultivation of love, etc.

original: gnod sems dang / rnam par 'tshe ba dang / phrag dog dang / zhe sdang gi gnyen po ni tshad med pa rnams yin la /
analyzed: gnod sems dang / rnam par 'tshe ba dang / phrag dog dang / zhe sdang gi gnyen po ni tshad med pa rnams yin la /
translated: is the perfection of patience, because the immeasurables are the antidote to malice, violence, envy, and hatred,

original: bzod pa yang de dag gi gnyen por gyur pa nyid yin pas so /
analyzed: bzod pa yang de dag gi gnyen por gyur pa nyid yin pas so /
translated: and patience is just the antidote to those.

original: / brtson 'grus la brten nas ye shes ma skyes pa ni skye bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: / brtson 'grus la brten nas ye shes ma skyes pa ni skye bar 'gyur la /
translated: Based on effort, the wisdom that has not arisen arises,

original: skyes pa rnams ni 'phel zhing rgyas pa dang / yangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyes pa rnams ni 'phel zhing rgyas pa dang / yangs par 'gyur ro //
translated: and that which has arisen increases, expands, and extends.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: brtson 'grus la brten nas thos pa dang / bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: brtson 'grus la brten nas thos pa dang / bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Based on effort, there is what is called arisen from hearing, reflection, and meditation, and so on.

original: thos pas bzung nas bsams shing sgom par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: thos pas bzung nas bsams shing sgom par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Having grasped through hearing, one reflects and meditates - this is the meaning.

original: de ltar thos pa la sogs pa'i sbyor bas thos pa'i shes rab kyis phung po la sogs pa la nye bar rtogs par byed do zhes bya ba smras pa /
analyzed: de ltar thos pa la sogs pa'i sbyor bas thos pa'i shes rab kyis phung po la sogs pa la nye bar rtogs par byed do zhes bya ba smras pa /
translated: Thus, through the application of hearing and so on, one comprehends the aggregates and so on through the wisdom of hearing, as stated.

original: phung po la mkhas pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: phung po la mkhas pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: Skilled in the aggregates and so on.

original: de ltar re zhig ye shes la mkhas pa'i dbang du byas nas bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig ye shes la mkhas pa'i dbang du byas nas bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having explained in terms of the mastery of wisdom,

original: bden pa rnam par 'byed pa la mkhas pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
analyzed: bden pa rnam par 'byed pa la mkhas pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
translated: in terms of the mastery of discerning the truths, it is said:

original: sdug bsngal la ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Regarding suffering and so on.

original: chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa la mkhas pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa la mkhas pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: In terms of the mastery of discerning phenomena,

original: dge ba'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: it is said: Virtuous and so on.

original: yang bsam gtan ni rnam par g-yeng ba med pa /
analyzed: yang bsam gtan ni rnam par g-yeng ba med pa /
translated: Moreover, concentration is non-distraction,

original: sems rtse gcig pa yang dag par nye bar gtod pa'o //
analyzed: sems rtse gcig pa yang dag par nye bar gtod pa'o //
translated: It is the one-pointedness of mind that is correctly applied.

original: de'i phyir sems rnam par g-yengs pa rnams kyis dge ba la sbyor bar mi nus pas dge ba thams cad la bsam gtan dang ldan no zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir sems rnam par g-yengs pa rnams kyis dge ba la sbyor bar mi nus pas dge ba thams cad la bsam gtan dang ldan no zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore, since those whose minds are distracted are unable to apply themselves to virtue, it is said in order to demonstrate that all virtue is endowed with meditative concentration:üîΩ‚ÄúBased on meditative concentration, etc.‚Äù

original: bsam gtan la brten nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o /üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan la brten nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o / zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: etc.

original: rnam pa drug yod do zhes bya ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: rnam pa drug yod do zhes bya ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi mtshan nyid can no //
translated: It has six aspects, i.e., it has the characteristic of the six perfections.

original: yang na bsod nams dang bsod nams kyi phyogs brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan zhes bya ba dang rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: yang na bsod nams dang bsod nams kyi phyogs brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan zhes bya ba dang rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: Alternatively, it has three aspects: merit, the side of merit, and effort and meditative concentration.

original: ye shes dang ye shes kyi phyogs brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan zhes bya ba dang rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: ye shes dang ye shes kyi phyogs brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan zhes bya ba dang rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: It has three aspects: direct intuition, the side of direct intuition, and effort and meditative concentration.

original: de re re'i rnam par dbye ba ni tshad med par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'i dngos po dpag tu med pa'i sgo nas zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de re re'i rnam par dbye ba ni tshad med par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'i dngos po dpag tu med pa'i sgo nas zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It should be understood that the analysis of each of these is immeasurable, because they are engaged in through immeasurable things such as generosity.

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi mtshungs pa'i rgyu khas blangs nas dris pa ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi rgyu gang zhe na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi mtshungs pa'i rgyu khas blangs nas dris pa ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi rgyu gang zhe na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Having accepted the cause of merit and knowledge, he asks: What is the cause of merit and knowledge?üîΩThe reply is: In brief, it should be understood that there are three causes.

original: lan yang dus gcig tu @51b btab pa ni mdor bsdu na gsum yod par rig par bya ste zhes bya ba la rgyu dang rkyen bsdoms nas rgyu zhes rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: lan yang dus gcig tu @51b btab pa ni mdor bsdu na gsum yod par rig par bya ste zhes bya ba la rgyu dang rkyen bsdoms nas rgyu zhes rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The cause is established by combining the causes and conditions.

original: 'das pa dang da ltar gyi tshe'i rkyen gyi dbang du byas nas rgyu zhes bya bar bstan te /
analyzed: 'das pa dang da ltar gyi tshe'i rkyen gyi dbang du byas nas rgyu zhes bya bar bstan te /
translated: The cause is taught from the perspective of the conditions of past and present life.

original: mdor bsdu na dge ba'i chos skye bar byed pa ni bzhi yin te /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na dge ba'i chos skye bar byed pa ni bzhi yin te /
translated: In brief, there are four that produce virtuous dharmas.

original: skyes bu dam pa la brten pa dang / dam ba'i chos nyan pa dang / de la tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang / skye ba snga ma'i dus su spyad pa dang bzhi ni rgyu gnyis su rnam par gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa la brten pa dang / dam ba'i chos nyan pa dang / de la tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang / skye ba snga ma'i dus su spyad pa dang bzhi ni rgyu gnyis su rnam par gzhag par bya'o //
translated: The four causes that are not included in the above are: association with holy people, hearing the true Dharma, proper attention, and practice in previous lives.

original: 'di dag tu ma gtogs pa ni dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa ste chos thams cad kyi rtsa ba ni 'dun pa yin pa'i phyir rgyu khyad par du 'phags pa'i mtshan nyid can rnams kyi nang nas dang po'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag tu ma gtogs pa ni dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa ste chos thams cad kyi rtsa ba ni 'dun pa yin pa'i phyir rgyu khyad par du 'phags pa'i mtshan nyid can rnams kyi nang nas dang po'i rgyu yin no //
translated: The cause that is not included in the above is aspiration for virtuous qualities, because aspiration is the root of all virtuous qualities. It is the first cause of those who have the special characteristics of causes.

original: yang 'dun pa de ni rnam pa gsum ste /üîΩma thob pa thob par bya ba'i phyir smras pa ni /
analyzed: yang 'dun pa de ni rnam pa gsum ste / ma thob pa thob par bya ba'i phyir smras pa ni /
translated: Moreover, that aspiration is threefold:

original: 'thob pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'thob pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Aspiration for attainment is the aspiration for the attainment of what has not been attained.üîΩAspiration for stability is the aspiration for the stability of what has been attained.

original: thob par gyur pa rnams mi nyams pa'i sbyor ba la gnas pa ni gang yang gnas pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: thob par gyur pa rnams mi nyams pa'i sbyor ba la gnas pa ni gang yang gnas pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Aspiration for non-decline is the aspiration for the non-decline of what has been stabilized.

original: gnas pa rnams gong nas gong du 'phel ba dang rgyas par 'gyur ba dang / 'dun pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang po ste /
analyzed: gnas pa rnams gong nas gong du 'phel ba dang rgyas par 'gyur ba dang / 'dun pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang po ste /
translated: The first cause is called aspiration.

original: yang dag pa'i spong ba tha ma'i rjes su 'brangs nas shes par bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i spong ba tha ma'i rjes su 'brangs nas shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood as following the last of the right efforts.

original: mthun la zhes bya ba'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mthun la zhes bya ba'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To show the meaning of ‚Äúfavorable,‚Äù

original: mi mthun pa med pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: mi mthun pa med pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: he says, ‚Äúwithout resistance.‚Äù

original: skye ba gzhan dag tu goms par byas pas ni rgyu nye bar bsags par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skye ba gzhan dag tu goms par byas pas ni rgyu nye bar bsags par 'gyur ro //
translated: By cultivating it in other lives, one accumulates the cause.

original: rgyu nye bar bsags pa dang ldan pa ni bsod nams dang ye shes skyed par byed kyi ma bskyed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu nye bar bsags pa dang ldan pa ni bsod nams dang ye shes skyed par byed kyi ma bskyed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: One who possesses the accumulation of the cause generates merit and knowledge, but not one who does not.

original: de'i phyir sngon yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir sngon yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Therefore he says, ‚Äúpreviously also,‚Äù and so on.

original: de la mi mthun pa med pa'i rkyen ni dngos po med pa dang / dngos po dang ldan pa rnam pa gnyis su bstan pa'i phyir dngos po kha cig mngon du ma gyur pas mi mthun pa med pa yin la /
analyzed: de la mi mthun pa med pa'i rkyen ni dngos po med pa dang / dngos po dang ldan pa rnam pa gnyis su bstan pa'i phyir dngos po kha cig mngon du ma gyur pas mi mthun pa med pa yin la /
translated: Therein, the condition of ‚Äúwithout resistance‚Äù is shown to be twofold: the absence of an entity and the presence of an entity.

original: dngos po kha cig mngon du gyur pa dang ldan pas mi mthun pa med pa ste /
analyzed: dngos po kha cig mngon du gyur pa dang ldan pas mi mthun pa med pa ste /
translated: Some things are not incompatible with the presence of something else.üîΩThings arise when they are not incompatible with the presence of causes that do not obstruct them and are compatible with the presence of causes that do not obstruct them.

original: bar du gcod pa'i rgyu med cing bar chad ma yin pa'i rgyu dang ldan pas dngos po rnams skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bas gnyi ga yang mi mthun pa med pa'i rkyen du bstan pa yin no //üîΩphyin ci log mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'gal ba dag bsod nams dang ye shes ma yin pa skye ba'i mthun pa yin pa de dag ni bsod nams dang ye shes la phyin ci log tu gyur pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bar du gcod pa'i rgyu med cing bar chad ma yin pa'i rgyu dang ldan pas dngos po rnams skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bas gnyi ga yang mi mthun pa med pa'i rkyen du bstan pa yin no // phyin ci log mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'gal ba dag bsod nams dang ye shes ma yin pa skye ba'i mthun pa yin pa de dag ni bsod nams dang ye shes la phyin ci log tu gyur pa'i phyir /
translated: Both of these are taught as conditions that are not incompatible.üîΩThe conditions that are incompatible with the opposite are compatible with the arising of nonmeritorious and nonvirtuous action.

original: phyin ci log gi rkyen zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log gi rkyen zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called conditions that are incompatible with the opposite because they are incompatible with meritorious and virtuous action.

original: des na smras pa /üîΩnye bar mi gnas shing zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: des na smras pa / nye bar mi gnas shing zhes bya ba la /
translated: Therefore, it was said:üîΩ‚ÄúThey do not remain present.‚Äù

original: nye bar mi gnas pa ni nye bar ma gyur pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar mi gnas pa ni nye bar ma gyur pa'o //
translated: They do not remain present means they are not present.

original: @52a * // nye bar ma gyur pa nyid de nye bar ma gyur pas na phyin ci ma log pa'i rkyen ni nye bar gnas pas bsod nams dang ye shes skye ba la rjes su mthun pa yin no //
analyzed: @52a * // nye bar ma gyur pa nyid de nye bar ma gyur pas na phyin ci ma log pa'i rkyen ni nye bar gnas pas bsod nams dang ye shes skye ba la rjes su mthun pa yin no //
translated: Since it is not proximate, the condition of non-error is not proximate. Since it is not proximate, it is conducive to the arising of merit and wisdom.

original: phyin ci log gi rkyen bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: phyin ci log gi rkyen bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the condition of error, he says:

original: sdig pa'i grogs po zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sdig pa'i grogs po zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚Äúevil friends‚Äù and so on.

original: sngar bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya ba'am /
analyzed: sngar bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya ba'am /
translated: One should understand this according to what was explained earlier,

original: sdig pa'i grogs po ni rnam pa bzhi ste zhes bya ba'i mdo'i rjes su 'brangs nas shes par bya'o //
analyzed: sdig pa'i grogs po ni rnam pa bzhi ste zhes bya ba'i mdo'i rjes su 'brangs nas shes par bya'o //
translated: or according to the sutra that states: ‚ÄúEvil friends are of four types.‚Äù

original: phyin ci log tu bstan pa ni 'jig rten 'phel bar byed pa dag gi bstan bcos kyi rjes su 'brangs nas shes par bya ste /
analyzed: phyin ci log tu bstan pa ni 'jig rten 'phel bar byed pa dag gi bstan bcos kyi rjes su 'brangs nas shes par bya ste /
translated: The teaching on error should be understood according to the treatises of the Lokayatas,

original: byol song 'ching ba la sogs pa ni bsod nams rab tu 'phel ba'i rgyur rnam par 'jog par byed la /
analyzed: byol song 'ching ba la sogs pa ni bsod nams rab tu 'phel ba'i rgyur rnam par 'jog par byed la /
translated: who posit animal sacrifice and so on as causes for the increase of merit.

original: de'i bcings pa bkrol na bsod nams ma yin par rnam par 'jog par byed pa dang / nyan thos kyi bslab pa phyogs gcig pa'i rjes su 'brangs ba dag kyang byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa las phyin ci log tu ston par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i bcings pa bkrol na bsod nams ma yin par rnam par 'jog par byed pa dang / nyan thos kyi bslab pa phyogs gcig pa'i rjes su 'brangs ba dag kyang byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa las phyin ci log tu ston par byed pa yin te /
translated: And those who follow the ≈õrƒÅvaka training in a one-sided way also teach in a way that is contrary to the bodhisattva training.

original: sa le sbram dang ; dngul la sogs pa ma blangs na bsod nams 'phel bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: sa le sbram dang ; dngul la sogs pa ma blangs na bsod nams 'phel bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is said that merit increases if one does not accept gold, silver, and so on.

original: mu stegs kyi bstan bcos kyi rjes su 'brangs nas ye shes phyin ci log tu bstan pas /
analyzed: mu stegs kyi bstan bcos kyi rjes su 'brangs nas ye shes phyin ci log tu bstan pas /
translated: Following the treatises of the tƒ´rthikas, they teach a distorted wisdom.

original: mi shes pa dang the tshom dang 'chal pa'i shes pas bslab pa rab tu thob cing ldan par 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: mi shes pa dang the tshom dang 'chal pa'i shes pas bslab pa rab tu thob cing ldan par 'gyur ro ;
translated: Thus, through ignorance, doubt, and wrong understanding, they obtain and possess the training.

original: / chos 'di pa kha cig kyang chos rnams phyin ci log gi mtshan nyid du rnam par 'jog cing phyin ci log gi mtshan nyid du 'dzin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: / chos 'di pa kha cig kyang chos rnams phyin ci log gi mtshan nyid du rnam par 'jog cing phyin ci log gi mtshan nyid du 'dzin par 'gyur te /
translated: Some Buddhists also posit the characteristics of phenomena in a distorted way and grasp them in a distorted way.

original: de bzhin du log par nges par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du log par nges par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, they become wrongly ascertained.

original: bsod nams dang ye shes thob pa dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes thob pa dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: The attainment of merit and knowledge meansüîΩthat even though it is not the condition for the arising of non-virtuous dharmas, there are other opposing conditions.

original: mi dge ba'i chos skye ba'i rkyen ma yin na yang 'gal ba'i rkyen gzhan dag kyang yod do zhes bstan pa nyid ni de yang sngar gyi lus dang sems g-yo bar byed pa ji ltar nyan thos kyi sa las bstan pa lta bu rnams so //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i chos skye ba'i rkyen ma yin na yang 'gal ba'i rkyen gzhan dag kyang yod do zhes bstan pa nyid ni de yang sngar gyi lus dang sems g-yo bar byed pa ji ltar nyan thos kyi sa las bstan pa lta bu rnams so //
translated: The statement there are other opposing conditions is just like the explanation in the ≈örƒÅvaka Levels about how to move the body and mind.

original: rgyu gsum po 'di dag ma lus pa ma tshang ba med pa nyid bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyi rgyur 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu gsum po 'di dag ma lus pa ma tshang ba med pa nyid bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyi rgyur 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that these three causes are the cause for the accumulation of merit and knowledge without exception,

original: rgyu gsum po 'di dag las zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu gsum po 'di dag las zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: it says, From these three causes... and so on.

original: de la bsod nams kyi 'bras bu ni rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu nyid dang / de la yang dag par brten pa'i sems can gyi don bya bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la bsod nams kyi 'bras bu ni rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu nyid dang / de la yang dag par brten pa'i sems can gyi don bya bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Among them, the result of merit is the result of karmic maturation and the benefit of sentient beings who rely on it should be known.

original: ye shes kyi 'bras bu ni ye shes kyi rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bur rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi 'bras bu ni ye shes kyi rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bur rig par bya'o //
translated: The result of knowledge is the result of natural outflow of knowledge.

original: gnod pa med par zhes bya ba @52b ni rjes su mi mthun pa med pa ste /
analyzed: gnod pa med par zhes bya ba @52b ni rjes su mi mthun pa med pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúWithout harm‚Äù means without opposition.

original: sdug bsngal gyi gnod pa med pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi gnod pa med pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: without the harm of suffering.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: sdug bsngal dag gis shin tu gzir ba med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dag gis shin tu gzir ba med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: ‚ÄúNot at all oppressed by suffering.‚Äù

original: bsod nams kyis bsdus pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gsum dang ldan pas rnam par smin pa'i longs spyod dang ; bdag gi dngos po dang / 'khor phun sum tshogs par longs spyod kyis rgud pa'i sdug bsngal dang / bdag gi dngos pos rgud pa'i sdug bsngal dang /
analyzed: bsod nams kyis bsdus pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gsum dang ldan pas rnam par smin pa'i longs spyod dang ; bdag gi dngos po dang / 'khor phun sum tshogs par longs spyod kyis rgud pa'i sdug bsngal dang / bdag gi dngos pos rgud pa'i sdug bsngal dang /
translated: Endowed with the three perfections included in merit, one enjoys the perfection of resources, the perfection of one‚Äôs person, and the perfection of retinue. One is not harmed by the suffering of the loss of resources, the suffering of the loss of one‚Äôs person, and the suffering of the loss of retinue.

original: 'khor gyis phongs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi gnod pa med par 'khor ba na 'khor ba'i longs spyod chen po la brten nas sems can gyi don bya bar nus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'khor gyis phongs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi gnod pa med par 'khor ba na 'khor ba'i longs spyod chen po la brten nas sems can gyi don bya bar nus par 'gyur ro //
translated: In cyclic existence, one is able to work for the benefit of beings by relying on great resources.

original: bdag gi dngos po'i rnam par smin pa la brten nas bsdu ba'i dngos po gzhan gsum gyis sems can gyi don byed par nus so //
analyzed: bdag gi dngos po'i rnam par smin pa la brten nas bsdu ba'i dngos po gzhan gsum gyis sems can gyi don byed par nus so //
translated: One is able to benefit sentient beings by means of the other three social practices, which are based on the maturation of one's own substance.

original: de ltar bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud la brten nas bsod nams kyi 'bras bu rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: de ltar bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud la brten nas bsod nams kyi 'bras bu rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: Thus, there are two kinds of meritorious results, based on one's own and others' mental continuum.

original: ye shes la brten nas ni phyin ci ma log pa dang rgya che ba'i bsod nams byed pa dang / nye bar sogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ye shes la brten nas ni phyin ci ma log pa dang rgya che ba'i bsod nams byed pa dang / nye bar sogs par 'gyur te /
translated: But, based on intuition, one's merit becomes unerring and extensive, and one becomes fit for the accumulations.

original: dge ba'i chos rnams kyi sngon du 'gro ba ni rigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos rnams kyi sngon du 'gro ba ni rigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For, reason is the forerunner of all virtuous things.

original: ye shes kyis ni shes bya'i rnam pa thams cad rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi sbyor ba goms par byas pas rgyud khyad par du 'phags pa'i ye shes kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub rtog par 'gyur ba'i 'bras
analyzed: ye shes kyis ni shes bya'i rnam pa thams cad rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi sbyor ba goms par byas pas rgyud khyad par du 'phags pa'i ye shes kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub rtog par 'gyur ba'i 'bras
translated: And, by the cultivation of the practice which is characterized by the full discernment of all the aspects of the knowable, one's mental continuum becomes exalted, and one's intuition becomes the cause for the result which is the realization of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: bur rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bur rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that this is the result.

original: de ltar na bsod nams kyi rnam pa gnyis dang / ye shes kyi rnam pa gnyis kyis rnam pa bzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na bsod nams kyi rnam pa gnyis dang / ye shes kyi rnam pa gnyis kyis rnam pa bzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, there are four aspects: two aspects of merit and two aspects of wisdom.

original: khongs su gtogs pa rnams kyi dbye ba ni dpag tu med do //
analyzed: khongs su gtogs pa rnams kyi dbye ba ni dpag tu med do //
translated: The classification of the included is immeasurable.

original: rnam par smin pa dang / de'i rgyu dang / de'i 'bras bu las bsod nams dang ye shes dag gis byed pa'i gtso bo nyid du gyur pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs par byang chub par 'gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa dang / de'i rgyu dang / de'i 'bras bu las bsod nams dang ye shes dag gis byed pa'i gtso bo nyid du gyur pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs par byang chub par 'gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the unsurpassed perfect enlightenment is due to the pre-eminence of merit and wisdom in terms of the maturation, its cause and its result, he says:

original: de la rnam par smin pa'i rgyu gang yin pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de la rnam par smin pa'i rgyu gang yin pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Therein, that which is the cause of the maturation...

original: de'i phyir de dag kyang tshogs su rnam par gzhag par bya ba nyid do //üîΩbsod nams la brten cing bsod nams las byung ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag kyang tshogs su rnam par gzhag par bya ba nyid do // bsod nams la brten cing bsod nams las byung ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Consequently, they are also to be determined as the accumulations.üîΩIt is dependent on merit and arises from merit.

original: re zhig rnam par smin pa nyid ni bsod nams las byung ba'i phyir bsod nams la brten pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: re zhig rnam par smin pa nyid ni bsod nams las byung ba'i phyir bsod nams la brten pa nyid yin no //
translated: To begin with, since the maturation itself arises from merit, it is dependent on merit.

original: gnod sems med pa la sogs pa rnam par smin pa'i rgyu rnam pa brgyad @53a * //
analyzed: gnod sems med pa la sogs pa rnam par smin pa'i rgyu rnam pa brgyad @53a * //
translated: The eight causes of karmic maturation are the absence of malice and so on.üîΩ

original: kyang sngon bsod nams byed pa goms pa'i stobs la brten nas zhes byas nas bsod nams la brten pa nyid do //
analyzed: kyang sngon bsod nams byed pa goms pa'i stobs la brten nas zhes byas nas bsod nams la brten pa nyid do //
translated: The eight causes of karmic maturation, such as the absence of malice, are also based on merit, because they are based on the power of prior habituation to the performance of merit.

original: dus ring por dge ba bsags pa la sogs pa rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu yang sngon bsod nams goms par byas pa'i stobs nyid kyi rgyu mthun pa nyid kyis 'jug par 'gyur ro zhes byas nas de yang bsod nams la brten pa nyid do //
analyzed: dus ring por dge ba bsags pa la sogs pa rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu yang sngon bsod nams goms par byas pa'i stobs nyid kyi rgyu mthun pa nyid kyis 'jug par 'gyur ro zhes byas nas de yang bsod nams la brten pa nyid do //
translated: The result of karmic maturation, such as the accumulation of virtue over a long period of time, is also based on merit, because it is the natural outcome of the power of prior habituation to merit.

original: de ltar na re zhig bsod nams gtso bo yin no //üîΩbsod nams kyang ye shes la brten pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig bsod nams gtso bo yin no // bsod nams kyang ye shes la brten pa yin te /
translated: Thus merit is primary.

original: ye shes la brtan nas bsod nams yongs su rdzogs par byed do zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: ye shes la brtan nas bsod nams yongs su rdzogs par byed do zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
translated: Moreover, merit is based on wisdom, because the words ‚Äúbased on wisdom, merit is perfected‚Äù are stated.

original: de lta bas na rnam par smin pa la sogs pa chos dgu po gang yin pa de dag las 'di gnyis kho na gtso bo'i byed pa ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na rnam par smin pa la sogs pa chos dgu po gang yin pa de dag las 'di gnyis kho na gtso bo'i byed pa ste /
translated: Therefore, from among the nine dharmas, such as karmic maturation, these two are the primary agents.

original: bsod nams dang / ye shes yongs su rdzogs par byas nas /
analyzed: bsod nams dang / ye shes yongs su rdzogs par byas nas /
translated: Having perfected merit and knowledge,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'thob pa'i gzhi yin no //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'thob pa'i gzhi yin no //
translated: one attains unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: de dag las kyang ye shes gtso bo yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag las kyang ye shes gtso bo yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: And in order to show that knowledge is foremost among those,

original: bsod nams kyang de'i rgyu can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsod nams kyang de'i rgyu can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it is said that merit is also based on it.

original: rigs pa zhes bya ba ni kha na ma tho ba med pa'i las so //
analyzed: rigs pa zhes bya ba ni kha na ma tho ba med pa'i las so //
translated: Reasoned is the action that is irreproachable.üîΩThe acquisition of enjoyments through an action that is reproachable is harmful,

original: dpyas dang bcas pa'i las kyi gnas kyis longs spyod bsgrub pa ni gnod par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dpyas dang bcas pa'i las kyi gnas kyis longs spyod bsgrub pa ni gnod par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the basis for the occurrence of disease.

original: tshod zin par longs spyad par bya ste /
analyzed: tshod zin par longs spyad par bya ste /
translated: One should enjoy in moderation,

original: tshod ma zin par longs spyod pa ni tshul ma yin pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dang / nad rnams 'byung ba'i gnas yin pa'i phyir gnod par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: tshod ma zin par longs spyod pa ni tshul ma yin pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dang / nad rnams 'byung ba'i gnas yin pa'i phyir gnod par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: because enjoyment without moderation is the cause for improper behavior and is harmful, because it is the basis for the occurrence of disease.

original: de ltar re zhig bdag po'i 'bras bu so sor myong ba mthong ba'i chos kyi don nyid bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig bdag po'i 'bras bu so sor myong ba mthong ba'i chos kyi don nyid bstan nas /
translated: Thus, the experience of the dominant result has been taught in terms of the present life.

original: da ni rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu so sor myong ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu so sor myong ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate the individually experienced maturational result, he says:

original: rnam par smin par 'gyur ba'i sngon gyi las kyi rnam par smin pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnam par smin par 'gyur ba'i sngon gyi las kyi rnam par smin pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The maturation of previous karma that is to be experienced is the maturation of karma that is to be experienced.

original: rnam par smin pa las byung ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las byung ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúarisen from maturation‚Äù is the meaning of ‚Äúmaturation.‚Äù

original: mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas par bya ba nyid kyi phyir bsam gtan bsgrubs nas bsam gtan gyi sbyor bas mthong ba'i chos la bsam gtan bsgyur ba la mkhas pas /
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas par bya ba nyid kyi phyir bsam gtan bsgrubs nas bsam gtan gyi sbyor bas mthong ba'i chos la bsam gtan bsgyur ba la mkhas pas /
translated: Having accomplished the meditative absorptions for the sake of abiding in comfort in this life, through the application of meditative absorption, one becomes skilled in transforming meditative absorption in this life.

original: tshe 'di nyid la bde ba la rig par bya ba'i phyir yin gyi /
analyzed: tshe 'di nyid la bde ba la rig par bya ba'i phyir yin gyi /
translated: This is for the sake of knowing happiness in this very life.

original: tshe gzhan gyi don du ni ma yin te /
analyzed: tshe gzhan gyi don du ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not for the sake of another life,

original: bsam gtan gyis bsgyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyis bsgyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is transformed by meditative absorption.

original: bsam gtan gyi sbyor ba de ni gzhan gyi don du sbyor ba ma yin te /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi sbyor ba de ni gzhan gyi don du sbyor ba ma yin te /
translated: That application of meditative absorption is not applied for the sake of others,

original: gzhan du sbyor bar gyur na 'jig rten pha rol por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du sbyor bar gyur na 'jig rten pha rol por 'gyur ro //
translated: because if it were applied for others, it would be for the sake of another world.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa mthar thug pa rnyed par @53b gyur pa'i phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa mngon sum du mdzad pa nyid ni mthong ba'i chos kyi don nyid yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa mthar thug pa rnyed par @53b gyur pa'i phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa mngon sum du mdzad pa nyid ni mthong ba'i chos kyi don nyid yin te /
translated: The vision of the ultimate reality of the Tathagata, the direct realization of nirvana with a remainder of support, is the benefit in this life.

original: des rnam par grol ba'i bde ba rab tu bstan pa'i phyir dang / skye ba gzhan mi mnga' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des rnam par grol ba'i bde ba rab tu bstan pa'i phyir dang / skye ba gzhan mi mnga' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because he demonstrates the bliss of liberation and because he is not reborn.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa smos pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i mthong ba'i chos la mya ngan las 'das pa bsal ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa smos pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i mthong ba'i chos la mya ngan las 'das pa bsal ba'i phyir te /
translated: The mention of the Tathagata is to exclude the nirvana of the bodhisattva in this life.

original: de'i de ni pha rol du yang 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: de'i de ni pha rol du yang 'byung ba yin te /
translated: That is the benefit in the next life,

original: skye ba khyad par can gong nas gong du 'gro bar 'gyur ba 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba khyad par can gong nas gong du 'gro bar 'gyur ba 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he attains the superior, higher rebirths.üîΩThe benefit in this life is the mundane and supramundane path, the benefit in the next life is the supramundane path, because the mundane path is not attained in this life.

original: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos dang / mthong ba'i chos kyi lam dang / tshogs su gyur pas lus dang sems rjes su sdud par byed pa'i phyir mthong ba'i chos kyi don to //
analyzed: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos dang / mthong ba'i chos kyi lam dang / tshogs su gyur pas lus dang sems rjes su sdud par byed pa'i phyir mthong ba'i chos kyi don to //
translated: The benefit in this life is the benefit in this life, because it is the path of seeing.üîΩThe benefit in the next life is the benefit in the next life, because it is the path of meditation.

original: phyi mar yang skye bar gyur pa med pa'i phyir pha rol med pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phyi mar yang skye bar gyur pa med pa'i phyir pha rol med pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because there is no rebirth in the future, the meaning is that the other shore does not exist.

original: gzhan gang dag byang chub sems dpas btul ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzhan gang dag byang chub sems dpas btul ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: Others are tamed by the bodhisattva.

original: gang dag byang chub sems dpas ji skad bstan pa'i don la yang dag par sbyar ba dang / nges par yang dag par sbyar ba de dag gi mthong ba'i chos kyi don yin no //
analyzed: gang dag byang chub sems dpas ji skad bstan pa'i don la yang dag par sbyar ba dang / nges par yang dag par sbyar ba de dag gi mthong ba'i chos kyi don yin no //
translated: Those who apply themselves correctly to the meaning taught by the bodhisattva, and those who apply themselves correctly and decisively, have the meaning of the present life.

original: 'phangs shing yongs su gzung bas skye ba phyi ma la longs spyod pa'i 'bras bu ni longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'phangs shing yongs su gzung bas skye ba phyi ma la longs spyod pa'i 'bras bu ni longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The result of enjoyment in the next life that is projected and grasped is called the abundance of enjoyment.

original: de ni yang phyi ma pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ni yang phyi ma pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is also future.

original: ma 'ongs pa na rnam par smin par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa na rnam par smin par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it will ripen in the future.

original: 'dod pa'i khams smos pa ni gzhan dag na longs spyod kyi rnam par smin pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams smos pa ni gzhan dag na longs spyod kyi rnam par smin pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mention of the desire realm is because there is no ripening of enjoyment in other realms.

original: 'dod pa'i khams de na tshe phyi ma'i lus phun sum tshogs pa ni 'jig rten phyi ma pa zhes pa'i don te /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams de na tshe phyi ma'i lus phun sum tshogs pa ni 'jig rten phyi ma pa zhes pa'i don te /
translated: The excellent body in the next life in the desire realm is called the future world.

original: dge ba'i rnam par smin pa nyid kyis ma 'ongs pa sdud par byed pa'i phyir dang ; rnam par smin pa gzhan dang sbyor ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i rnam par smin pa nyid kyis ma 'ongs pa sdud par byed pa'i phyir dang ; rnam par smin pa gzhan dang sbyor ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the maturation of virtue, it attracts the future, and because it is not connected with another maturation.

original: bsam gtan dang gzugs med par skye ba zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan dang gzugs med par bdag gi lus len pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang gzugs med par skye ba zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan dang gzugs med par bdag gi lus len pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbirth in the absorptions and the formless realm‚Äù means the taking up of a body in the absorptions and the formless realm.

original: phun sum tshogs pa gnyis po 'di dag ni bsam gtan dang gzugs med par skyes pa rnams kyi rgyur gyur pa sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / sgom pa la brten pa ni phyi ma'i don to //
analyzed: phun sum tshogs pa gnyis po 'di dag ni bsam gtan dang gzugs med par skyes pa rnams kyi rgyur gyur pa sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / sgom pa la brten pa ni phyi ma'i don to //
translated: These two perfections are the cause of birth in the absorptions and the formless realm. They are based on generosity, morality, and meditation. They are the future benefit.

original: de dag sdug bsngal gyis 'jug par 'gyur ba ni mthong ba'i chos ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de dag sdug bsngal gyis 'jug par 'gyur ba ni mthong ba'i chos ma yin pa'o //
translated: They are not the present benefit, because they are entered through suffering.

original: phyi ma la 'dod pa'i rnam par smin par 'gyur bas pha rol po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phyi ma la 'dod pa'i rnam par smin par 'gyur bas pha rol po zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called the other shore because they are the result of the desire realm in the future.

original: de bde ba dang yid bde ba dang bcas pas dge @54a * //
analyzed: de bde ba dang yid bde ba dang bcas pas dge @54a * //
translated: When he is endowed with pleasure and mental pleasure, he is engaged in virtuous qualities.

original: ba'i chos la sbyor bar gyur na mthong ba'i chos dang phyi ma gnyi gar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ba'i chos la sbyor bar gyur na mthong ba'i chos dang phyi ma gnyi gar rig par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood in terms of both this life and the next.

original: de lta bu'i tshul gyis gzhan dag la yang de bzhin du gzhan gyi don du 'gyur bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i tshul gyis gzhan dag la yang de bzhin du gzhan gyi don du 'gyur bar rig par bya'o //
translated: In this way, one should understand the benefit for others in terms of others.

original: gang dag byang chub sems dpas btul bar gyur pa zhes bya ni snga ma bzhin no /
analyzed: gang dag byang chub sems dpas btul bar gyur pa zhes bya ni snga ma bzhin no /
translated: Those who are disciplined by the bodhisattva are as above.

original: / longs spyod dang lus phun sum tshogs par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba la de'i skye ba gcig tsam gyis bsgos pa'i phyir gtan du ba ma yin pa nyid de /
analyzed: / longs spyod dang lus phun sum tshogs par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba la de'i skye ba gcig tsam gyis bsgos pa'i phyir gtan du ba ma yin pa nyid de /
translated: As for the perfection of resources and body, it is not permanent because it is conditioned by just one birth.

original: de'i rgyu yang tshad yod pa'i skye bas thob pa'i phyir gtan du ba ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i rgyu yang tshad yod pa'i skye bas thob pa'i phyir gtan du ba ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: And its cause is not permanent because it is obtained through a limited birth.

original: 'jig rten pa'i dag pa 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis 'dod chags dang bral bar gyur pa ni nyams par yang 'gyur ba dang / yang 'dir 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i dag pa 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis 'dod chags dang bral bar gyur pa ni nyams par yang 'gyur ba dang / yang 'dir 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The purity of the mundane path is not permanent because one can fall away from freedom from attachment and can be reborn in this world.

original: so so'i skye bo smos pa ni bden pa mthong ba bsal ba'i don to //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo smos pa ni bden pa mthong ba bsal ba'i don to //
