translated: The mention of ordinary people is for the purpose of excluding those who have seen the truths.

original: bden pa mthong bas 'jig rten pa'i lam nyid kyis 'dod chags dang bral bar gyur na gtan du ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bden pa mthong bas 'jig rten pa'i lam nyid kyis 'dod chags dang bral bar gyur na gtan du ba zhes bya'o //
translated: If one becomes free from attachment by the mundane path alone, after having seen the truths, that is called ‚Äúpermanent.‚Äù

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad gtan spangs pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa 'dus pa 'dus ma byas pa de ni gtan du ba'o /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad gtan spangs pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa 'dus pa 'dus ma byas pa de ni gtan du ba'o /
translated: That nirvana which is the complete relinquishment of all afflictions, whether compounded or uncompounded, is permanent.

original: de'i phyir yongs su nyams pa dang / de'i phyir 'ong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir yongs su nyams pa dang / de'i phyir 'ong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no falling away from that, and because there is no return to this world.

original: de 'thob par byed pa'i 'phags pa'i lam yang gtan du ba nyid dang / yongs su mi nyams pa nyid do //
analyzed: de 'thob par byed pa'i 'phags pa'i lam yang gtan du ba nyid dang / yongs su mi nyams pa nyid do //
translated: The noble path that causes one to attain that is also permanent and does not fall away.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan khyad par can du gyur pa de la brten pa de dag kyang yongs su nyams pa med pa yin no zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan khyad par can du gyur pa de la brten pa de dag kyang yongs su nyams pa med pa yin no zhes bya'o //
translated: And those who are established in that special quality of the bodhisattva do not fall away.

original: yang de ni sa gnon cing yongs su sbyong ba'i dus su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yang de ni sa gnon cing yongs su sbyong ba'i dus su rig par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, that should be understood as the time of treading the stages and purifying them.

original: 'dus byas kyi chos rnams ni mi rtag pa dang / ther zug pa la sogs pa ma yin pa rnams ji ltar gtan du bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi chos rnams ni mi rtag pa dang / ther zug pa la sogs pa ma yin pa rnams ji ltar gtan du bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How can conditioned phenomena, which are impermanent, unstable, etc., be eternal?

original: rnam par phye nas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par phye nas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain this by analyzing it, he says:

original: rgyu rnam pa gsum gyis na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: rgyu rnam pa gsum gyis na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Because of three kinds of causes, etc.

original: ngo bo nyid ni mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The reality of nirvana is called ‚Äúeternal‚Äù

original: de ni 'dus ma byas pa'i phyir rtag pa nyid kyis na gtan du ba nyid do //
analyzed: de ni 'dus ma byas pa'i phyir rtag pa nyid kyis na gtan du ba nyid do //
translated: because it is permanent, since it is unconditioned.

original: 'dus byas pa rnams ni mi rtag pa'i phyir gtan du ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas pa rnams ni mi rtag pa'i phyir gtan du ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: Conditioned phenomena are not eternal because they are impermanent.

original: 'phags pa'i lam ni yongs su nyams pa ma yin pas rtag tu rjes su ldan pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam ni yongs su nyams pa ma yin pas rtag tu rjes su ldan pa nyid do //
translated: The noble path is always associated with nirvana because it is not subject to retrogressing.

original: des na de'i rnam grangs ni gtan du ba zhes bya ste /üîΩ'bras bu longs spyad nas zad par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir yod do //
analyzed: des na de'i rnam grangs ni gtan du ba zhes bya ste / 'bras bu longs spyad nas zad par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir yod do //
translated: Therefore, its synonym is ‚Äúeternal.‚ÄùüîΩIt exists because it does not cease after giving its result.

original: 'bras bu byin nas ldog bar gyur pa ma yin @54b pa zhes bya ba'i don te //
analyzed: 'bras bu byin nas ldog bar gyur pa ma yin @54b pa zhes bya ba'i don te //
translated: It does not cease after giving its result.

original: ji ltar zag pa dang bcas pa'i dge ba ni 'bras bu ma myong gi bar du rgyud la nges par 'brel par gnas la 'bras bu byin nas nges par ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar zag pa dang bcas pa'i dge ba ni 'bras bu ma myong gi bar du rgyud la nges par 'brel par gnas la 'bras bu byin nas nges par ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as the wholesome with-outflows are definitely connected with the life-stream until the experience of the fruit, and after giving the fruit, they definitely cease.

original: des na 'bras bu nye bar longs spyod nas zad par 'gyur ba'i phyir gtan du ba ma yin pa'o ;
analyzed: des na 'bras bu nye bar longs spyod nas zad par 'gyur ba'i phyir gtan du ba ma yin pa'o ;
translated: Therefore, because of the exhaustion through the enjoyment of the fruit, they are not permanent.

original: / lam ni de lta bu ma yin no //
analyzed: / lam ni de lta bu ma yin no //
translated: The path is not like that.

original: des na de las gzhan pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: des na de las gzhan pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚Äúother than that . . . ‚Äù and so on.

original: ci nus zhes bya ba la sogs pa la byang chub sems dpa' sa bcu gcig la 'jug par 'gyur ba na bdag nyid kyi nus pa dang mthun par bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: ci nus zhes bya ba la sogs pa la byang chub sems dpa' sa bcu gcig la 'jug par 'gyur ba na bdag nyid kyi nus pa dang mthun par bslab par bya'o //
translated: As much as possible, and so on, means that when the bodhisattva enters the eleventh stage, he should train in accordance with his own ability.

original: dus gsum du byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis bslab pa'i gnas kyi don bcu po 'di dag la bslab par bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dus gsum du byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis bslab pa'i gnas kyi don bcu po 'di dag la bslab par bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that in the three times all bodhisattvas should train in these ten topics of training,

original: 'di las gong na yang med ces bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: 'di las gong na yang med ces bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúThere is nothing higher than this . . . ‚Äù and so on.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i 'grel pa las bdag dang gzhan gyi don gyi le'u'i bshad pa ste gsum pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i 'grel pa las bdag dang gzhan gyi don gyi le'u'i bshad pa ste gsum pa rdzogs so /
translated: This completes the explanation of the chapter on the benefit for oneself and others, the third chapter of the Bodhisattvabh≈´mi.üîΩThe bodhisattva who has trained in the benefit for oneself and others, when he trains in the meaning of reality, becomes free of afflictions.

original: // / bdag dang gzhan gyi don bslabs par gyur pa'i byang chub sems dpas de kho na nyid kyi don la slob par byed na nyon mongs pa med par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar de'i rjes la de kho na nyid kyi don bstan to //
analyzed: // / bdag dang gzhan gyi don bslabs par gyur pa'i byang chub sems dpas de kho na nyid kyi don la slob par byed na nyon mongs pa med par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar de'i rjes la de kho na nyid kyi don bstan to //
translated: Thus, after that, the meaning of reality is taught.

original: nyon mongs pa med pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Moreover, freedom from affliction is twofold:

original: nyon mongs pa med pas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par rtog pa med pa'i nyon mongs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par rtog pa med pa'i nyon mongs pa med pa'o //
translated: freedom from affliction through freedom from affliction and freedom from affliction through freedom from conceptualization.üîΩThe freedom from affliction of both is the reality.

original: gnyi ga'i nyon mongs pa med pa ni de kho na rnam par rig par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar de kho na'i don gang zhes na zhes bya ba smras te /üîΩde'i ngo bo nyid ni de nyid do ;
analyzed: gnyi ga'i nyon mongs pa med pa ni de kho na rnam par rig par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar de kho na'i don gang zhes na zhes bya ba smras te / de'i ngo bo nyid ni de nyid do ;
translated: What is the meaning of reality?üîΩIts reality is reality.

original: / de kho na nyid kyi don ni de kho na'i don te /
analyzed: / de kho na nyid kyi don ni de kho na'i don te /
translated: The meaning of reality is the meaning of reality.

original: ye shes kyi spyod yul dang yul nyid do //
analyzed: ye shes kyi spyod yul dang yul nyid do //
translated: The domain of wisdom is the object itself.

original: mdor bsdu na de kho na nyid ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na de kho na nyid ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: In brief, reality is twofold:

original: dngos po'i de kho na nyid dang / chos rnams kyi rang gi rang bzhin ni 'di'o zhes yongs su gcod pa'o //üîΩde dag ni dngos po ma lus pa'i de nyid de /
analyzed: dngos po'i de kho na nyid dang / chos rnams kyi rang gi rang bzhin ni 'di'o zhes yongs su gcod pa'o // de dag ni dngos po ma lus pa'i de nyid de /
translated: The reality of things is the determination of the nature of things, ‚ÄúThis is the nature of things.‚ÄùüîΩThat is the reality of all things.

original: chos de dag kyang 'di tsam mo zhes grangs yongs su gcod pa'o //
analyzed: chos de dag kyang 'di tsam mo zhes grangs yongs su gcod pa'o //
translated: The enumeration of things is the determination of the number of things, ‚ÄúThere are just so many things.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: ji ltar yod pa las brtsams te //üîΩzhes pa la sogs pa la /
analyzed: ji ltar yod pa las brtsams te // zhes pa la sogs pa la /
translated: ‚ÄúThe reality of things is taughtüîΩIn terms of existence and non-existence.‚ÄùüîΩIn terms of existence and non-existence.

original: ji ltar ni phyin ci ma log pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar ni phyin ci ma log pa'o //
translated: How is it? It is non-erroneously.

original: 'di yod pa'i ngang tshul can ni ji ltar yod pa'o //
analyzed: 'di yod pa'i ngang tshul can ni ji ltar yod pa'o //
translated: The mode of existence of this is how it exists.

original: ji ltar yod pa nyid ni ji ltar yod pa can no//
analyzed: ji ltar yod pa nyid ni ji ltar yod pa can no//
translated: How it exists is how it exists.

original: @55a * // de'i ngo bo ni ji ltar yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: @55a * // de'i ngo bo ni ji ltar yod pa nyid do //
translated: Its nature is how it exists.

original: de las brtsams te zhes bya ba ni de'i dbang du byas nas de kho na dang po'i don phyin ci ma log par rnam par gzhag par bya bya ba'o //
analyzed: de las brtsams te zhes bya ba ni de'i dbang du byas nas de kho na dang po'i don phyin ci ma log par rnam par gzhag par bya bya ba'o //
translated: In terms of that means in terms of that, taking that as the basis, reality is to be non-erroneously established as the first topic.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /üîΩchos rnams kyi yang dag pa nyid //
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa / chos rnams kyi yang dag pa nyid //
translated: Therefore, it is said:üîΩThe reality of things

original: ces bya ba ni yang dag pa nyid dang / phyin ci ma log pa nyid de dngos po nyid kyi ji lta bu nyid do //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni yang dag pa nyid dang / phyin ci ma log pa nyid de dngos po nyid kyi ji lta bu nyid do //
translated: is the reality and non-erroneousness of things, just as they are.

original: ji snyed yod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //üîΩthams cad nyid ces bya ba ni ma lus pa ste /
analyzed: ji snyed yod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o // thams cad nyid ces bya ba ni ma lus pa ste /
translated: The extent of things, etc. should be understood as before.üîΩAll means without exception.

original: kun zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: kun zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúall‚Äù is the meaning of ‚Äúeverything.‚Äù

original: de kho na'i don mtha' dag yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni mdor bsdus nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de kho na'i don mtha' dag yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni mdor bsdus nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúeverything‚Äù should be understood as the totality of the meaning of reality.üîΩThe meaning of ‚Äúin brief‚Äù is the meaning of ‚Äúeverything.‚Äù

original: de la de kho na'i don ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la de kho na'i don ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Therein, the meaning of reality is twofold:

original: shes pa rnam pa gnyis gnyis skyed par byed do //
analyzed: shes pa rnam pa gnyis gnyis skyed par byed do //
translated: it generates the two kinds of cognition.

original: 'jig rten pa'i 'khrul pa med pa'i shes pa dang / chos 'di pa rnams kyi phyin ci ma log pa'i shes pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i 'khrul pa med pa'i shes pa dang / chos 'di pa rnams kyi phyin ci ma log pa'i shes pa ste /
translated: The non-erroneous cognition of worldly people and the non-erroneous cognition of those who belong to this teaching.

original: kun rdzob kyi shes pa dang / don dam pa'i shes pa'i dbang du byas pa'o ;
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi shes pa dang / don dam pa'i shes pa'i dbang du byas pa'o ;
translated: It is in terms of conventional cognition and ultimate cognition.

original: / kun rdzob kyi shes pas bsdus pa'i 'khrul pa med pa'i shes pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: / kun rdzob kyi shes pas bsdus pa'i 'khrul pa med pa'i shes pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The non-erroneous consciousness subsumed by conventional consciousness is also twofold:

original: tha snyad kyi rjes su zhugs pa tha snyad du gdags pa 'jig rten tha mal pa rnams kyi dang / rigs pas nye bar brtags pa'i rjes su 'jug pa'i rigs pas bsgrubs pa dang ldan pa ni khyad par du 'phags pa'i 'jig rten gnyis pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: tha snyad kyi rjes su zhugs pa tha snyad du gdags pa 'jig rten tha mal pa rnams kyi dang / rigs pas nye bar brtags pa'i rjes su 'jug pa'i rigs pas bsgrubs pa dang ldan pa ni khyad par du 'phags pa'i 'jig rten gnyis pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: the conventional designations of those who are engaged in conventional expressions, which are the ordinary people of the world, and the one that is established by reasoning, which is possessed by the second type of superior worldly beings who engage in the investigation of reasoning.

original: de la chos 'di pa rnams kyi de kho na 'khrul pa med pa'i ye shes kyang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la chos 'di pa rnams kyi de kho na 'khrul pa med pa'i ye shes kyang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The non-erroneous transcendent wisdom of those who belong to this teaching is also twofold:

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi ma rig pa'i gnyen po'i phyogs su gyur pa rig pa'i mtshan nyid dang nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i ma rig pa'i gnyen po'i phyogs su gyur pa thogs pa med pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi ma rig pa'i gnyen po'i phyogs su gyur pa rig pa'i mtshan nyid dang nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i ma rig pa'i gnyen po'i phyogs su gyur pa thogs pa med pa'i ye shes te /
translated: the one that is characterized by knowledge, which is the antidote to afflicted ignorance, and the unobstructed transcendent wisdom, which is the antidote to unafflicted ignorance.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa'i dbang du byas pa'o /
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa'i dbang du byas pa'o /
translated: This is in terms of the ultimate truth.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore it was said:

original: de kho na'i don de yang rab tu dbye na rnam pa bzhi ste zhes bya ba la 'jig rten pa rnams la grags pa ni 'jig rten gyi grags pa ste /
analyzed: de kho na'i don de yang rab tu dbye na rnam pa bzhi ste zhes bya ba la 'jig rten pa rnams la grags pa ni 'jig rten gyi grags pa ste /
translated: The mundane is that which is renowned in the world.üîΩIt is the ultimate of non-disputation in worldly dharmas.

original: 'jig rten gyi chos kyi rtsod pa med pa'i mthar thug pa'o zhes bya bas byis pa dang mkhas pa'i bar gyi 'jig rten pa rnams gang dag la mtshungs par blo 'jug par 'gyur zhing grags ba'i dbang gis tha mi dad par mthong ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi chos kyi rtsod pa med pa'i mthar thug pa'o zhes bya bas byis pa dang mkhas pa'i bar gyi 'jig rten pa rnams gang dag la mtshungs par blo 'jug par 'gyur zhing grags ba'i dbang gis tha mi dad par mthong ba'o //
translated: It is that which is seen by the world, from the childish to the learned, as being the same, as being undifferentiated, in terms of what is renowned.

original: de'i phyir 'jig rten gyi grags pa zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jig rten gyi grags pa zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is called mundane renown.

original: rigs pa ni rab tu grags pa'i tshad ma rnam pa gsum @55b mo ;
analyzed: rigs pa ni rab tu grags pa'i tshad ma rnam pa gsum @55b mo ;
translated: Reason is the three kinds of valid knowledge that are renowned.

original: / grags pa ni so sor shes pa dang khong du chud pa ni rigs pas grags pa'o //
analyzed: / grags pa ni so sor shes pa dang khong du chud pa ni rigs pas grags pa'o //
translated: Renown is the understanding and comprehension of each of those by reason.

original: nyon mongs pa nyid sgrib pa yin pas nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa nyid sgrib pa yin pas nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa ste /
translated: Afflictions are obscurations, because they are the obscurations of afflictions.

original: rang gi gnyen po'i phyogs kyi ye shes skye ba la bar du gcod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi gnyen po'i phyogs kyi ye shes skye ba la bar du gcod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are obscurations because they obstruct the arising of the wisdom that is their antidote.

original: de las rnam par grol ba'i ye shes ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pa'i shes pa ste /
analyzed: de las rnam par grol ba'i ye shes ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pa'i shes pa ste /
translated: The intuition of liberation from that is the consciousness purified of the obscuration of the passions.

original: ma rig pa dang bral ba ni shes rab kyi rnam par grol ba'o zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: ma rig pa dang bral ba ni shes rab kyi rnam par grol ba'o zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
translated: The freedom from nescience is the liberation by the wisdom of the bodhisattva.

original: rnam par grol ba gang yin pa de ni rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba gang yin pa de ni rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: That which is liberation is purification.

original: de'i yul nyid ni spyod yul te /
analyzed: de'i yul nyid ni spyod yul te /
translated: The very object of that is the domain.

original: de kho na'i don gsum pa'o //
analyzed: de kho na'i don gsum pa'o //
translated: That is the third reality.

original: shes bya nyid sgrib pa yin pas shes bya'i sgrib pa ste /
analyzed: shes bya nyid sgrib pa yin pas shes bya'i sgrib pa ste /
translated: Since the knowable is the obscuration, it is the obscuration of the knowable.

original: shes bya nyid ni de dang 'du ba ste /
analyzed: shes bya nyid ni de dang 'du ba ste /
translated: The knowable is the object of that.

original: gang sangs rgyas kyi ye shes las gzhan pa'i shes pa rnams zil gyis mnan nas 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: gang sangs rgyas kyi ye shes las gzhan pa'i shes pa rnams zil gyis mnan nas 'jug pa'o //
translated: It is the engagement of the intuition of the Buddha, having overwhelmed all other consciousnesses.

original: des rnam par dag pa'i shes pa ni shes bya'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pa'i shes pa ste /
analyzed: des rnam par dag pa'i shes pa ni shes bya'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pa'i shes pa ste /
translated: The consciousness purified by that is the consciousness purified of the obscuration of the knowable.

original: shes bya thams cad la chags pa med cing thogs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: shes bya thams cad la chags pa med cing thogs pa med pa'o //
translated: It is the freedom from attachment and obstruction with regard to all knowable things.

original: de'i spyod yul du gyur pa ni de kho na bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: de'i spyod yul du gyur pa ni de kho na bzhi pa'o //
translated: The domain of that is the fourth reality.

original: de ltar na 'dir chos 'di pa rnams kyi yang 'jig rten pa'i bzhin du tha mal pa dang / khyad par du 'phags pa'i dbye bas ye shes gnyis su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na 'dir chos 'di pa rnams kyi yang 'jig rten pa'i bzhin du tha mal pa dang / khyad par du 'phags pa'i dbye bas ye shes gnyis su rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, here, like the worldly, the wise should know the two kinds of intuition of the Buddhists, by way of the distinction of the ordinary and the extraordinary.

original: de ltar re zhig mdor rnam par bzhag nas de kho na nyid bzhi'i don mdor bstan pa de dag rnam par dbye zhing bshad pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig mdor rnam par bzhag nas de kho na nyid bzhi'i don mdor bstan pa de dag rnam par dbye zhing bshad pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Having thus presented the four realities in brief, in order to explain and analyze them, he says:

original: de la brda dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de la brda dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Among them, the conventional is the sign, etc.

original: thams cad kyi zhes bya ba ni byis pa nas mkhas pa'i bar tha snyad mkhas pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyi zhes bya ba ni byis pa nas mkhas pa'i bar tha snyad mkhas pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAll‚Äù refers to the wise, from the childish to the learned.

original: dngos po gang la zhes bya ba ni mdor bsdu na 'chad par 'gyur ba'i dngos po rnam pa bzhi po 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dngos po gang la zhes bya ba ni mdor bsdu na 'chad par 'gyur ba'i dngos po rnam pa bzhi po 'di lta ste /
translated: ‚ÄúAny thing‚Äù means, in brief, the four kinds of things that will be explained, namely:

original: 'byung ba'i dngos po dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa'i dngos po dang / de sdom pa'i dngos po dang / gnyi ga ma yin pa'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba'i dngos po dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa'i dngos po dang / de sdom pa'i dngos po dang / gnyi ga ma yin pa'i dngos po'o //
translated: the elemental thing, the thing derived from the elements, the thing that is their combination, and the thing that is neither.

original: mthong ba mtshungs pa'i rgyu bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: mthong ba mtshungs pa'i rgyu bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: To show the cause of the similarity of seeing, he says:

original: brda dang kun rdzob la 'dris pa'i rjes su 'gro bas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: brda dang kun rdzob la 'dris pa'i rjes su 'gro bas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because of the conformity with the familiar conventional symbol.

original: brda dang kun rdzob la 'dris pa'i rjes su 'gro bas zhugs pa'i blo skye bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩdngos po gang las 'jig rten pa thams cad kyi rtsod pa med pas rtsod pa dang bral ba'i lta mtshungs par gyur pas mtshungs pa'i blo dang shes pa skye bar 'gyur ba de la de kho na @56a * //
analyzed: brda dang kun rdzob la 'dris pa'i rjes su 'gro bas zhugs pa'i blo skye bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'i don to // dngos po gang las 'jig rten pa thams cad kyi rtsod pa med pas rtsod pa dang bral ba'i lta mtshungs par gyur pas mtshungs pa'i blo dang shes pa skye bar 'gyur ba de la de kho na @56a * //
translated: The meaning is: because of the conformity with the familiar conventional symbol, the mind that has entered arises.

original: nyid ces bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: nyid ces bstan pa yin no //
translated: That thing in regard to which the mind and cognition of all worldly people arise in a similar way, without dispute, because of the absence of dispute, is taught to be reality.

original: de la brda ni ming la nges par sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: de la brda ni ming la nges par sbyor ba ste /
translated: Therein, the conventional symbol is the connection with the name.

original: des dngos po rnams de lta de ltar mtshon par byed pa'o //
analyzed: des dngos po rnams de lta de ltar mtshon par byed pa'o //
translated: By that, things are indicated in such and such a way.

original: kun rdzob ni tha snyad de /
analyzed: kun rdzob ni tha snyad de /
translated: The conventional is the designation.

original: brtags nas ji ltar 'du shes 'jug par 'gyur ba de ltar tha snyad du byed par zhes bya ba'i mdo'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: brtags nas ji ltar 'du shes 'jug par 'gyur ba de ltar tha snyad du byed par zhes bya ba'i mdo'i tshig gis so //
translated: By the words of the sutra, ‚ÄúHaving investigated, one should designate in accordance with the way the discrimination enters,‚Äù.

original: 'dris pa ni de dag nyid skye ba gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa dpag tu med par goms pas rjod pa dang brjod par bya ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi sgra dang 'brel pa ste /
analyzed: 'dris pa ni de dag nyid skye ba gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa dpag tu med par goms pas rjod pa dang brjod par bya ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi sgra dang 'brel pa ste /
translated: Familiarity is the connection with the words that have the nature of expression and the expressed, through the immeasurable cultivation of those very things in the succession of lives.

original: dngos po 'di'i ming ni 'di yin no zhes btags pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po 'di'i ming ni 'di yin no zhes btags pa'o //
translated: The name of this thing is this.

original: de'i rjes su 'gro bar zhugs pa ni brda dang kun rdzob la 'dris pa'i rjes su 'brang zhing de'i sgo nas zhugs shing rab tu zhugs pa na blo de'i rjes su zhugs shing skyes pas lta ba mtshungs par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: de'i rjes su 'gro bar zhugs pa ni brda dang kun rdzob la 'dris pa'i rjes su 'brang zhing de'i sgo nas zhugs shing rab tu zhugs pa na blo de'i rjes su zhugs shing skyes pas lta ba mtshungs par gyur pa ste /
translated: Engaging in the pursuit of that is following the conventions and the conventional designations that are familiar. When one enters and fully enters through that, the mind engages in and arises from that pursuit. Thus, it is the same view.

original: dngos po la mos pa mtshungs par gyur ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dngos po la mos pa mtshungs par gyur ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one has the same conviction about things.

original: dngos po'i tshogs de'i dbang du byas nas rnam pa gsum du brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: dngos po'i tshogs de'i dbang du byas nas rnam pa gsum du brtag par bya ste /
translated: One should investigate that collection of things in terms of three aspects:

original: 'byung ba'i dngos po dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa'i dngos po dang / gnyis ka'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba'i dngos po dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa'i dngos po dang / gnyis ka'i dngos po'o //
translated: the primary elements, the things derived from the primary elements, and the things that are both.

original: lus kyi yo byad rnam pa bcu'i dbang du byas pa dang yongs su bzung ba'i dngos po'i dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: lus kyi yo byad rnam pa bcu'i dbang du byas pa dang yongs su bzung ba'i dngos po'i dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: The things that are used are those that are used as ornaments, etc.üîΩThe things that are displayed are those that are displayed as ornaments, etc.üîΩThe things that are enjoyed are those that are enjoyed as ornaments, etc.üîΩThe things that are used as ornaments are those that are used as ornaments, etc.üîΩThe things that are worn are those that are worn as ornaments, etc.üîΩThe things that are used as utensils are those that are used as utensils, etc.

original: rgyan du bya ba dang / snod spyad dang zhes bya ba la /üîΩnye bar spyod pa ni nye bar spyod pa ste /
analyzed: rgyan du bya ba dang / snod spyad dang zhes bya ba la / nye bar spyod pa ni nye bar spyod pa ste /
translated: The things that are used are those that are used as ornaments, etc.üîΩThe things that are displayed are those that are displayed as ornaments, etc.üîΩThe things that are enjoyed are those that are enjoyed as ornaments, etc.üîΩThe things that are used as ornaments are those that are used as ornaments, etc.

original: rgyan la sogs par gtags pa mtshungs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩsems dang sems las byung ba'i tshogs rab tu grags pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: rgyan la sogs par gtags pa mtshungs pa zhes bya ba'i don to // sems dang sems las byung ba'i tshogs rab tu grags pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: The things that are worn are those that are worn as ornaments, etc.üîΩThe things that are used as utensils are those that are used as utensils, etc.üîΩThe things that are used are those that are used as ornaments, etc.üîΩThe things that are displayed are those that are displayed as ornaments, etc.

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal la yang zhes bya ba'i tshig smras so //
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal la yang zhes bya ba'i tshig smras so //
translated: The things that are enjoyed are those that are enjoyed as ornaments, etc.üîΩThe things that are used as ornaments are those that are used as ornaments, etc.üîΩThe things that are worn are those that are worn as ornaments, etc.üîΩThe things that are used as utensils are those that are used as utensils, etc.üîΩThe things that are used are those that are used as ornaments, etc.üîΩThe things that are displayed are those that are displayed as ornaments, etc.üîΩThe things that are enjoyed are those that are enjoyed as ornaments, etc.üîΩThe things that are used as ornaments are those that are used as ornaments, etc.üîΩThe things that are worn are those that are worn as ornaments, etc.üîΩThe things that are used as utensils are those that are used as utensils, etc.üîΩThe things that are used are those that are used as ornaments, etc.

original: 'dus ma byas ni rjod pa tsam du zad kyi tha snyad du bya ba ma yin pas 'dus byas rnams bstan to //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ni rjod pa tsam du zad kyi tha snyad du bya ba ma yin pas 'dus byas rnams bstan to //
translated: The things that are displayed are those that are displayed as ornaments, etc.üîΩThe things that

original: 'di ni 'di yin gyi 'di ni ma yin no zhes nges par dpyod pa na shes pa mtshungs par bstan pa'i phyir 'di ni 'di yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes nges pa'i dngos po la mos pa mtshungs pa ni dngos po la mos pa mtshungs pa'am

translated: When one analyzes with certainty, saying, ‚ÄúThis is this,‚Äù and ‚ÄúThis is not that,‚Äù there is a similarity of cognition.

analyzed: brnga'i rjes su 'gro ba'i don sngar bstan pa nyid brjod pa'i phyir rang gi rnam par rtog pa las grags pa zhes bya ba yin no //

analyzed: rigs pa'i don ni phyin ci ma log pa'i don to //

analyzed: rtog ge'i yul la gnas pa yin gyi /

original: rtogs pa la yang ma yin /
analyzed: rtogs pa la yang ma yin /

original: lung yang ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: lung yang ma yin pa'o //

original: gang smras pa /
analyzed: gang smras pa /

analyzed: rtog ger gtogs pa'i sa'o //

translated: In order to show that it is of three kinds,üîΩit is said:üîΩIt is arisen from one's own eloquence,

analyzed: da ni de kho na'i dngos po bstan pa'i phyir /

analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi ste zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: bden pa bzhi shes pa ni 'khor ba'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir dngos po de la dmigs pas nyon mongs pa spong bar 'gyur te /
translated: The knowledge of the four noble truths is the antidote to sa·πÉsƒÅra, so by observing that reality, afflictions are abandoned.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //

original: ji skad du mdo gzhan dag las 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po 'di dag ma mthong ba dang / ma rtogs pa dang so sor ma rtogs pas khyed rnams yun ring por 'khor ba na 'khor zhing rgyug par gyur to zhes bstan pa yin no //

analyzed: rab tu rnam par 'byed pa ni zag pa med pa 'thob par byed pa bden pa rnam par 'byed pa'i gnas skabs na'o //

analyzed: mngon par rtogs par byed pa ni zag pa med pa'i ye shes mngon par rtogs pa'i dus na'o//

analyzed: mngon par rtogs par gyur pa'i ye shes ni de'i rjes la thob pa bden pa rnam par 'jog pa'i dus kyi'o //

original: yang ye shes de dngos po de dag la rnam pa gang dag gis ji ltar skye bar 'gyur /
analyzed: yang ye shes de dngos po de dag la rnam pa gang dag gis ji ltar skye bar 'gyur /

original: rim pa ni gang gis she na /
analyzed: rim pa ni gang gis she na /

original: de'i rnam pa dang go rims bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i rnam pa dang go rims bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /

analyzed: bden pa mngon par rtogs pa de yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /

analyzed: med pa la yang med pa'i rnam par dmigs nas shes pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When it does not exist, knowledge arises by apprehending it in the aspect of non-existence.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: phung po tsam du dmigs shing zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: phung po tsam du dmigs shing zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /

original: 'dis ni gang zag la bdag med par rab tu rtogs pa'i rnam pa skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dis ni gang zag la bdag med par rab tu rtogs pa'i rnam pa skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: go rims bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /

analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i 'du byed skye ba dang 'jig pa dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyi phung po las ma gtogs pa'i gang zag @58b med par lta ba goms par byas pa la 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni stong pa dang bdag med par mthong ba

original: goms par zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: goms par zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: ye shes dang rab tu 'brel pa'i bgegs yod par gyur pa de ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mi shes par rig par bya ste /

original: nyan thos la sogs pa'i'o //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa'i'o //

analyzed: so so'i skye bo rnams kyis ni nyon mongs pa can dang nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa yang ngo //

analyzed: shes bya nyid ni de bzhin du gnas na yang sangs rgyas nyid kyi mkhyen pa las gzhan pa'i shes pa las lhag par gyur pa yin no zhes zer ro //

original: de ni mi bden te /
analyzed: de ni mi bden te /

analyzed: shes bya'i sgrib pa ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mi shes pa ni shes bya'i sgrib par rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: ye shes de'i rnam pa bstan pa'i @59a * //

analyzed: / ye shes des shes par bya ba'i yul de ni de kho na nyid do //

translated: It is called the dependent nature because it is the object of the grasping of subject and object in accordance with the conditions.

analyzed: rkyen gyi dbang gis de lta de de lta bur yongs su 'jug go zhes byas nas so //

analyzed: yongs su 'jug pa yang mngon par brjod pa ma spangs kyi bar du'o //

translated: Moreover, it is fully accomplished because it is fully purified by being free from conceptualization, and it abides in its intrinsic nature by itself without relying on conditions.

analyzed: gzhan du mi 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin yin pas na de bzhin nyid do //
translated: It is thusness because it is the intrinsic nature that does not change into something else.

original: des na smras pa /
analyzed: des na smras pa /

analyzed: gang yin pa de ni de bzhin nyid mchog ces bya ba ni chu'i khams dang gser dang nam mkha' rnams dag pa dang 'dra bas mchog ces brjod pa'am /
translated: That is called the supreme thusness. It is called supreme because it is like the purification of the water element, gold, and space,

original: ye shes mchog gi spyod yul nyid yin pa'i phyir mchog ces brjod do //
analyzed: ye shes mchog gi spyod yul nyid yin pa'i phyir mchog ces brjod do //

analyzed: shes bya'i mthar thug bar phyin par gyur @59b pas bla na med pa'o //
translated: It is unsurpassed because it has reached the end of knowables.

analyzed: des na shes bya'i mthar thug pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /

analyzed: chos thams cad rab tu rnam par 'byed pa 'grub par 'gyur te zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: de'i pha rol na chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: 'grub par 'gyur ba ni des bya ba rdzogs pas ldog par 'gyur ba'o //

analyzed: 'da' bar mi 'gyur ba ni de las 'das nas gzhan du 'jug pa med pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Non-transgression means not engaging in anything else beyond that. This is the meaning.

original: de ltar ye shes kyi spyod yul du gyur pa nyid bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar ye shes kyi spyod yul du gyur pa nyid bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught the object of wisdom,

original: de kho na nyid kyi mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de kho na nyid kyi mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: in order to teach the establishment of the characteristics of reality, he says:üîΩThe characteristic of reality is also...

original: de kho na'i mtshan nyid de yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de kho na'i mtshan nyid de yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: and so on.

analyzed: gnyis su med pas rab tu phye ba zhes bya ba ni gnyis las rnam par grol ba mtha' gnyis rnam par spangs pa'i phyir dbu ma'i lam gyis bsdus pa /
translated: Distinguished by non-duality means included in the middle way due to being liberated from duality and abandoning the two extremes.

original: sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / gzugs brnyan dang / brag ca dang 'dra bar dngos po dang / dngos po med par yang ston par mi byed de /
analyzed: sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / gzugs brnyan dang / brag ca dang 'dra bar dngos po dang / dngos po med par yang ston par mi byed de /
translated: He does not show them as things or non-things, like illusions, mirages, reflections, or echoes.

original: rnam par 'jog par mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par 'jog par mi byed pa'o //
translated: He does not posit them.

original: de ltar byas na gnyis su med pas rab tu phye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar byas na gnyis su med pas rab tu phye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, they are distinguished as non-dual.

original: de ltar na yang byis pas btags pa'i sgyu ma'i glang po la sogs pa'i bdag nyid du med pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na yang byis pas btags pa'i sgyu ma'i glang po la sogs pa'i bdag nyid du med pa'o //
translated: In this way, the nature of an illusory elephant, etc., imagined by a child, does not exist.

original: de lta bur dngos po las rnam par grol ba yin gyi thams cad du med pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta bur dngos po las rnam par grol ba yin gyi thams cad du med pa ni ma yin te /
translated: In this way, they are liberated from things, but not as non-existent in every way.

analyzed: shing bu dang bong ba la sogs pa'i rdzas rnams ni yod pa nyid do //
translated: Things such as sticks, clods, etc. do exist.

original: de bzhin smig rgyu la sogs pa rnams kyang ji ltar rigs par sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin smig rgyu la sogs pa rnams kyang ji ltar rigs par sbyar bar bya'o //
