original: de ltar na dngos po 'di dag ni byis pas yongs su btags pa'i rang bzhin las rnam par grol ba'i phyir dngos po dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar na dngos po 'di dag ni byis pas yongs su btags pa'i rang bzhin las rnam par grol ba'i phyir dngos po dang bral ba'o //
translated: Thus, these things are free from things because they are liberated from the nature imagined by a child.

original: dngos po tsam gyis rab tu phye ba'i phyir dang / 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul du gyur pa nyid yongs su grub pa'i phyir dngos po med pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po tsam gyis rab tu phye ba'i phyir dang / 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul du gyur pa nyid yongs su grub pa'i phyir dngos po med pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: because it is distinguished by mere entity, and because it is the perfected, which is the domain of the wisdom of the noble ones.

original: de ltar na sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' gnyis dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' gnyis dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, it is free from the two extremes of superimposition and denial.

original: de ltar byas na dbu ma'i lam rab tu bstan pa yin no ;
analyzed: de ltar byas na dbu ma'i lam rab tu bstan pa yin no ;
translated: Thus, the middle way is well taught.

original: / yang gnyis kyi don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: / yang gnyis kyi don ni 'di yin te /
translated: Moreover, the meaning of the two is this:

original: dngos po dang / dngos po med pa ste /
analyzed: dngos po dang / dngos po med pa ste /
translated: entity and non-entity.

original: dbu ma'i lam rnam par gzhag pa'i dbang du byas nas so //
analyzed: dbu ma'i lam rnam par gzhag pa'i dbang du byas nas so //
translated: From the perspective of positing the middle way,

original: dngos po ni btags pa'i brjod pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba ni btags pa'i brjod pa dang / tha snyad dang / mngon par brjod pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po ni btags pa'i brjod pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba ni btags pa'i brjod pa dang / tha snyad dang / mngon par brjod pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: entity is the nature of the expression of designation, which is to say, designation, convention, and verbal expression.

original: de rnam @60a * //
analyzed: de rnam @60a * //
translated: That is

original: par gzhag pa ni bstan pa dang tha snyad du byas pa ste //
analyzed: par gzhag pa ni bstan pa dang tha snyad du byas pa ste //
translated: posited as the expression and convention of teaching,

original: ngo bo nyid dang khyad par la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang khyad par la sogs pa'o //
translated: which is to say, entityness, particularity, and so on.

original: de ltar byas na ji ltar byis pas tshig gis ji skad brjod pa dang / sems kyis ji ltar brtag pa de ltar yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar byas na ji ltar byis pas tshig gis ji skad brjod pa dang / sems kyis ji ltar brtag pa de ltar yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is shown that things do not exist as they are expressed in words by the childish, nor as they are imagined by the mind.

original: yun ring po nas mngon par zhen pa zhes bya ba ni mngon par zhen pas gzung ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yun ring po nas mngon par zhen pa zhes bya ba ni mngon par zhen pas gzung ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase long-standing adherence means adherence through imagination.

original: de ltar byas na ji ltar byis pas gzung ba de bzhin du yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar byas na ji ltar byis pas gzung ba de bzhin du yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is shown that things do not exist as they are grasped by the childish.

original: rnam par rtog pa dang spro ba thams cad kyi rtsa bar gyur te zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa thams cad ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rnam pa brgyad du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang spro ba thams cad kyi rtsa bar gyur te zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa thams cad ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rnam pa brgyad du rig par bya'o //
translated: The phrase the root of all conceptual thoughts and proliferation means that all conceptual thoughts should be understood as the eight types that will be explained.

original: rtag pa la sogs pa'i tha snyad kyis rnam par brtag par bya ba dang / rnam par rtog pa'i tha snyad ni spros pa'o //
analyzed: rtag pa la sogs pa'i tha snyad kyis rnam par brtag par bya ba dang / rnam par rtog pa'i tha snyad ni spros pa'o //
translated: Conceptual thoughts are the imagination of things that are the objects of conventional expressions such as permanence, etc. Conventional expressions that are conceptual thoughts are proliferation.

original: de dag la gnas pa dang / rgyu mtshan du gyur pa ni rtsa ba'o //
analyzed: de dag la gnas pa dang / rgyu mtshan du gyur pa ni rtsa ba'o //
translated: The phrase the root of these means the basis and the cause of these.

original: de lta byas na dngos po de ni ming dang rnam par rtog pa la gnas par bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta byas na dngos po de ni ming dang rnam par rtog pa la gnas par bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, it is shown that that entity is based on name and conceptualization.

original: yang rnam par rtog pa thams cad ni mdor na gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //üîΩde rtsa bar gyur pa las 'khor ba 'jug par 'gyur ba ni spros pa'o //
analyzed: yang rnam par rtog pa thams cad ni mdor na gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o // de rtsa bar gyur pa las 'khor ba 'jug par 'gyur ba ni spros pa'o //
translated: Moreover, in brief, all conceptualization is the conceptualization of the apprehended and the apprehender.üîΩThe cause of that is the proliferation of the engagement of cyclic existence.

original: de dag gi rgyu mtshan ni rtsa ba gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi rgyu mtshan ni rtsa ba gyur pa'o //
translated: The sign of that is the root.

original: de la ngo bo nyid kyi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de la ngo bo nyid kyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: With regard to that, from the perspective of the nature of entities,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it is as follows.

original: gzugs zhes bya ba'am zhes bya ba nas rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: gzugs zhes bya ba'am zhes bya ba nas rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: It is from form up to consciousness.

original: 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: From the perspective of the conceptualization of the apprehender,

original: mig ces bya ba nas yid ces bya ba'i bar du'o //üîΩgzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i dbang du byas nas sa zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: mig ces bya ba nas yid ces bya ba'i bar du'o // gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i dbang du byas nas sa zhes bya ba nas /
translated: it is from the eye up to the mental faculty.üîΩFrom the perspective of the conceptualization of the apprehended,

original: reg bya zhes bya ba'i bar du ste /
analyzed: reg bya zhes bya ba'i bar du ste /
translated: it is from the earth element up to the tactile object.

original: rten dang brten pa'i gzugs dag gcig tu byas nas gzung ba nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: rten dang brten pa'i gzugs dag gcig tu byas nas gzung ba nyid du bstan to //
translated: The apprehended is taught to be the form of the support and the supported combined.

original: khyad par la rnam par rtog pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /üîΩdge ba zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: khyad par la rnam par rtog pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa / dge ba zhes bya ba nas /
translated: In particular, he spoke from the perspective of conceptualization.

original: 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: He said, ‚Äúvirtuous‚Äù up to ‚Äúunconditioned.‚Äù

original: mthong ba'i chos dang phyi ma'i rnam par rtog pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos dang phyi ma'i rnam par rtog pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
translated: He spoke from the perspective of conceptualization of the present life and the next life.

original: 'jig rten 'di dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: He said, ‚Äúthis world‚Äù and so forth.

original: nyin mo dang mtshan mo'i rnam par rtog pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
analyzed: nyin mo dang mtshan mo'i rnam par rtog pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
translated: He spoke from the perspective of conceptualization of day and night.

original: nyi ma dang zla ba 'di gnyis dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nyi ma dang zla ba 'di gnyis dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: He said, ‚Äúthese two, the sun and the moon.‚Äù

original: tha snyad kyi rnam par rtog pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: tha snyad kyi rnam par rtog pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: He spoke from the perspective of conceptualization of conventions.

original: mthong ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mthong ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: He said, ‚Äúseeing‚Äù and so forth.

original: @60b shes rab kyis rab tu dpyod pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
analyzed: @60b shes rab kyis rab tu dpyod pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
translated: He spoke from the perspective of thorough analysis with wisdom.

original: thob pa dang yongs su tshol ba dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: thob pa dang yongs su tshol ba dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: He said, ‚Äúattainment and thorough search.‚Äù

original: tha na zhes bya ba ni spros pa thams cad zad pa'i mya ngan las 'das ba'o //
analyzed: tha na zhes bya ba ni spros pa thams cad zad pa'i mya ngan las 'das ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAt the very least‚Äù refers to nirvƒÅ·πáa, the exhaustion of all elaborations.

original: de lta yin na yang byis ba'i blo can nye bar bzung nas rnam par rtog pa'i ngo bo yin zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta yin na yang byis ba'i blo can nye bar bzung nas rnam par rtog pa'i ngo bo yin zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Nevertheless, in order to teach that the nature of conceptualization is the same as the nature of the imagined, he says,

original: de lta bu dang mthun pa btags par brjod pas zhes bya ba ni ming dang brdas rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu dang mthun pa btags par brjod pas zhes bya ba ni ming dang brdas rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe imagined is said to be like that.‚ÄùüîΩThe world means the nature imagined by naive, ordinary beings.üîΩThe non-existence of the duality is the imagined nature.üîΩThe non-existence of the imagined is the perfected nature.üîΩThe non-existence of the duality is the imagined nature, because the duality does not exist in that nature.

original: 'jig rten gyi zhes bya ba ni byis pa'i skye bos yongs su btags pa'i ngo bo zhes ston par byed ba'o /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi zhes bya ba ni byis pa'i skye bos yongs su btags pa'i ngo bo zhes ston par byed ba'o /
translated: The non-existence of the imagined is the perfected nature, because the perfected nature is the non-existence of the imagined.

original: dngos po med pa nyid ni dngos po lnga'i nang nas dang por rab tu bkag pa ni dngos po med pa nyid ces bya'o//
analyzed: dngos po med pa nyid ni dngos po lnga'i nang nas dang por rab tu bkag pa ni dngos po med pa nyid ces bya'o//
translated: The non-existence of the dependent is the perfected nature, because the perfected nature is the non-existence of the dependent.

original: de ltar byas nas ming gi rnam par rtog pa'i dngos po bsal bar gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar byas nas ming gi rnam par rtog pa'i dngos po bsal bar gyur pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the existence of the imagined is refuted, and the non-existence of the dependent and the perfected are taught.üîΩThe non-existence of the duality is the imagined nature.üîΩThe non-existence of the imagined is the perfected nature.üîΩThe non-existence of the dependent is the perfected nature.

original: ngo bo nyid gsum las gzhan gyi dbang bkag pas ni mtshan ma med pa nyid do //üîΩdes na smras pa /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gsum las gzhan gyi dbang bkag pas ni mtshan ma med pa nyid do // des na smras pa /
translated: The non-existence of the imagined is the perfected nature.üîΩThe non-existence of the dependent is the perfected nature.üîΩThe non-existence of the imagined is the perfected nature.üîΩThe non-existence of the dependent is the perfected nature.üîΩThe non-existence of the imagined is the perfected nature.üîΩThe non-existence of the dependent is the perfected nature.üîΩThe non-existence of the imagined is the perfected nature.üîΩThe non-existence of the dependent is the perfected nature.üîΩThe non-existence of the imagined is the perfected nature.üîΩThe non-existence of the dependent is the perfected nature.üîΩThe non-existence of the imagined is the perfected nature.üîΩThe non-existence of the dependent is the perfected nature.üîΩThe non-existence of the imagined is the perfected nature.üîΩThe non-existence of the dependent is the perfected nature.üîΩThe non-existence of the imagined is the perfected nature.üîΩThe non-existence of the dependent is the perfected nature.üîΩThe non-existence of the imagined is the perfected nature.üîΩThe non-existence of the dependent is the perfected nature.üîΩThe non-existence of the imagined is the perfected nature.üîΩThe non-existence of the dependent is the perfected nature.üîΩThe non-existence of the imagined is the perfected nature.

original: btags par brjod pa'i rten thams cad kyi thams cad du med pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: btags par brjod pa'i rten thams cad kyi thams cad du med pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The non-existence of the dependent is the perfected nature.üîΩThe non-existence of the imagined is the perfected nature

original: btags pa brjod pa la brten pa dang / mngon par brjod pa'i tshig la brten pa'i dngos po bkag pas /
analyzed: btags pa brjod pa la brten pa dang / mngon par brjod pa'i tshig la brten pa'i dngos po bkag pas /
translated: Since the existence of things that are based on the expression of designations and on the words of verbal expressions is refuted,

original: thams cad kyi thams cad du med cing yod pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyi thams cad du med cing yod pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: they do not exist at all, they do not exist in any way.

original: thams cad kyi thams cad du btags pa tsam tha snyad tsam yin no zhes smras pa de dag gis tha snyad tsam la yang skur pa btab par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad kyi thams cad du btags pa tsam tha snyad tsam yin no zhes smras pa de dag gis tha snyad tsam la yang skur pa btab par 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who say that everything is just a designation, just a convention, deprecate even mere conventions.

original: de ltar byas na mtshan ma med pa brten pa med pa'i btags pa tsam 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar byas na mtshan ma med pa brten pa med pa'i btags pa tsam 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: If they did so, they would obtain the mere designation of the signless without a basis.

original: de ni 'jig rten pa yang mi 'dod cing bstan bcos las kyang mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de ni 'jig rten pa yang mi 'dod cing bstan bcos las kyang mi 'byung ngo //
translated: But that is not accepted even by the worldly, nor does it occur in the treatises.

original: mdor bsdus na btags pa ni rnam pa gsum du gzhag par bya ste /
analyzed: mdor bsdus na btags pa ni rnam pa gsum du gzhag par bya ste /
translated: In brief, a designation should be posited in three ways:

original: tshogs pa dang / rgyu dang gnas skabs kyi khyad par gyis btags pa'i dbye ba nyid do //
analyzed: tshogs pa dang / rgyu dang gnas skabs kyi khyad par gyis btags pa'i dbye ba nyid do //
translated: as a collection, as a cause, and as a distinction of state.

original: de dag las gang /
analyzed: de dag las gang /
translated: Among those, what is a designation as a collection?

original: tshogs pa dang ldan pa de ni mtshan ma dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: tshogs pa dang ldan pa de ni mtshan ma dang bcas pa'o //
translated: That which possesses a collection is with a sign.

original: de bzhin du gzugs la sogs par btags pa rnams kyang dngos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs la sogs par btags pa rnams kyang dngos par 'gyur ro //
translated: Likewise, the designations of form, etc. would be substantial entities.

original: de med par gyur na btags par rig pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de med par gyur na btags par rig pa ma yin no //
translated: If they do not exist, they are not known to be designations.

original: de ltar na dngos po thams cad med par smras pa nyid thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na dngos po thams cad med par smras pa nyid thob par 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, you would be reduced to the position of a nihilist who denies all substantial entities.

original: de med par smra ba 'ba' zhig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de med par smra ba 'ba' zhig par 'gyur ro //
translated: You would be a pure nihilist.

original: chos kyi mtshan nyid kyi bsdus ba zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad bdag med pas rab tu phye ba'i phyir ro zhes bya'i don to //
analyzed: chos kyi mtshan nyid kyi bsdus ba zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad bdag med pas rab tu phye ba'i phyir ro zhes bya'i don to //
translated: The inclusion of the dharmas is called the inclusion of the characteristics of the dharmas because all dharmas are distinguished by the absence of self.

original: de ltar na dngos po de ni gnyis su med pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar na dngos po de ni gnyis su med pa ste /
translated: Thus, that substantial entity is nondual.

original: gnyis dang bral ba'i phyir dbu ma'i lam yin no //
analyzed: gnyis dang bral ba'i phyir dbu ma'i lam yin no //
translated: Because it is free from duality, it is the middle way.

original: gnyis dang @61a * //
analyzed: gnyis dang @61a * //
translated: It is free from the two extremes.

original: bral ba nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bral ba nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that freedom from the two extremes, he says:

original: mtha' gnyis spangs pa zhes bya ba ni ji skad bstan pa'i rnam pa dang po yod do zhes bya ba ni mtha' dang po'o //
analyzed: mtha' gnyis spangs pa zhes bya ba ni ji skad bstan pa'i rnam pa dang po yod do zhes bya ba ni mtha' dang po'o //
translated: The abandonment of the two extremes. The first extreme is the assertion that the aspect described above exists.

original: dngos po tsam yang med do zhes bya ba ni mtha' gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po tsam yang med do zhes bya ba ni mtha' gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second extreme is the assertion that not even mere substantial entities exist.

original: de gnyi ga spangs pa ni mtha' gnyis spangs pa'o /
analyzed: de gnyi ga spangs pa ni mtha' gnyis spangs pa'o /
translated: The avoidance of both is the avoidance of the two extremes.

original: / gzugs med pa bstan du med pa la sogs pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa ni bla na med pa'o //
analyzed: / gzugs med pa bstan du med pa la sogs pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa ni bla na med pa'o //
translated: It is unsurpassed because it possesses the special qualities of being formless, invisible, and so on.

original: yang de kho na nyid de ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams nyid kyi yul yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yang de kho na nyid de ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams nyid kyi yul yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: Moreover, it is taught that this reality is the domain of the Buddhas and bodhisattvas alone,

original: de dag ni shes bya thams cad la rab tu 'byed pa la dbang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni shes bya thams cad la rab tu 'byed pa la dbang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they have power over the full analysis of all objects of knowledge.

original: shes bya'i mthar phyin pa'i phyir dang / shes bya'i mthar 'gro ba la zhugs shing nan tan dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes bya'i mthar phyin pa'i phyir dang / shes bya'i mthar 'gro ba la zhugs shing nan tan dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they have reached the end of objects of knowledge and because they have entered and are intent on going to the end of objects of knowledge.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi ni shin tu rnam par dag pa yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi ni shin tu rnam par dag pa yin te /
translated: The Buddhas have the most pure.

original: sa'i mthar thug pa brnyes pa dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ni sa bcu rnams su slob pa'i sa la rab tu 'byed pa'i lhag pa'i tshul khrims la sogs pa bslab pa gsum gyis bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa'i mthar thug pa brnyes pa dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ni sa bcu rnams su slob pa'i sa la rab tu 'byed pa'i lhag pa'i tshul khrims la sogs pa bslab pa gsum gyis bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they have attained the ultimate stage, and because the bodhisattvas have the three trainings included in the superior morality, etc. on the ten stages.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni de kho na de la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni de kho na de la'o //
translated: In that, means in that reality.

original: de ltar sangs rgyas rnams kyi ni yongs su dag pa dang / yongs su rdzogs pa'i ye shes yin la /
analyzed: de ltar sangs rgyas rnams kyi ni yongs su dag pa dang / yongs su rdzogs pa'i ye shes yin la /
translated: Thus, it is shown that the Buddhas have the knowledge which is completely purified and completely fulfilled,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ni yongs su ma dag pa dang / yongs su rdzogs pa yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ni yongs su ma dag pa dang / yongs su rdzogs pa yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: and the bodhisattvas have the knowledge which is not completely purified and not completely fulfilled.

original: shes rab de yang thabs chen po yin no zhes bya ba la thabs ma yin pa'i gnyen po'i phyogs su gyur pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab de yang thabs chen po yin no zhes bya ba la thabs ma yin pa'i gnyen po'i phyogs su gyur pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: And that wisdom is the great means, because it is the antidote to the non-means.

original: thabs ma yin pa de la yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: thabs ma yin pa de la yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: And that non-means is also of four kinds:

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob pa dang 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob pa dang 'gal ba yin no //
translated: It is incompatible with the attainment of unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: de dag kyang bdag tu lta ba dang sred pa dag gis 'khor ba la mngon par dga' zhing /
analyzed: de dag kyang bdag tu lta ba dang sred pa dag gis 'khor ba la mngon par dga' zhing /
translated: Moreover, they delight in samsara through the views of self and craving,üîΩand they fear nirvana.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa la skrag pa dang / 'khor ba'i nyes dmigs mthong bas myur du 'dod chags dang bral bar 'dod pas mya ngan las 'das pa sgom par byed cing mya ngan las 'das pa ni zhi bar mthong bas de la gcig tu gzhol zhing 'bab pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa la skrag pa dang / 'khor ba'i nyes dmigs mthong bas myur du 'dod chags dang bral bar 'dod pas mya ngan las 'das pa sgom par byed cing mya ngan las 'das pa ni zhi bar mthong bas de la gcig tu gzhol zhing 'bab pa'o //
translated: Since they see the faults of samsara, they quickly desire freedom from attachment, and so they cultivate nirvana. Since they see nirvana as peace, they are single-pointedly focused on it.

original: de dag gi gnyen po'i phyogs su gyur pa'i phyir thabs chen po'o //
analyzed: de dag gi gnyen po'i phyogs su gyur pa'i phyir thabs chen po'o //
translated: It is great skillful means because it is the antidote to those.

original: de dag gi thabs su gyur ba nyid kyang shes rab dang snying rje gnyis phan tshun rjes su mthun par 'jug pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de dag gi thabs su gyur ba nyid kyang shes rab dang snying rje gnyis phan tshun rjes su mthun par 'jug pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is skillful means because wisdom and compassion engage in a mutually compatible manner.

original: shes rab @61b kyis ni 'khor ba'i nyes dmigs dang mya ngan las 'das pa zhi bar mthong ba'o //
analyzed: shes rab @61b kyis ni 'khor ba'i nyes dmigs dang mya ngan las 'das pa zhi bar mthong ba'o //
translated: Wisdom sees the faults of samsara and the peace of nirvana.

original: de lta na yang snying rje'i stobs kyis 'khor ba yang yongs su mi gtong la /
analyzed: de lta na yang snying rje'i stobs kyis 'khor ba yang yongs su mi gtong la /
translated: Thus, by the power of compassion, he does not abandon samsara,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa yang mngon sum du mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa yang mngon sum du mi byed pa'o //
translated: but he does not actualize nirvana.

original: yang na mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i gnas skabs nyid de /
analyzed: yang na mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i gnas skabs nyid de /
translated: Or else, it is the state of non-abiding nirvana.

original: de lta bu'i shes rab 'dis mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la byang chub sems dpa' gnas par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de lta bu'i shes rab 'dis mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la byang chub sems dpa' gnas par 'gyur gyi /
translated: By this wisdom, the bodhisattva abides in non-abiding nirvana.

original: 'khor ba na gnas pa'i sems can bzhin du 'khor ba na gnas pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: 'khor ba na gnas pa'i sems can bzhin du 'khor ba na gnas pa yang ma yin la /
translated: He does not abide in samsara like sentient beings who abide in samsara,

original: nyan thos la sogs pa bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa yang ma yin no //
translated: but he does not abide in nirvana like the sravakas and so on.

original: des na 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal gyis kyang kun nas nyon mongs pas sems can rnams kyi don yang mi 'dor zhing /
analyzed: des na 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal gyis kyang kun nas nyon mongs pas sems can rnams kyi don yang mi 'dor zhing /
translated: Therefore, he does not abandon the welfare of sentient beings due to the afflictions of the sufferings of samsara,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa yang mngon sum du mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa yang mngon sum du mi byed pa'o //
translated: but he does not actualize nirvana.

original: de'i phyir de dag gi gnas skabs mtshungs par 'jug pa'i shes rab de ni thabs chen po yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag gi gnas skabs mtshungs par 'jug pa'i shes rab de ni thabs chen po yin no //
translated: Thus, that wisdom which functions similarly in those states is the great means.

original: shes rab des sems can rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par bya ba la rab tu sbyor bar byed pa na 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: shes rab des sems can rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par bya ba la rab tu sbyor bar byed pa na 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: When that wisdom is applied to the full maturation of sentient beings and the qualities of the Buddha, it is the correct knowledge of the suffering of cyclic existence.

original: de ltar sdug bsngal rab tu shes pas 'khor ba de yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: de ltar sdug bsngal rab tu shes pas 'khor ba de yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: Thus, through the correct knowledge of suffering, one knows cyclic existence as it is.

original: yongs su shes nas kyang 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa dang rnam par grol ba rab tu sgrub par mi byed de /
analyzed: yongs su shes nas kyang 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa dang rnam par grol ba rab tu sgrub par mi byed de /
translated: Having fully known it, one does not accomplish the attainment of freedom from attachment and nirvana.

original: yongs su smin par bya ba gnyis la sbyor ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su smin par bya ba gnyis la sbyor ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one is endowed with application to the two kinds of full maturation.

original: gal te de lta na thog ma nas 'khor ba'i yon tan mthong bar ci'i phyir mi bya zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na thog ma nas 'khor ba'i yon tan mthong bar ci'i phyir mi bya zhe na /
translated: If that is so, why not see the virtues of cyclic existence from the beginning?

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: gal te 'khor ba yang dag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gal te 'khor ba yang dag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: If cyclic existence were real, etc.

original: 'khor ba la mngon par dga' bas 'khor ba'i skyon gyis gos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'khor ba la mngon par dga' bas 'khor ba'i skyon gyis gos par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of delighting in samsara, they are defiled by the faults of samsara.

original: skyon gyis gos par gyur na bdag gi don yang bya bar mi nus so //
analyzed: skyon gyis gos par gyur na bdag gi don yang bya bar mi nus so //
translated: When they are defiled by faults, they are unable to accomplish even their own aim.

original: des na snga ma'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na snga ma'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the former fault would follow.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa yongs su spangs pa'i phyir 'khor ba la yid byung bas 'gyod pa drag po yid la byed pa de dag ni myur ba nyid du yongs su mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur ro /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa yongs su spangs pa'i phyir 'khor ba la yid byung bas 'gyod pa drag po yid la byed pa de dag ni myur ba nyid du yongs su mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur ro /
translated: Because of completely abandoning the afflictions, they are remorseful about samsara because of their disgust with it. Those who attend to that remorse quickly attain nirvana.

original: de ltar lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das par gyur na yongs su smin par bya ba rnam pa gnyis las shin tu nyams par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba @62a * //
analyzed: de ltar lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das par gyur na yongs su smin par bya ba rnam pa gnyis las shin tu nyams par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba @62a * //
translated: When they attain nirvana without remainder, they fall away from the two kinds of maturation.üîΩIt is said:

original: smras pa / sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: smras pa / sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The Buddha qualities, etc.

original: stong pa nyid du mos pa des zhes bya ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pas stong pa nyid du gnas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: stong pa nyid du mos pa des zhes bya ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pas stong pa nyid du gnas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: By that conviction in emptiness, means by abiding in emptiness, which is the emptiness of the apprehended and the apprehender.

original: byang chub sems dpas mya ngan las 'das pa la mngon sum du ma byas kyang mya ngan las 'das pas skrag pa yang med do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas mya ngan las 'das pa la mngon sum du ma byas kyang mya ngan las 'das pas skrag pa yang med do //
translated: The bodhisattva does not actualize nirvana, but he is not afraid of nirvana.

original: de bsam pa mya ngan las 'das pa la song ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bsam pa mya ngan las 'das pa la song ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because his intention is directed toward nirvana.

original: gzhan du na 'di'i sangs rgyas kyi chos dang sems can yongs su smin par bya ba yang 'thob par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na 'di'i sangs rgyas kyi chos dang sems can yongs su smin par bya ba yang 'thob par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, he would not attain the qualities of a buddha and the full development of living beings.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: tshogs yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bas ni de'i rgyu ston par byed do //
analyzed: tshogs yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bas ni de'i rgyu ston par byed do //
translated: ‚ÄúThe collections are not completed.‚Äù This shows the cause of that.

original: yid skrag ste zhes bya ba ni sems skrag par gyur pa ni phan yon mthong ba ma yin la /
analyzed: yid skrag ste zhes bya ba ni sems skrag par gyur pa ni phan yon mthong ba ma yin la /
translated: ‚ÄúThe mind is afraid‚Äù means that the mind becomes afraid. One who does not see the benefits

original: phan yon ma mthong bas mya ngan las 'das pa'i phan yon mthong ba sngon du song ba'i lhag par mos pa ni rab tu dang ba med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phan yon ma mthong bas mya ngan las 'das pa'i phan yon mthong ba sngon du song ba'i lhag par mos pa ni rab tu dang ba med par 'gyur ro //
translated: does not see the benefits of nirvana. One who does not see the benefits of nirvana does not have the superior intention that is preceded by the vision of the benefits of nirvana. He does not have faith.

original: de'i phyir de'i tshogs yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i tshogs yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is taught that ‚Äúthe collections are not completed.‚Äù

original: gang la yon tan gyis sems mngon par 'dus byas pa yod pa de ni smon lam zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gang la yon tan gyis sems mngon par 'dus byas pa yod pa de ni smon lam zhes bya ba ste /
translated: That which is the mental orientation through the excellences is called the vow,

original: de thob par byed pa nyid la 'bad pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas so //
analyzed: de thob par byed pa nyid la 'bad pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas so //
translated: because it is the striving for the attainment of that.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa ni thabs ma yin la /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa ni thabs ma yin la /
translated: The unfavorable is the non-skillful,üîΩand the favorable is the skillful.

original: gnyen po'i phyogs su gyur pa ni thabs yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gnyen po'i phyogs su gyur pa ni thabs yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to demonstrate this, he says,

original: de la 'khor ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de la 'khor ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: ‚ÄúIn that regard, the samsara is just as it is,‚Äù and so on.

original: ji skad bstan pa'i thabs rnam pa bzhi po chos bdag med pas bsdus pa ni de la brten pa yin no zhes bya bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa'i thabs rnam pa bzhi po chos bdag med pas bsdus pa ni de la brten pa yin no zhes bya bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the four kinds of skillful means, as they have been taught, are included in the selflessness of dharmas, he says,

original: thabs de yang stong pa nyid la mos pa 'di la brten pa yin te zhes bya la /
analyzed: thabs de yang stong pa nyid la mos pa 'di la brten pa yin te zhes bya la /
translated: ‚ÄúThat skillful means is based on this conviction in emptiness.‚Äù

original: de yod na 'di yod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de yod na 'di yod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that when that exists, this exists.

original: ring du zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ring du zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúFar advanced‚Äù means

original: sa bcu'i mthar thug par zhugs par 'gyur ba'i ye shes gang gis rnam par rtog pa'i spros pa thams cad spangs par gyur ba'o //
analyzed: sa bcu'i mthar thug par zhugs par 'gyur ba'i ye shes gang gis rnam par rtog pa'i spros pa thams cad spangs par gyur ba'o //
translated: The wisdom by which one enters the final stage of the ten stages, and by which one abandons all conceptual elaborations.

original: chos gang yang rung ste zhes bya ba ni gzugs nas mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar ro //üîΩji lta bur yang zhes bya ba ni ngo bo'am khyad par ram /
analyzed: chos gang yang rung ste zhes bya ba ni gzugs nas mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar ro // ji lta bur yang zhes bya ba ni ngo bo'am khyad par ram /
translated: Any dharma whatsoever means from form to nirvana.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i dbye bas gzhan yang rung ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i dbye bas gzhan yang rung ba'o //
translated: In any way whatsoever means as an entity or a particular, or as a conceptual distinction.

original: de lta bu'i rnam par @62b rtog pa dang bral ba'i ye shes des mngon par brjod pa'i gnas su gyur pa'i dngos po tsam 'dzin pa ni gzhi lnga'i dang po gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rnam par @62b rtog pa dang bral ba'i ye shes des mngon par brjod pa'i gnas su gyur pa'i dngos po tsam 'dzin pa ni gzhi lnga'i dang po gang yin pa'o //
translated: The first of the five bases is the apprehension of mere things as the basis of verbal expression by that wisdom free from such conceptualization.

original: de bzhin nyid tsam du zhes bya ba ni yongs su dag pa'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid tsam du zhes bya ba ni yongs su dag pa'i gnas skabs so //
translated: Mere thusness means the state of complete purity.

original: yang na dngos po tsam mthong ba nyid bshad pa'i phyir de bzhin nyid tsam du 'dzin pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang na dngos po tsam mthong ba nyid bshad pa'i phyir de bzhin nyid tsam du 'dzin pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Or, in order to explain the mere seeing of things, it is called the apprehension of mere thusness.

original: de bzhin nyid kyi dngos po de la de'i dngos po tsam du yang rnam par mi rtog ste /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi dngos po de la de'i dngos po tsam du yang rnam par mi rtog ste /
translated: They do not even conceive of the suchness of things as just the suchness of things,

original: rnam par rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are free from all conceptual thought.

original: des na spros pa thams cad spangs pa'i don dam pa la spyod pa ni /
analyzed: des na spros pa thams cad spangs pa'i don dam pa la spyod pa ni /
translated: Thus, those who practice the ultimate truth, which is free from all conceptual elaboration,

original: mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa thob pa yin no /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa thob pa yin no /
translated: attain the state of abiding in the absence of attributes.

original: / de ltar spyod pa las skyes pa'i phan yon mang po thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩmtshungs par mnyam pa zhes bya la sogs pa la /
analyzed: / de ltar spyod pa las skyes pa'i phan yon mang po thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir / mtshungs par mnyam pa zhes bya la sogs pa la /
translated: The following verse is stated to illustrate the many benefits that are gained from such practice.üîΩOn the first ground, they attain the state of equanimity,üîΩwhich is the equality of all things and the equality of all sentient beings.

original: sa dang po kun du 'gro ba nyid du bzhin nyid so sor rtog pas de bzhin nyid ro gcig pa nyid dang / chos rnams mnyam pa nyid du mthong bar 'gyur ba ni chos thams cad dang / sems can thams cad la mnyam pa'i sems kyis btang snyoms thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sa dang po kun du 'gro ba nyid du bzhin nyid so sor rtog pas de bzhin nyid ro gcig pa nyid dang / chos rnams mnyam pa nyid du mthong bar 'gyur ba ni chos thams cad dang / sems can thams cad la mnyam pa'i sems kyis btang snyoms thob par 'gyur te /
translated: This is because they see the suchness of all things as being of one taste and they attain equanimity through their attitude of sameness toward all things and all sentient beings.

original: khyad par dang sna tshogs kyi dbye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par dang sna tshogs kyi dbye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no distinction of particular or diverse.

original: gang la dbye ba yod pa de la mnyam pa'i sems med do //
analyzed: gang la dbye ba yod pa de la mnyam pa'i sems med do //
translated: Where there is differentiation, there is no equanimity of mind.

original: de ltar byas na sems snyoms pa nyid dang ldan pas /
analyzed: de ltar byas na sems snyoms pa nyid dang ldan pas /
translated: Thus, by means of equanimity of mind,

original: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i btang snyoms thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i btang snyoms thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: one attains the non-defiled equanimity.

original: nyon mongs pa med par rig pa'i gnas thams cad la mkhas pa yang nyon mongs pa med pa sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med par rig pa'i gnas thams cad la mkhas pa yang nyon mongs pa med pa sgrub par byed do //
translated: And, by means of the absence of afflictions, one becomes skilled in all the branches of knowledge.

original: sgrub par byed pa na yang nyon mongs pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa na yang nyon mongs pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: And, by means of the absence of afflictions, one accomplishes the branches of knowledge.

original: sdug bsngal thams cad dang / yongs su ngal ba thams cad kyis phyir ldog par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal thams cad dang / yongs su ngal ba thams cad kyis phyir ldog par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And, by means of the absence of afflictions, one does not turn back from all the sufferings and all the hardships.

original: nyon mongs pa dang ldan na ngal bas gnod par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang ldan na ngal bas gnod par 'gyur zhing /
translated: For, when one is afflicted, one is harmed by hardships

original: sdug bsngal dang bcas par gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang bcas par gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: and one becomes subject to suffering.

original: de ltar nyon mongs pa med pa'i lus dang sems kyi mthar thug par 'gyur te zhes bya ba yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar nyon mongs pa med pa'i lus dang sems kyi mthar thug par 'gyur te zhes bya ba yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Thus, one attains the ultimate of physical and mental absence of afflictions.

original: de dag gis ni mang du thos pa'i che ba bstan pa yin no //üîΩde dag gis rten bsags pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
analyzed: de dag gis ni mang du thos pa'i che ba bstan pa yin no // de dag gis rten bsags pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
translated: These verses show the greatness of learning.üîΩWith regard to the greatness of the basis of learning, it is said:

original: dran pa'i stobs skyed pa chen po yang thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni thos pas yang dag par bsdus pa'i rig @63a * //
analyzed: dran pa'i stobs skyed pa chen po yang thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni thos pas yang dag par bsdus pa'i rig @63a * //
translated: They also attain the great power of memory.

original: pa'i gnas rnams la sa la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi 'khor ba ji srid par brjed pa med pa'o zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: pa'i gnas rnams la sa la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi 'khor ba ji srid par brjed pa med pa'o zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: This means that bodhisattvas who have entered the levels never forget the sciences that are included in learning for as long as samsara lasts.

original: de lta bu'i thos pa'i bdag nyid che ba dang ldan du zin kyang bdag la bstod cing khengs par yang mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: de lta bu'i thos pa'i bdag nyid che ba dang ldan du zin kyang bdag la bstod cing khengs par yang mi 'gyur la /
translated: Even though they have such great learning, they do not praise themselves or become arrogant.

original: thams cad la sems mnyam pa'i phyir gzhan la phun tshogs pa'i khyad par thob par 'dod pas bdag dang gzhan du mnyam pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pas de dag la slob dpon gyis dpe mkhyud kyang mi byed do //
analyzed: thams cad la sems mnyam pa'i phyir gzhan la phun tshogs pa'i khyad par thob par 'dod pas bdag dang gzhan du mnyam pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pas de dag la slob dpon gyis dpe mkhyud kyang mi byed do //
translated: And because their attitude toward all is the same, they do not begrudge their teachers even though they have attained the special excellence of learning.

original: gzhan dag la yang yang dag par ston par byed do //
analyzed: gzhan dag la yang yang dag par ston par byed do //
translated: He also teaches it to others.

original: gsal par byed do //
analyzed: gsal par byed do //
translated: He makes it clear.

original: thabs la mkhas pa de dag la rnam pa gnyis kyis sems zhum par yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa de dag la rnam pa gnyis kyis sems zhum par yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: By these two aspects, his mind does not become discouraged with regard to those skillful means.

original: ma gus pas 'dun pa med cing mi sbyor ba dang / bdag nyid la brnyas pas spro ba med pa'o //
analyzed: ma gus pas 'dun pa med cing mi sbyor ba dang / bdag nyid la brnyas pas spro ba med pa'o //
translated: He is not discouraged because he is not interested in and does not apply himself to the teaching out of disrespect, and because he is not discouraged by disparaging himself.

original: bdud kyi 'khor la sogs pa 'dun pa bsgyur ba na ldog par mi 'gyur ba ni /
analyzed: bdud kyi 'khor la sogs pa 'dun pa bsgyur ba na ldog par mi 'gyur ba ni /
translated: He does not turn back when he converts the retinue of Mara, etc.

original: 'jug pa yang thogs pa med par 'gyur ro zhes bya bas go cha'i sbyor ba yang bstan par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: 'jug pa yang thogs pa med par 'gyur ro zhes bya bas go cha'i sbyor ba yang bstan par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: He is also said to be unhindered in his engagement, which shows the application of his armor.

original: sdug bsngal gyi khyad par zhes bya ba ni drag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi khyad par zhes bya ba ni drag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The distinctive feature of suffering is its intensity, etc.

original: yang sdug bsngal gyi khyad par de ni /
analyzed: yang sdug bsngal gyi khyad par de ni /
translated: Moreover, that distinctive feature of suffering

original: 'khor ba na gnas pa'i sems can rnams log par bsgrub pa'i sdug bsngal gyis bsdus pa de lta bu'i sdug bsngal gyis reg par gyur kyang sems can rnams la snying rjes mngon du phyogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'khor ba na gnas pa'i sems can rnams log par bsgrub pa'i sdug bsngal gyis bsdus pa de lta bu'i sdug bsngal gyis reg par gyur kyang sems can rnams la snying rjes mngon du phyogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even though they are touched by such suffering, which is included in the suffering of wrong practice of beings who remain in cyclic existence, they are inclined to compassion for beings.

original: de lta bas na bdag nyid myur du mya ngan las 'da' bar mi byed kyi /
analyzed: de lta bas na bdag nyid myur du mya ngan las 'da' bar mi byed kyi /
translated: Therefore, they do not quickly pass beyond suffering.

original: sems can rnams kyi sdug bsngal bsal ba'i phyir 'bad par byed sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi sdug bsngal bsal ba'i phyir 'bad par byed sgrub par byed do //
translated: They strive and practice in order to remove the suffering of beings.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: spro ba skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: spro ba skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: ‚ÄúThey are inclined to delight, etc.‚Äù

original: lus kyi khyad par thob pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lus kyi khyad par thob pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúThey attain a special body‚Äù

original: rigs mthon po la sogs pa'i mtho ba'o //
analyzed: rigs mthon po la sogs pa'i mtho ba'o //
translated: means that they attain a high status, such as a high caste.

original: nga rgyal med par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten shes pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: nga rgyal med par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten shes pa'i phyir te /
translated: ‚ÄúThey become free from pride‚Äù means that they are free from pride because they know the world.

original: sems can thams cad ji ltar snod du 'gyur bde lta bur sgrub par byed ces bya bas so //
analyzed: sems can thams cad ji ltar snod du 'gyur bde lta bur sgrub par byed ces bya bas so //
translated: ‚ÄúThey make all beings fit vessels‚Äù means that they make all beings fit vessels in whatever way is necessary.

original: shes pa'i khyad par thob pa zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa med pa ni dge sbyong gi chos kyi mchog go zhes byas nas so //üîΩgzhan gyis nye bar sbyar ba'am /
analyzed: shes pa'i khyad par thob pa zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa med pa ni dge sbyong gi chos kyi mchog go zhes byas nas so // gzhan gyis nye bar sbyar ba'am /
translated: The attainment of a special knowledge is the supreme austerity of a monk.üîΩOne should guard the mind against the arising of disputes,

original: rtsod pa'am / rtsod pa brgyud pa las sems bsrung zhing spang bar bya ste /
analyzed: rtsod pa'am / rtsod pa brgyud pa las sems bsrung zhing spang bar bya ste /
translated: and against the arising of disputes in the future.

original: brtsam par mi bya'o @63b zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: brtsam par mi bya'o @63b zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: One should not engage in disputes.

original: ye shes la brten par 'gyur pas nyon mongs pa rnam par sbyong ba dang / rnam par sel bar byed pas nyon mongs pa rnams las sems srung bar byed do //
analyzed: ye shes la brten par 'gyur pas nyon mongs pa rnam par sbyong ba dang / rnam par sel bar byed pas nyon mongs pa rnams las sems srung bar byed do //
translated: One should guard the mind against the afflictions by means of the purification of the afflictions through the support of knowledge, and by means of the removal of the afflictions.

original: de'i stobs kyis kha na ma thob thams cad nye bar spyod pa las nyes dmigs mthong nas sems srung bar byed de ;
analyzed: de'i stobs kyis kha na ma thob thams cad nye bar spyod pa las nyes dmigs mthong nas sems srung bar byed de ;
translated: One should guard the mind against the arising of all transgressions by seeing the danger in the slightest transgression.

original: btang snyoms su byed pas nyon mongs pa can ma yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: btang snyoms su byed pas nyon mongs pa can ma yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: One should guard the mind against the arising of the non-afflicted by means of equanimity.

original: yon tan dang phan yon 'di dag rnam par 'phel bar gyur pas mthar thug pa thob pa na /
analyzed: yon tan dang phan yon 'di dag rnam par 'phel bar gyur pas mthar thug pa thob pa na /
translated: When these qualities and benefits increase, one attains the ultimate.

original: dang pa skyed pa rnams dbang du bya ba'i 'dod pa med cing /
analyzed: dang pa skyed pa rnams dbang du bya ba'i 'dod pa med cing /
translated: There is no desire to control those who are generated.

original: dge ba mi spyoms par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: dge ba mi spyoms par 'gyur zhing /
translated: There is no desire to boast about virtue.

original: gzhan las shes kyi khe dang / de yon tan skye bo mang pos shes par 'dod pa nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan las shes kyi khe dang / de yon tan skye bo mang pos shes par 'dod pa nyid do //
translated: There is no desire for the gain of knowledge from others, or for many beings to know one's good qualities.

original: de lta bu dang ldan par gyur cig ces sems kyis kyang 'dod par mi byed na de sgrub par byed pa lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta bu dang ldan par gyur cig ces sems kyis kyang 'dod par mi byed na de sgrub par byed pa lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If one does not even mentally wish for such things, what need is there to mention engaging in their practice?

original: phan yon mang po dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa thams cad dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi rgyud las shin tu 'das pa'i phyir thun mong ma yin pa'i yon tan gyi phan yon dang ldan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: phan yon mang po dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa thams cad dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi rgyud las shin tu 'das pa'i phyir thun mong ma yin pa'i yon tan gyi phan yon dang ldan par 'gyur te /
translated: One will possess many benefits means that one will possess the benefits of extraordinary qualities because one surpasses the mindstreams of all mundane beings, sravakas, and pratyekabuddhas.

original: ye shes de dag bdag por gyur pa las skye bar 'gyur ro zhes byas nas te /
analyzed: ye shes de dag bdag por gyur pa las skye bar 'gyur ro zhes byas nas te /
translated: Because those benefits arise from the mastery of that transcendent wisdom.

original: de las gzhan pa'i ye shes la med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i ye shes la med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they do not exist in any other wisdom.

original: phan yon 'di dag ni byang chub kyi lam gyi tshogs kyis bsdus pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams la phan pa mang du byed pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir byang chub kyi phyogs dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: phan yon 'di dag ni byang chub kyi lam gyi tshogs kyis bsdus pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams la phan pa mang du byed pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir byang chub kyi phyogs dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, it is said:üîΩThe wisdom of the buddhas is the cause of the attainment of the enlightenment of the buddhas.

original: ye shes de ni dus nyid dang / rgyud nyid la khyad par bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: ye shes de ni dus nyid dang / rgyud nyid la khyad par bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate the distinction in terms of time and in terms of the continuum, it is said:

original: de bas na gang la la dag ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de bas na gang la la dag ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Therefore, whoever...

original: de ni dus thams cad pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi rgyud du gtogs pa'o zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni dus thams cad pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi rgyud du gtogs pa'o zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is taught that it belongs to all times and to the continuum of all bodhisattvas.

original: ye shes de med par nam yang gang du yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub rjes su thob pa med do zhes rnam par gzhag pas ni sangs rgyas kyi lam gyi gtso bo yin no zhes bya ba grub pa yin no //
analyzed: ye shes de med par nam yang gang du yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub rjes su thob pa med do zhes rnam par gzhag pas ni sangs rgyas kyi lam gyi gtso bo yin no zhes bya ba grub pa yin no //
translated: By the statement that without that wisdom, there is never any attainment of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment anywhere, it is established that it is the principal of the path of the buddhas.

original: da ni ye shes de la yang dag par brten pa ye shes de'i stobs kyis 'phangs pa'i thun mong ma yin pa'i sgrub pa bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /üîΩde ltar spros @64a * //
analyzed: da ni ye shes de la yang dag par brten pa ye shes de'i stobs kyis 'phangs pa'i thun mong ma yin pa'i sgrub pa bstan pa'i phyir smras pa / de ltar spros @64a * //
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate the uncommon practice which is impelled by the power of that intuition which is based on that intuition, he says:

original: pa med pa'i tshul la zhugs shing zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: pa med pa'i tshul la zhugs shing zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Thus, having entered the way of non-conceptuality, etc.

original: spros pa zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi rtsa bar gyur pa'i phyir dang / spang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa thams cad do //
analyzed: spros pa zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi rtsa bar gyur pa'i phyir dang / spang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa thams cad do //
translated: Conceptualization is all discursive thought, because it is the root of suffering and because it is to be abandoned.

original: de'i gnyen po'i phyogs su gyur pa'i ye shes de ni spros pa med pa'i tshul zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i gnyen po'i phyogs su gyur pa'i ye shes de ni spros pa med pa'i tshul zhes bya'o //
translated: The intuition which is the counteragent to that is called the way of non-conceptuality.

original: zhugs pa ni de la gnas pa dang / de la brten pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhugs pa ni de la gnas pa dang / de la brten pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Having entered means to abide in it and to rely on it, that is the meaning.

original: ji skad bstan pa'i phan yon dang ldan pa'i phyir phan yon mang po dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa'i phan yon dang ldan pa'i phyir phan yon mang po dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Having many benefits means having the benefits as they have been taught.

original: bdag nyid kyang sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir yang dag par zhugs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang gi don la zhugs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyang sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir yang dag par zhugs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang gi don la zhugs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: And I have set out to ripen the Buddha qualities in myself is the meaning of engaged in one's own aim.

original: de dag rang gi rgyud la thob pa nyid ni rang gi don te /
analyzed: de dag rang gi rgyud la thob pa nyid ni rang gi don te /
translated: The attainment of those in one's own stream of consciousness is one's own aim,

original: rang la dgos pa'i dbang gis bsgrubs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rang la dgos pa'i dbang gis bsgrubs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: not the accomplishment of it for the sake of oneself.

original: de las sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams ni stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de las sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams ni stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The Buddha qualities are the powers, fearlessnesses, etc.

original: chos de dag gi yongs su smin pa ni de'i rgyu'i khyad par gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i 'phel bar gyur pa'i sbyor ba dang / dus kyi khyad par gzhan du gyur pa'i yongs su gyur pa khyad par can thob par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: chos de dag gi yongs su smin pa ni de'i rgyu'i khyad par gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i 'phel bar gyur pa'i sbyor ba dang / dus kyi khyad par gzhan du gyur pa'i yongs su gyur pa khyad par can thob par gyur pa'o //
translated: The ripening of those qualities is the attainment of a special transformation through the development of a special cause of them, which is the special transformation of the continuum.

original: de'i phyir zhugs pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrubs pa'i sgo nas de yongs su smin par gyur pas yang dag par zhugs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhugs pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrubs pa'i sgo nas de yongs su smin par gyur pas yang dag par zhugs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, one is engaged in that ripening through engagement in the perfections and through the accomplishment of the perfections.

original: theg pa gsum gyi chos yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni theg pa gsum po de rgyu dang 'bras bus bsdus pa dag ni theg pa gsum zhes brjod do //
analyzed: theg pa gsum gyi chos yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni theg pa gsum po de rgyu dang 'bras bus bsdus pa dag ni theg pa gsum zhes brjod do //
translated: In order to ripen the Dharma of the three vehicles means that the three vehicles are called the three vehicles because they are included in cause and effect.

original: de dag gi yongs su smin pa ni 'jug pa dang / yongs su smin pa dang ; rnam par grol ba'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: de dag gi yongs su smin pa ni 'jug pa dang / yongs su smin pa dang ; rnam par grol ba'i gnas skabs so //
translated: Their ripening is the states of entry, ripening, and liberation.

original: kha cig la nus pa ji lta ba dang / stobs ji lta bas khams dang / mos pa'i dbang gis theg pa gsum la 'jug par byed pa dang zhugs pa rnams yongs su smin par byed pa dang / yongs su smin pa rnams rnam par grol bar byed do zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: kha cig la nus pa ji lta ba dang / stobs ji lta bas khams dang / mos pa'i dbang gis theg pa gsum la 'jug par byed pa dang zhugs pa rnams yongs su smin par byed pa dang / yongs su smin pa rnams rnam par grol bar byed do zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Some, by their capacity and strength, enter the three vehicles by the power of their spiritual gene and their faith. Those who have entered are ripened, and those who are ripened are liberated.

original: 'di dag ni de dag gi yang dag pa'i sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag ni de dag gi yang dag pa'i sgrub pa yin no //
translated: These are their correct practices.

original: rang gi sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin pa'i yang dag pa'i sgrub pa ni de la pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis bsdus pa'i sgrub pa'i sbyor ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin pa'i yang dag pa'i sgrub pa ni de la pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis bsdus pa'i sgrub pa'i sbyor ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The correct practice of the full maturation of one's own Buddha-qualities is to be known as the application of practice which is included in the six perfections.

original: de la sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i sbyor ba'i dbang du byas nas @64b smras pa /üîΩlongs spyod rnams dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de la sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i sbyor ba'i dbang du byas nas @64b smras pa / longs spyod rnams dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In this regard, with reference to the application of the perfection of generosity, he says:üîΩHe has no craving for possessions or for his body.

original: longs spyod rnams dang lus la yang sred pa med pa zhes bya ba chags pa dang bral bar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: longs spyod rnams dang lus la yang sred pa med pa zhes bya ba chags pa dang bral bar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: He has no craving for possessions or for his body means that he is free from attachment.

original: longs spyod dang / lus la ltos pa med pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: longs spyod dang / lus la ltos pa med pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that he is not concerned with possessions or the body.

original: de dag la ltos pa med pa yang byang chub sems dpa' rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de dag la ltos pa med pa yang byang chub sems dpa' rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Moreover, the bodhisattva is not concerned with these two in two ways:

original: lhag par mos pa'i stobs dang / bsam pa'i stobs kyis 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lhag par mos pa'i stobs dang / bsam pa'i stobs kyis 'gyur ro //
translated: through the power of his superior attitude and through the power of his intention.

original: de la lhag par mos pa'i stobs kyis ni mos pas spyod pa'i dus na ste /
analyzed: de la lhag par mos pa'i stobs kyis ni mos pas spyod pa'i dus na ste /
translated: In this regard, through the power of his superior attitude, he is so at the time of the 'stage of action in faith'.

original: de kho na nyid rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de kho na nyid rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they do not conceive reality.

original: sa la zhugs pa rnams kyi ni bsam pa'i stobs kyis te /
analyzed: sa la zhugs pa rnams kyi ni bsam pa'i stobs kyis te /
translated: For those who have entered the stages, it is through the power of their intention.

original: de la sa la zhugs pa rnams kyi ni sred pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de la sa la zhugs pa rnams kyi ni sred pa med pa'o //
translated: For those who have entered the stages, it is through the absence of craving.

original: mos pas spyod pa rnams kyi ni sred pa med par slob pa'o //
analyzed: mos pas spyod pa rnams kyi ni sred pa med par slob pa'o //
translated: For those on the stage of action in faith, it is through the absence of craving.üîΩAnother explanation is that it is through the absence of craving, because it is empty of the nature of seeking and grasping.üîΩIt is through the absence of craving, because it is empty of the nature of seeking and grasping.

original: rnam grangs gzhan yang tshol ba dang yongs su 'dzin pa'i ngo bos stong pas sred pa med pa'o //üîΩde tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'i sbyor ba'i slob pa'o //
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan yang tshol ba dang yongs su 'dzin pa'i ngo bos stong pas sred pa med pa'o // de tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'i sbyor ba'i slob pa'o //
translated: It is through the absence of craving, because it is empty of the nature of seeking and grasping.üîΩIt is through the absence of craving, because it is empty of the nature of seeking and grasping.

original: yang na sems can thams cad la lus dang / longs spyod gtong zhing sred pa med par slob par byed pa'o //üîΩde'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: yang na sems can thams cad la lus dang / longs spyod gtong zhing sred pa med par slob par byed pa'o // de'i phyir smras pa /

original: longs spyod dang lus yongs su gtong ba'i phyir zhes bya'o //üîΩlus can bsod nams zhing 'gyur zhing //üîΩgzhan la gnod pa mi byed par //
analyzed: longs spyod dang lus yongs su gtong ba'i phyir zhes bya'o // lus can bsod nams zhing 'gyur zhing // gzhan la gnod pa mi byed par //
translated: It is through the absence of craving, because it is empty of the nature of seeking and grasping.üîΩIt is through the absence of craving, because it is empty of the nature of seeking and grasping.üîΩIt is through the absence of craving, because it is empty of the nature of seeking and grasping.üîΩIt is through the absence of craving, because it is empty of the nature of seeking and grasping.üîΩIt is through the absence of craving, because it is empty of the nature of seeking and grasping.üîΩIt is through the absence of craving, because it is empty of the nature of seeking and grasping.

original: brtse ba'i bdag nyid khyod bsten pas //üîΩgzung 'os tshig tu 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: brtse ba'i bdag nyid khyod bsten pas //üîΩgzung 'os tshig tu 'gyur ba yin //
translated: It is through the absence of craving, because it is empty of the nature of seeking and grasping.üîΩIt is through the absence

original: zhes bya ba'i nges pas tshul khrims yang dag par blangs pa'i dgos pa bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i nges pas tshul khrims yang dag par blangs pa'i dgos pa bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate the purpose of taking up morality, he says:

original: sems can rnams kyi don gyi phyir //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi don gyi phyir // zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: For the sake of the benefit of sentient beings.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The morality of the bodhisattva is threefold:

original: sdom pa'i tshul khrims dang / sems can gyi don byed pa'i tshul khrims dang / dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sdom pa'i tshul khrims dang / sems can gyi don byed pa'i tshul khrims dang / dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the morality of restraint, the morality of collecting virtuous natures, and the morality of acting for the benefit of sentient beings.

original: 'dir ni sdom pa blangs pa'i tshul khrims kyi dbang du byas nas smras pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni sdom pa blangs pa'i tshul khrims kyi dbang du byas nas smras pa'o //
translated: Here, it is the morality of restraint that is being discussed.

original: bsdams pa yang yin la zhes bya ba ni ldog pa'i sdom pa yang dag par blangs pas so //
analyzed: bsdams pa yang yin la zhes bya ba ni ldog pa'i sdom pa yang dag par blangs pas so //
translated: Restraint is the taking up of the restraint of the code of rules.

original: de'i rjes la bsrung ba ni shin tu bsdams pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes la bsrung ba ni shin tu bsdams pa'o //
translated: After that, protection is the extreme restraint.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i chos nyid kyis thob pa'i tshul khrims la dmigs pa ni slob pa'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i chos nyid kyis thob pa'i tshul khrims la dmigs pa ni slob pa'o //
translated: The focus on the morality that is attained by the future intrinsic reality is training.

original: chos nyid kyis thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyang rnam pa gnyis te /üîΩde dang der skyes par bsam pa'i khyad @65a * //
analyzed: chos nyid kyis thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyang rnam pa gnyis te / de dang der skyes par bsam pa'i khyad @65a * //
translated: The morality of the bodhisattva that is obtained naturally is also of two kinds.üîΩIt is obtained by the special intention to be born here and there,

original: par gyis thob pa dang / rten gyi khyad par gyis thob pa'o //
analyzed: par gyis thob pa dang / rten gyi khyad par gyis thob pa'o //
translated: and it is obtained by the special support.

original: de la bsam pa'i khyad par ni /
analyzed: de la bsam pa'i khyad par ni /
translated: The special intention is

original: rang bzhin gyis sdig ba la mi dga' ba dang / kha na ma tho ba la ngo tsha bas nye bar spyod pa nyid dang / sems can rnams la gtong ba dang ldan pa nyid do //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis sdig ba la mi dga' ba dang / kha na ma tho ba la ngo tsha bas nye bar spyod pa nyid dang / sems can rnams la gtong ba dang ldan pa nyid do //
translated: the natural dislike of evil, the natural shame at wrongdoing, the natural practice of giving to sentient beings.

original: de dag bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate those,

original: rang bzhin gyis bzang zhing dge ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis bzang zhing dge ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: he says, ‚Äúbecause of the natural goodness and virtue.‚Äù

original: rten gyi khyad par ni /
analyzed: rten gyi khyad par ni /
translated: The special support is

original: ji skad bstan pa'i rten gyi khyad par dang ldan pas sdig pa'i las kyi bya ba byed par mi nus pa'i lus thob par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa'i rten gyi khyad par dang ldan pas sdig pa'i las kyi bya ba byed par mi nus pa'i lus thob par rig par bya'o //
translated: the attainment of a body in which one is unable to perform the actions of evil karma because of possessing the special support as it has been taught.

original: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa ;
analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa ;
translated: With reference to the perfection of patience, it is said:

original: thams cad la yang bzod pa yin la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: thams cad la yang bzod pa yin la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: He is patient with all, etc.

original: bzod pa ni brnags nus pa ste /
analyzed: bzod pa ni brnags nus pa ste /

original: de ltar re zhig yon tan dang ldan pa dang / skyon dang ldan pa dang / phan 'dogs pa dang / gnod pa byed pa'i sems can rnams la bsam pa dang sbyor bas yang dag par bsgrub pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig yon tan dang ldan pa dang / skyon dang ldan pa dang / phan 'dogs pa dang / gnod pa byed pa'i sems can rnams la bsam pa dang sbyor bas yang dag par bsgrub pa bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught the correct practice with regard to sentient beings who possess good qualities, who possess faults, who are helpful, and who are harmful, in terms of attitude and application,

original: ji skad bstan pa'i dngos po de dag nyid la yod pa'i phyogs dang / med pa'i phyogs kyi dbu ma'i rnam par bsgrub pa ma grub pa rnams rnam par bsgrub pa'i phyir rigs pa gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa'i dngos po de dag nyid la yod pa'i phyogs dang / med pa'i phyogs kyi dbu ma'i rnam par bsgrub pa ma grub pa rnams rnam par bsgrub pa'i phyir rigs pa gang yin zhe na /
translated: what is the reasoning by which one accomplishes the middle way that is the absence of the extremes of existence and non-existence with regard to those very things that have been taught?

original: smras pa / 'thad pa sgrub pa'i rigs pas de bsgrub par 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: smras pa / 'thad pa sgrub pa'i rigs pas de bsgrub par 'dod pa ste /
translated: It is said: That is accomplished by the reasoning of tenability, which is asserted to be the accomplishment of that.

original: 'dir rigs pa bzhi'i nang nas 'thad pa sgrub pa'i rigs pa yin par 'dod pa ni tshad ma rnam pa gsum gyis bsdus pa sngar bstan pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir rigs pa bzhi'i nang nas 'thad pa sgrub pa'i rigs pa yin par 'dod pa ni tshad ma rnam pa gsum gyis bsdus pa sngar bstan pa ste /

analyzed: chos thams cad brjod du med pa de rgyu gang gis yongs su gcad par nus zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: rigs pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rigs pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /

original: btags ba tsam du zad par rig par bya ste zhes bya la /üîΩdngos po 'di dag ni yongs su btags pa nyid de /
analyzed: btags ba tsam du zad par rig par bya ste zhes bya la / dngos po 'di dag ni yongs su btags pa nyid de /

analyzed: ngo bo nyid yongs su gsal bar byed pa la btags pa tsam mo zhes bya ba yin no // de'i @67a * //

original: phyir smras pa /

analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyang ma yin / de las ma gtogs pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: btags par brjod pa de ni dngos po de la de'i bdag nyid du yang yod pa ma yin la /

analyzed: de ltar byas nas chos de dag ni byis pas ji ltar btags pa'i rnam pa de lta bur yod pa ma yin no //

analyzed: med pa yang ma yin na rnam pa ji lta bus yod pa yin zhe na /

translated: In order to demonstrate this,üîΩhe says,

original: zhes bya ba smras pa /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smras pa /

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyis yod pa ma yin pa'i rang bzhin la mtshan mar bzung nas sgro btags pa dang / log par gzung ba dang / spangs pa ni yod pa ma yin pa la sgro btags pa'o //

original: de lta bu'i yod pa de gang gis yongs su gcod par 'gyur zhe na de ni nges par shes byas bsdus pa yin pa'i phyir shes pas yongs su gcod pa 'thob par 'gyur ro zhas bstan pa'i phyir /

translated: If that sort of existence is determined by what, it is said that it is definitely included in the object of knowledge, and therefore it is determined by knowledge.üîΩIn order to demonstrate that, it says:

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: 'jig @67b rten thams cad las rab tu khyad par du 'phags par gyur pa'i ye shes des yongs su gcod par byed kyi gzhan gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: That is determined by the intuition which is most exalted above all mundane states, but not by any other.

original: gang la de lta bu'i ye shes yod pa de dag de las som nyi med cing kun du rmongs pa med de /
analyzed: gang la de lta bu'i ye shes yod pa de dag de las som nyi med cing kun du rmongs pa med de /
translated: Those who have such intuition are free from doubt and confusion with regard to that,

original: des mngon sum du byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des mngon sum du byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is directly perceived by them.

original: de bzhin du de ni 'phags pa nyid kyi spyod yul yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du de ni 'phags pa nyid kyi spyod yul yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: In the same way, it is demonstrated that that is the domain of the noble ones.

original: dngos po la mngon par zhen pa'i phyogs la skyon rnam pa gsum yod par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dngos po la mngon par zhen pa'i phyogs la skyon rnam pa gsum yod par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that there are three faults in the position that clings to things, it says:

original: gal te chos gang dag ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gal te chos gang dag ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: If there were any phenomena, etc.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid gzhan gyi dbang gi rdzas yod pa nyid du bzung nas smras pa ni /üîΩchos zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid gzhan gyi dbang gi rdzas yod pa nyid du bzung nas smras pa ni / chos zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The other-dependent, which is the reality of dependent origination, is spoken of as the ‚Äúthing‚Äù when it is apprehended as substantially existent.

original: de nyid yongs su dag pa'i gnas skabs don dam pa nyid yod pa yongs su grub par nye bar bzung nas smras pa ni dngos po zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid yongs su dag pa'i gnas skabs don dam pa nyid yod pa yongs su grub par nye bar bzung nas smras pa ni dngos po zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The reality that is the thoroughly established, which is the pure state of that very [other-dependent], is spoken of as the ‚Äúentity‚Äù when it is apprehended as the ultimate.

original: yang na yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ni chos zhes bstan te /
analyzed: yang na yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ni chos zhes bstan te /
translated: Or, the thoroughly established reality is taught as the ‚Äúreality‚Äù

original: rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it holds its own characteristics.

original: dngos po lnga'i nang nas rgyu mtshan gang yin pa de ni dngos po zhes brjod do //
analyzed: dngos po lnga'i nang nas rgyu mtshan gang yin pa de ni dngos po zhes brjod do //
translated: From among the five entities, that which is the reason is spoken of as the ‚Äúentity‚Äù

original: mngon par brjod pa'i gnas su gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par brjod pa'i gnas su gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the basis of verbalization.

original: yang na de rdzas su yod pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir chos zhes brjod do //
analyzed: yang na de rdzas su yod pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir chos zhes brjod do //
translated: Or, it is spoken of as the ‚Äúreality‚Äù in order to teach that it exists substantially.

original: de nyid ming dang rnam par rtog pa la brten pa'i phyir dngos po zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de nyid ming dang rnam par rtog pa la brten pa'i phyir dngos po zhes brjod do //
translated: That very [thoroughly established reality] is spoken of as the ‚Äúentity‚Äù because it is based on names and conceptualization.

original: de'i bdag nyid du gyur na ni zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid du gyur na ni zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If it were to become its very nature,

original: brjod pa'i bdag nyid de nges nges par brtags pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: brjod pa'i bdag nyid de nges nges par brtags pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: because it is the nature of speech, which is the nature of definite examination.

original: mngon par brjod pa'i tshig gi rang bzhin no zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: mngon par brjod pa'i tshig gi rang bzhin no zhes bya ba'i don te /
