original: zhes bya ba 'dis ni sgro 'dogs pa'i mtha' yongs su bsal ba dang / ngo bo nyid gnyis gsal bar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis ni sgro 'dogs pa'i mtha' yongs su bsal ba dang / ngo bo nyid gnyis gsal bar bstan pa yin no //
translated: This shows the elimination of the extreme of superimposition and the manifestation of the two natures.

original: 'di ni chos rnams nyid do zhes bya ba ni dus rtag tu gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo la mngon par brjod pa dang / kun du brtags pa'i ngo bo ni yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di ni chos rnams nyid do zhes bya ba ni dus rtag tu gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo la mngon par brjod pa dang / kun du brtags pa'i ngo bo ni yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the reality of things means that the dependent nature is always the referent of verbalization, and the imagined nature does not exist.

original: 'dis ni skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' yongs su bsal ba dang / yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid gsal bar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' yongs su bsal ba dang / yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid gsal bar bstan pa yin no //
translated: This passage completely eliminates the extreme of nihilism and clearly teaches the reality of the perfected nature.

original: 'di dag ni tshigs su bcad pa'i bsdus pa'i don te /
analyzed: 'di dag ni tshigs su bcad pa'i bsdus pa'i don te /
translated: These are the condensed topics of the verse.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i ming can gyi chos rnams ming gis ngo bo nyid brjod pa na de dag gi ming med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i ming can gyi chos rnams ming gis ngo bo nyid brjod pa na de dag gi ming med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When the names of things such as form are expressed, their names do not exist.

original: des ni de nyid las /
analyzed: des ni de nyid las /
translated: As that same text says:

original: chos rnams ming ni yod ma yin //üîΩzhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos rnams ming ni yod ma yin // zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Things do not exist as names.

original: gang la ming de 'jug par 'gyur ba de las gzhan pa'i chos de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang la ming de 'jug par 'gyur ba de las gzhan pa'i chos de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: This means that apart from the name, the thing to which the name applies does not exist as its own reality.

original: de ltar na chos de dag ni ming dag gis nges par brtags pa na yang ming med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir gzhan ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: de ltar na chos de dag ni ming dag gis nges par brtags pa na yang ming med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir gzhan ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: Thus, since those phenomena are not even names when they are ascertained by names, they are not other than that.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: de la de ni yod ma yin //
analyzed: de la de ni yod ma yin //
translated: That does not exist in it.

original: zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: This is what is said.

original: de ni brjod du med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / rang bzhin gyis sgrub pa'i phyir don dam pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi chos nyid do zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni brjod du med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / rang bzhin gyis sgrub pa'i phyir don dam pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi chos nyid do zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Since that is the inexpressible nature and is established by intrinsic reality, it is the ultimate nature of phenomena.

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa dang yang dag par ldan pa'i lung gnyis nga bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa dang yang dag par ldan pa'i lung gnyis nga bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the two scriptures that are associated with the ≈örƒÅvaka Vehicle,üîΩthe meaning of this verse should be understood as a summary of the teaching.

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'di'i don bsdus nas bstan par rig par bya'o zhes zhal gyis mi bzhes te zhes bya ba ni lta ba dang / sred pa dag gis gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po khas blangs nas so //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'di'i don bsdus nas bstan par rig par bya'o zhes zhal gyis mi bzhes te zhes bya ba ni lta ba dang / sred pa dag gis gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po khas blangs nas so //
translated: This is not accepted because, having accepted the entity of form, etc., through views and craving,

original: lta ba ni mngon par zhen pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: lta ba ni mngon par zhen pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: views are the aspect of strong attachment.

original: sred pa ni mi gtong ba'i rnam pas dngos po de 'dzin pa ni khas len pa'o //
analyzed: sred pa ni mi gtong ba'i rnam pas dngos po de 'dzin pa ni khas len pa'o //
translated: and the grasping of it in the aspect of non-abandonment is the acceptance of it.

original: de dag gnyis ka las thub pa grol bas zhal gyis mi bzhes pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gnyis ka las thub pa grol bas zhal gyis mi bzhes pa'o //
translated: The Sage, being liberated from both, does not accept it.

original: de ni gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po'i ngo bo la mngon par zhen par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ni gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po'i ngo bo la mngon par zhen par mi 'gyur te /
translated: He does not become attached to the nature of entities such as form,

original: @72a * // sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs pa'i lta ba rab tu spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @72a * // sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs pa'i lta ba rab tu spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he has abandoned the views of superimposition and denial.

original: des na smras pa /
analyzed: des na smras pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: de kun thub pas zhal gyis mi bzhes te //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de kun thub pas zhal gyis mi bzhes te // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The Sage does not accept any of them.

original: sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs pa'i lta ba la brten nas sred pa rnam pa gnyis skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs pa'i lta ba la brten nas sred pa rnam pa gnyis skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: Here, the two kinds of craving arise based on the views of superimposition and denial.

original: srid pa'i sred pa dang / srid pa ma yin pa'i sred pa dang / rim pa bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: srid pa'i sred pa dang / srid pa ma yin pa'i sred pa dang / rim pa bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The craving for existence and the craving for non-existence should be connected in order.

original: de la srid pa ma yin pa'i sred pa ni dngos po yang dngos po med par mthong ba'i sgo nas skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bas gzigs pa dang bzhed pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la srid pa ma yin pa'i sred pa ni dngos po yang dngos po med par mthong ba'i sgo nas skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bas gzigs pa dang bzhed pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: As for the craving that is not existence, it arises by way of seeing an entity as a non-entity, and so it is not accepted.

original: srid pa la sred pa ni mngon par brjod pa thos pa'i sgo nas skye ba ni gsan la bzhed pa'o //
analyzed: srid pa la sred pa ni mngon par brjod pa thos pa'i sgo nas skye ba ni gsan la bzhed pa'o //
translated: As for the craving that is existence, it arises by way of hearing the expressions of others, and so it is not accepted.

original: de gnyi ga'i ngo bo med pas zhal gyis mi bzhes pa'o //
analyzed: de gnyi ga'i ngo bo med pas zhal gyis mi bzhes pa'o //
translated: Since both of these are non-entities, they are not accepted.

original: 'dogs pa'i rnam grangs ni kun rdzob yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dogs pa'i rnam grangs ni kun rdzob yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the synonyms of imputation are the conventional,üîΩit says, ‚ÄúWhatever is imputed is called the conventional.‚Äù

original: btags pa gang yin pa de dag ni kun rdzob ces bya ste zhes bya ba la kun rdzob de la dngos po'i ngo bor ni mngon par zhen par mi bya ste /
analyzed: btags pa gang yin pa de dag ni kun rdzob ces bya ste zhes bya ba la kun rdzob de la dngos po'i ngo bor ni mngon par zhen par mi bya ste /
translated: One should not cling to that conventional as having the nature of an entity,

original: lta ba med pa'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: lta ba med pa'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: and so it is taught that there is no view.

original: des na rgyu des zhal gyis mi bzhes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: des na rgyu des zhal gyis mi bzhes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, for that reason, it is called ‚Äúnot accepted.‚Äù

original: zhal gyis mi bzhes pa'i phyir gang yang nye bar mi 'dzin pas gang gis kyang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhal gyis mi bzhes pa'i phyir gang yang nye bar mi 'dzin pas gang gis kyang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Since he does not accept anything, he does not apprehend anything at all.

original: 'dzin pa bshad pa ni /
analyzed: 'dzin pa bshad pa ni /
translated: The explanation of apprehension:

original: sgro 'dogs pa'am skur pa 'debs pas sam zhes bya ba ni rdzas de 'dzin pa'i skabs kyis so //
analyzed: sgro 'dogs pa'am skur pa 'debs pas sam zhes bya ba ni rdzas de 'dzin pa'i skabs kyis so //
translated: By superimposition or denial, he does not apprehend that substance.

original: de ltar phyin ci log gi lta ba spangs pas yang dag pa'i lta ba can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar phyin ci log gi lta ba spangs pas yang dag pa'i lta ba can du 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, by abandoning the view of error, he becomes one who has the right view.

original: des shes bya de yang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin mthong ba'i phyir gzigs pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: des shes bya de yang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin mthong ba'i phyir gzigs pa zhes brjod do //
translated: Since he sees that knowable object as it is in reality, he is called ‚Äúthe seer.‚Äù

original: des shes bya'i brjod pa thos pa'i phyir gsan pa zhes brjod do//
analyzed: des shes bya'i brjod pa thos pa'i phyir gsan pa zhes brjod do//
translated: Since he hears the expression of that knowable object, he is called ‚Äúthe hearer.‚Äù

original: sred pa skyed par yang mi mdzad /
analyzed: sred pa skyed par yang mi mdzad /
translated: He does not generate craving.üîΩHe does not increase it.

original: 'phel bar yang mi mdzad ces bya ba'i rang bzhin gyi don bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'phel bar yang mi mdzad ces bya ba'i rang bzhin gyi don bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the meaning of the nature of that, it says:

original: dmigs pa de spong zhing btang snyoms can du gnas te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dmigs pa de spong zhing btang snyoms can du gnas te zhes bya ba la /
translated: He abides in equanimity, abandoning that apprehension.

original: skyed par mi mdzad ces bya ba ni spong bar mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: skyed par mi mdzad ces bya ba ni spong bar mdzad pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHe does not generate‚Äù means he abandons.

original: 'phel bar mi mdzad ces bya ba ni btang snyoms su gnas pa'o ;
analyzed: 'phel bar mi mdzad ces bya ba ni btang snyoms su gnas pa'o ;
translated: ‚ÄúHe does not increase‚Äù means he remains indifferent.

original: / nyan thos kyi theg pa dang yang dag par ldan pa'i lung gsum pa nyid bstan pa /üîΩsa la brten cing bsam gtan mi byed ces bya ba ni sa gang yin pa de ni bdag go zhe'am /
analyzed: / nyan thos kyi theg pa dang yang dag par ldan pa'i lung gsum pa nyid bstan pa / sa la brten cing bsam gtan mi byed ces bya ba ni sa gang yin pa de ni bdag go zhe'am /
translated: The third verse shows the Sravakayana.üîΩ‚ÄúHe does not meditate on the elements‚Äù means that he does not meditate on the elements, thinking ‚Äúthis is the self‚Äù or ‚Äúthis is the self‚Äôs.‚Äù

original: bdag gang yin pa de nyid sa'o zhes bya bar de ltar sa la bdag dang bdag gir bzung nas bsam gtan mi byed de @72b zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag gang yin pa de nyid sa'o zhes bya bar de ltar sa la bdag dang bdag gir bzung nas bsam gtan mi byed de @72b zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus he does not meditate on the elements, thinking ‚Äúthis is the self‚Äù or ‚Äúthis is the self‚Äôs.‚Äù

original: de ltar chu dang me dang rlung la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar chu dang me dang rlung la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same is to be applied to water, fire, and wind.

original: de bzhin du 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i tshig gis 'dod pa'i khams dang / gzugs kyi khams la brten nas bsam gtan mi byed do zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i tshig gis 'dod pa'i khams dang / gzugs kyi khams la brten nas bsam gtan mi byed do zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, by the words ‚Äúthe four great elements,‚Äù it is shown that he does not meditate on the elements in dependence on the desire realm and the form realm.

original: gzugs med pa'i skye mched bzhi ni rang gi sgras bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i skye mched bzhi ni rang gi sgras bstan pa yin no //
translated: The four formless states are shown by their own names.

original: 'dod pa'i khams ni 'jig rten 'di la /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams ni 'jig rten 'di la /
translated: The desire realm is this world.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams ni 'jig rten gzhan no //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams ni 'jig rten gzhan no //
translated: The form and formless realms are other worlds.

original: nyi ma dang zla ba tha dad du smos pa ni 'jig rten gzhan du yang mngon sum du mthong ba'i phyir ro //üîΩmthong ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni tha snyad la brten nas bsam gtan mi byed do zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: nyi ma dang zla ba tha dad du smos pa ni 'jig rten gzhan du yang mngon sum du mthong ba'i phyir ro // mthong ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni tha snyad la brten nas bsam gtan mi byed do zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The sun and moon are mentioned separately because they are seen directly in other worlds.üîΩBy seeing and so on, it is shown that one should not meditate in dependence on conventions.

original: bsnyen pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni spros pa la brten nas bsam gtan mi byed do zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bsnyen pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni spros pa la brten nas bsam gtan mi byed do zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: By approaching and so on, it is shown that one should not meditate in dependence on conceptual elaborations.

original: mi rten pa'i rgyu bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mi rten pa'i rgyu bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the cause of non-dependence,

original: sa la sar 'du shes pa gang yin pa de bsal ba yin no zhes bya ba ni rab tu spangs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sa la sar 'du shes pa gang yin pa de bsal ba yin no zhes bya ba ni rab tu spangs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: it is said, Whatever perception of earth as earth is eliminated, meaning completely abandoned.

original: de ltar brten pa med par bsam gtan byed pa'i dge slong la ni lha dang tshangs pa la sogs pas kyang mchod par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar brten pa med par bsam gtan byed pa'i dge slong la ni lha dang tshangs pa la sogs pas kyang mchod par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In this way, it is shown that the monk who meditates without dependence is worshipped even by gods, Brahma, and so on.

original: dbang po dang bcas pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po dang bcas pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: together with the faculties.

original: sa'i 'du shes la sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs pa'i sgo nas bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sa'i 'du shes la sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs pa'i sgo nas bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the imputation and denial of the notion of earth, he says:

original: sgro 'dogs pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sgro 'dogs pa ni brjod pa'i ngo bo la mngon par zhen pa nyid do //
analyzed: sgro 'dogs pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sgro 'dogs pa ni brjod pa'i ngo bo la mngon par zhen pa nyid do //
translated: Imputation is the adherence to the nature of verbal expression.

original: skur pa 'debs pa ni don dam par yod pa yang dag pa'i dngos po la skur pa 'debs pa'o //
analyzed: skur pa 'debs pa ni don dam par yod pa yang dag pa'i dngos po la skur pa 'debs pa'o //
translated: Denial is the denial of the ultimate existence of real entities.

original: bsal ba'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bsal ba'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the meaning of elimination, he says:

original: bsal zhes bya ba ni spong ba dang gtong ba'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bsal zhes bya ba ni spong ba dang gtong ba'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Elimination is the relinquishment and abandonment of both imputation and denial.

original: de ltar chos thams cad brjod du med pa'i ngo bo rab tu rtogs nas de'i bdag nyid ma yin na yang brjod pa'i bdag nyid kyi sgo nas ston par mdzad kyang /
analyzed: de ltar chos thams cad brjod du med pa'i ngo bo rab tu rtogs nas de'i bdag nyid ma yin na yang brjod pa'i bdag nyid kyi sgo nas ston par mdzad kyang /
translated: Thus, having realized that all things are essentially inexpressible, he teaches them by means of verbal expression, although they are not of the nature of that.

original: brjod du med pa'i bdag nyid la bstan du med pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: brjod du med pa'i bdag nyid la bstan du med pa nyid yin te /
translated: However, they are not taught in the inexpressible nature,

original: ngag gi spyod yul thams cad las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngag gi spyod yul thams cad las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they transcend all the domains of speech.

original: des de brjod pa na 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi rgyu mthun pa'i bstan pas bsdus pa de ni yang dag pa'i ye shes skye ba la rjes su mthun pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des de brjod pa na 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi rgyu mthun pa'i bstan pas bsdus pa de ni yang dag pa'i ye shes skye ba la rjes su mthun pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When it is expressed, it is conducive to the arising of correct knowledge because it is included in the teaching that is the natural outcome of the knowledge of the noble ones.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: brjod pa med na yang de gzhan dag la bsnyad pa dang / thos par byed kyang mi nus te /üîΩso so rang gis rig par bya ba @73a * //
analyzed: brjod pa med na yang de gzhan dag la bsnyad pa dang / thos par byed kyang mi nus te / so so rang gis rig par bya ba @73a * //
translated: ‚ÄúEven though it is inexpressible, it can be conveyed to others and can be heard,

original: yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is to be personally experienced by oneself.

original: thos par yang mi nus te /
analyzed: thos par yang mi nus te /
translated: It can be heard,

original: thos pa'i spyod yul las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thos pa'i spyod yul las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it transcends the domain of hearing.

original: de ltar byas nas shes pas kyang shes par nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar byas nas shes pas kyang shes par nus pa ma yin te /
translated: Even though it is not known by the knower,

original: de'i yul can gyi shes pa ni man ngag dang nye bar 'brel pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i yul can gyi shes pa ni man ngag dang nye bar 'brel pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the knowledge that has it as its object is connected with instruction.

original: de ltar na yang dag pa ma yin pa la rnam par rtog pa yin na yang /
analyzed: de ltar na yang dag pa ma yin pa la rnam par rtog pa yin na yang /
translated: In this way, even though it is a conceptualization of what is not real,

original: 'ga' zhig rnam par byang ba dang mthun par 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig rnam par byang ba dang mthun par 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: it is conducive to purification for some.

original: 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi rgyu mthun pa la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi rgyu mthun pa la dmigs pa'o //
translated: It is the object of the cause of the wisdom of the noble ones.

original: de'i phyir tshigs su bcad pas smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshigs su bcad pas smras pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said in verse:üîΩUnreal imagination,

original: yang dag min rtog yang dag min //üîΩyang dag ma yin min mi rtog ;
analyzed: yang dag min rtog yang dag min // yang dag ma yin min mi rtog ;
translated: neither unreal nor not unreal,

original: / rtog min mi rtog ma yin pa //
analyzed: / rtog min mi rtog ma yin pa //
translated: neither imagination nor not imagination,

original: shes bya thams cad yin par brjod //üîΩces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: shes bya thams cad yin par brjod // ces bya ba yin no //
translated: is said to be all objects of knowledge.

original: de la yang dag min rtog ni thar pa dang rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa'o //üîΩyang dag min //
analyzed: de la yang dag min rtog ni thar pa dang rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa'o // yang dag min //
translated: Among them, unreal imagination is not in accord with liberation.üîΩUnreal imagination is the imagination of what is unreal.

original: yang dag ma yin min ni brjod du med pa'i mtshan nyid rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i rjes su mthun pa'o ;
analyzed: yang dag ma yin min ni brjod du med pa'i mtshan nyid rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i rjes su mthun pa'o ;
translated: Neither unreal nor not unreal is in accord with the discernment of the characteristic of the inexpressible.

original: / mi rtog ces bya ba ni de kho na nyid dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: / mi rtog ces bya ba ni de kho na nyid dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes te /
translated: Neither imagination nor not imagination is the wisdom that transcends the world and reality,

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has the characteristic of non-imagination.

original: rtog min mi rtog ma yin pa ni /
analyzed: rtog min mi rtog ma yin pa ni /
translated: Neither imagination nor not imagination is the wisdom that transcends the world and reality,üîΩbecause it has the characteristic of non-imagination.

original: 'phags pa rnams kyi 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyi rjes la thob pa dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyi 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyi rjes la thob pa dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes te /
translated: The supramundane knowledge of the noble ones is pure mundane knowledge that is attained subsequently.

original: yang dag pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it has a correct object.

original: chos kyi mtshan nyid rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi mtshan nyid rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it establishes the characteristics of phenomena.

original: ji skad bstan pa de khon nyid yongs su shes na rnam par rtog pa spong ngo //
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa de khon nyid yongs su shes na rnam par rtog pa spong ngo //
translated: When one fully understands reality as it has been taught, one abandons conceptualization.

original: rnam par rtog pa spangs na 'khor ba las ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa spangs na 'khor ba las ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: When conceptualization is abandoned, one turns away from sa·πÉsƒÅra.

original: de ltar byas na de kho na nyid mthong ba rnams ni rnam par grol ba la 'jug par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar byas na de kho na nyid mthong ba rnams ni rnam par grol ba la 'jug par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus it is taught that those who see reality enter into liberation.

original: da ni de kho na nyid ma mthong na ni 'ching ba'i rgyur 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: da ni de kho na nyid ma mthong na ni 'ching ba'i rgyur 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Now, in order to show that if one does not see reality, it becomes the cause of bondage, it is said:

original: de bzhin nyid de de ltar yongs su ma shes shes pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid de de ltar yongs su ma shes shes pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: That suchness is not fully understood by those who think...

original: chos thams cad brjod du med pa'i mtshan nyid du yongs su ma shes pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad brjod du med pa'i mtshan nyid du yongs su ma shes pa ste /
translated: One does not fully understand all phenomena as having the characteristic of being inexpressible.

original: de ltar ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not seen in that way.

original: de pho na shes pa dang bral ba'i byis pa rnams kyis de kho na nyid ma mthong ba'i gzhi des te /
analyzed: de pho na shes pa dang bral ba'i byis pa rnams kyis de kho na nyid ma mthong ba'i gzhi des te /
translated: Therefore, the childish, who are devoid of knowledge, do not see reality.

original: de'i rgyus zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i rgyus zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The basis is the cause of that.

original: rnam par rtog pa rnam pa brgyad ni 'jug pa'i 'bras bu'i rgyu nyid dang / 'jug pa'i gzhi'i rgyu nyid kyi dbang du byas nas rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa rnam pa brgyad ni 'jug pa'i 'bras bu'i rgyu nyid dang / 'jug pa'i gzhi'i rgyu nyid kyi dbang du byas nas rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: The eight kinds of conceptualization are established in terms of the cause of the result of engagement and the cause of the basis of engagement.

original: de la 'jug @73b pa'i 'bras bu ni khams dang 'gro ba dang skye gnas kyis bsdus pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i 'du byed rnams so //
analyzed: de la 'jug @73b pa'i 'bras bu ni khams dang 'gro ba dang skye gnas kyis bsdus pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i 'du byed rnams so //
translated: The result of engagement is the formative forces such as form, etc., which are included in the realms, destinies and the places of birth.

original: de dag gi rgyu ni rnam par rtog pa gsum mo //
analyzed: de dag gi rgyu ni rnam par rtog pa gsum mo //
translated: The cause of these is the three kinds of conceptualization.

original: 'jug pa'i gzhi ni bdag med par mthong ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa bdag tu mthong ba dang / de'i rtsa ba can gyi lta ba'o//
analyzed: 'jug pa'i gzhi ni bdag med par mthong ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa bdag tu mthong ba dang / de'i rtsa ba can gyi lta ba'o//
translated: The basis of engagement is the view of self, which is the counteragent to the view of selflessness, and the views that are rooted in that.

original: de'i gzhi las 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug ste /
analyzed: de'i gzhi las 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug ste /
translated: From that basis, there is attachment, hatred and delusion.

original: de dag ni rnam par rtog pa rnam pa lnga'o //
analyzed: de dag ni rnam par rtog pa rnam pa lnga'o //
translated: These are the five types of conceptualization.

original: de ltar na chos kyi mtshan nyid dang / chos kyi khyad par gyi mtshan nyid dang / bsdus pa'i mtshan nyid dang / bsdus pa'i khyad par gyi mtshan nyid dang / chos kyi rnam par dbye ba'i dbang du byas nas rnam pa brgyad do //
analyzed: de ltar na chos kyi mtshan nyid dang / chos kyi khyad par gyi mtshan nyid dang / bsdus pa'i mtshan nyid dang / bsdus pa'i khyad par gyi mtshan nyid dang / chos kyi rnam par dbye ba'i dbang du byas nas rnam pa brgyad do //
translated: Thus, there are eight types of conceptualization, based on the characteristics of the dharmas, the characteristics of the distinctions of the dharmas, the characteristics of the collections, the characteristics of the distinctions of the collections, and the differentiation of the dharmas.

original: gzhi gsum skyed par byed pa yin pas sems can thams cad dang / snod kyi 'jig rten rnams sgrub par byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhi gsum skyed par byed pa yin pas sems can thams cad dang / snod kyi 'jig rten rnams sgrub par byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since it produces the three bases, it produces all sentient beings and the physical cosmos.

original: chos rnams kyi ngo bo la dmigs pa'i rnam pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni ngo bo nyid du rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi ngo bo la dmigs pa'i rnam pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni ngo bo nyid du rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: Conceptualization of identity is the conceptualization that has as its aspect the observation of the nature of the dharmas.

original: bye brag tu rnam par rtog pa yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: bye brag tu rnam par rtog pa yang de bzhin no //
translated: Conceptualization of distinctions is the same.

original: chos bsdus pa la dmigs pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni ril por 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: chos bsdus pa la dmigs pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni ril por 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: Conceptualization of wholes is the conceptualization that has as its object the collection of dharmas.

original: rang gi rgyud kyi 'du byed la bdag dang bdag gi rnam par 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni bdag dang bdag gi rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi rgyud kyi 'du byed la bdag dang bdag gi rnam par 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni bdag dang bdag gi rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: The conceptualization that apprehends the formative forces of one's own mental continuum as an 'I' and as 'mine' is the conceptualization of 'I' and 'mine'.

original: tshor ba rnam pa gsum gyi gnas su gyur pa'i chos rnam la rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro ba dang / so sor ma brtags pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni sdug pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: tshor ba rnam pa gsum gyi gnas su gyur pa'i chos rnam la rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro ba dang / so sor ma brtags pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni sdug pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: The attachment to the three kinds of feelings, the aversion towards the three kinds of unwholesome dharmas and the non-discernment in regard to the three kinds of wholesome dharmas is the conceptualization of the agreeable, disagreeable and neither agreeable nor disagreeable.

original: de ltar dmigs pa dang / rnam pa'i dbang gis rnam par rtog pa rnams rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //üîΩrnam par rtog pa nyid spros pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar dmigs pa dang / rnam pa'i dbang gis rnam par rtog pa rnams rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o // rnam par rtog pa nyid spros pa ste /
translated: Thus, the conceptualizations should be understood as being established in terms of objective support and aspect.

original: brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Conceptualization itself is elaboration because it has an imagined nature.

original: de'i gnas ni dmigs pa'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de'i gnas ni dmigs pa'o zhes bstan to //
translated: Its basis is the objective support.

original: skye ba snga ma'i las kyis 'phangs pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga po la rnam par rtog pas bskyed ces brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: skye ba snga ma'i las kyis 'phangs pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga po la rnam par rtog pas bskyed ces brjod par bya ste /
translated: It should be said that the five aggregates, beginning with form, which are projected by the karma of previous births, are generated by conceptualization.

original: ji lta ji ltar rnam par rtog pa de dag la kun du spyod par byed pa de lta de ltar spros pa la mngon par dga' bar 'gyur zhing de las spros pa mngon par 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar rnam par rtog pa de dag la kun du spyod par byed pa de lta de ltar spros pa la mngon par dga' bar 'gyur zhing de las spros pa mngon par 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The more one indulges in these conceptualizations, the more one delights in conceptual proliferation, and from that conceptual proliferation arises.

original: de'i phyir rnam par rtog pa gsum po ni spros pa'i gnas kyis bskyed pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par rtog pa gsum po ni spros pa'i gnas kyis bskyed pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the three types of conceptualization are generated by the basis of conceptual proliferation.

original: yang dngos po de dag nyid la gnas nas sngon gyi spros ba'i bag chags kyis bsgos ba'i rnam par rtog pa kun nas spyod par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir @74a * //
analyzed: yang dngos po de dag nyid la gnas nas sngon gyi spros ba'i bag chags kyis bsgos ba'i rnam par rtog pa kun nas spyod par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir @74a * //
translated: In order to demonstrate that, based on those very entities, conceptualization is engaged through the latent impressions of past conceptual proliferation,

original: smras pa // ming gi 'du shes kyi brjod pas yongs su gzung ba zhes bya ba ni ming la 'du shes pa ni ming la 'du shes te /
analyzed: smras pa // ming gi 'du shes kyi brjod pas yongs su gzung ba zhes bya ba ni ming la 'du shes pa ni ming la 'du shes te /
translated: it is said: ‚ÄúGrasped by the expression of the conception of name.‚Äù The conception of name is the conception of name.

original: ming gi mtshan ma 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: ming gi mtshan ma 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid can no //
translated: It has the nature of apprehending the sign of name.

original: de sngon du song ba las rjes su tha snyad du byed pa ni brjod pa ste /
analyzed: de sngon du song ba las rjes su tha snyad du byed pa ni brjod pa ste /
translated: From that as the antecedent, there is expression, which is conventional usage.

original: ji ltar 'du shes pa de bzhin du tha snyad du byed do zhes mdo las gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar 'du shes pa de bzhin du tha snyad du byed do zhes mdo las gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and one designates it in accordance with that idea.

original: des yongs su gzung ba zhes bya ba'i bshad pa ni yongs su bsgos pa zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: des yongs su gzung ba zhes bya ba'i bshad pa ni yongs su bsgos pa zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The explanation ‚Äúthat which is taken up by that‚Äù means ‚Äúthat which is thoroughly imbued by that.‚Äù

original: rnam par rtog pa'i spros pa zhes bya ba ni spros pa med pa'i dngos po la gzugs nas rnam par shes pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du bzung nas rtog cing dpyod pas 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i spros pa zhes bya ba ni spros pa med pa'i dngos po la gzugs nas rnam par shes pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du bzung nas rtog cing dpyod pas 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúconceptual elaboration of conceptualization‚Äù means that when one apprehends a thing that is free from conceptual elaboration, one generates conceptualization and investigation, i.e., the thought ‚Äúthis is form,‚Äù up to the thought ‚Äúthis is consciousness.‚Äù

original: rdzas kyi dbye bas ni rnam pa sna tshogs mang por 'gyur ro //üîΩde las gzhan pa'i lta ba thams cad kyi rtsa ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rdzas kyi dbye bas ni rnam pa sna tshogs mang por 'gyur ro // de las gzhan pa'i lta ba thams cad kyi rtsa ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe many varieties of substance‚Äù means that the aggregates are of many different kinds.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthe root of all other views‚Äù means that the root of all other views, such as the view of the grasping of extremes, etc., is the view of the grasping of the perishable collection.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba las gzhan pa mthar 'dzin pa'i lta ba la sogs pa'i rtsa ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba de nyid kyis nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal yang rgyas par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba las gzhan pa mthar 'dzin pa'i lta ba la sogs pa'i rtsa ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba de nyid kyis nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal yang rgyas par byed pa yin la /
translated: The pride ‚ÄúI am‚Äù is also nourished by that view of the perishable collection.

original: rnam par rtog pa gang las de byung ba de las yang 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gang las de byung ba de las yang 'byung ba yin no //
translated: It arises from the conception that is its cause.

original: nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal de las /
analyzed: nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal de las /
translated: From the pride that thinks ‚ÄúI am,‚Äù

original: nga rgyal las kyang nga rgyal la sogs pa nga rgyal gzhan thams cad 'byung bas de ni rtsa bar gyur pa yin no //üîΩci rigs par zhes bya ba ni 'dir rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du lta ba'am /
analyzed: nga rgyal las kyang nga rgyal la sogs pa nga rgyal gzhan thams cad 'byung bas de ni rtsa bar gyur pa yin no // ci rigs par zhes bya ba ni 'dir rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du lta ba'am /
translated: all other types of pride, such as the pride that thinks ‚ÄúI am,‚Äù arise. Therefore, it is the root.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúin whatever way is appropriate‚Äù means that the order of the three bases is not fixed.

original: yang na gang na rjes su chags pa yod pa de na khong khro yang yod pas zhes bya bas don ji ltar 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: yang na gang na rjes su chags pa yod pa de na khong khro yang yod pas zhes bya bas don ji ltar 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: Or, the order is in accordance with the way the text is recited.

original: gzhi gsum po dbye bar bya ste /
analyzed: gzhi gsum po dbye bar bya ste /
translated: The three bases should be distinguished.

original: dang po ni rnam par rtog pa la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: dang po ni rnam par rtog pa la gnas pa'o //
translated: The first is the basis of the conception of ‚ÄúI.‚Äù

original: de nyid la lta ba las ngo'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal kun du 'jug pa ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid la lta ba las ngo'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal kun du 'jug pa ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second is the basis of the pride that thinks ‚ÄúI am,‚Äù which is based on the view of the transitory collection.

original: de la brten pa'i 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang gti mug ni gsum pa'o //
analyzed: de la brten pa'i 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang gti mug ni gsum pa'o //
translated: The third is the basis of the attachment, hatred, and delusion that are based on the pride that thinks ‚ÄúI am.‚Äù

original: gzhi gsum po dag gcig la gcig brten pa'i don bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: gzhi gsum po dag gcig la gcig brten pa'i don bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to show that the three bases are mutually dependent, the root text says:

original: de la rnam par rtog pa'i spros ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de la rnam par rtog pa'i spros ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In this regard, the proliferation of conceptual thought and so on.

original: 'jig rten thams cad kyi zhes bya ba ni snod dang sems can gyi 'jig rten rnams so ;
analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad kyi zhes bya ba ni snod dang sems can gyi 'jig rten rnams so ;
translated: The entire world refers to the world of the environment and the world of beings.

original: / gzugs zhes bya ba ni gzung bar bya bas rab tu phye ba'i rtog pa ste /
analyzed: / gzugs zhes bya ba ni gzung bar bya bas rab tu phye ba'i rtog pa ste /
translated: The term form refers to the conceptual thought that is distinguished by being the object of perception.

original: gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid du rtog pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid du rtog pa'o //
translated: It is the conceptual thought that form is an entity.

original: de bzhin du gzhan dag kyang yin no //üîΩde dag gi ngo bo nyid rnam par gzhag pas yongs su bsdus pa ni bye brag tu rnam par rtog par rig par bya ste /üîΩngo bo nyid du rtog pa nyid la gnas nas @74b de'i rjes su 'brangs nas 'jug pa ni bye brag tu rnam par rtog pa'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan dag kyang yin no // de dag gi ngo bo nyid rnam par gzhag pas yongs su bsdus pa ni bye brag tu rnam par rtog par rig par bya ste / ngo bo nyid du rtog pa nyid la gnas nas @74b de'i rjes su 'brangs nas 'jug pa ni bye brag tu rnam par rtog pa'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: The same is true of the others.üîΩThe term conceptual thought that is based on the differentiation of their essential nature should be understood as the conceptual thought that is based on the differentiation of their essential nature.

original: ngo bo nyid du rnam par rtog pa la brten pa de zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang ngo //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid du rnam par rtog pa la brten pa de zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang ngo //
translated: In order to demonstrate that the conceptual thought that is based on the differentiation of their essential nature is the conceptual thought that is based on the differentiation of their particulars, he says, the conceptual thought that is based on the differentiation of their essential nature is the conceptual thought that is based on the differentiation of their particulars.

original: mang po gcig nyid du 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni ril por 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir dang ; phyir rol gyi dngos po bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mang po gcig nyid du 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni ril por 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir dang ; phyir rol gyi dngos po bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, and in order to demonstrate external entities, he says:

original: khyim dang / dmag dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: khyim dang / dmag dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: house, army, etc.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i sa bon rjes su bsgos pa'i phyir zag pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i sa bon rjes su bsgos pa'i phyir zag pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: It is contaminated because it is imbued with the seeds of contamination.

original: de'i phyir nye bar len pa dang bcas pa'i phyir nye bar len pa'i gnas su gyur pa'i phyir ro /üîΩ'dris shing zhes bya ba ni lhan cig skyes pa'i 'jig tshogs kyi lta ba la kun du brtags nas mngon par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir nye bar len pa dang bcas pa'i phyir nye bar len pa'i gnas su gyur pa'i phyir ro / 'dris shing zhes bya ba ni lhan cig skyes pa'i 'jig tshogs kyi lta ba la kun du brtags nas mngon par zhen pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is the basis of appropriation because it appropriates.üîΩFamiliarity means the innate identity view, which is the adherence to the belief in a real self.

original: goms pa la log par 'dzin cing 'dres pa yang mngon par shes pa'o //
analyzed: goms pa la log par 'dzin cing 'dres pa yang mngon par shes pa'o //
translated: Habituation means the adherence to the belief in a real self that is superimposed.

original: rang gi zhes bya ba ni rang gi rgyud do //
analyzed: rang gi zhes bya ba ni rang gi rgyud do //
translated: One's own means one's own continuum.

original: log pa'i rnam par rtog pa zhes bya ba ni sgro btags pa'i rnam pa nyid do //
analyzed: log pa'i rnam par rtog pa zhes bya ba ni sgro btags pa'i rnam pa nyid do //
translated: Erroneous conceptualization means the form of superimposition.

original: mdzes pa yid du 'ong ba'i dngos po la dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni yid du 'ong ba'i dngos po la dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mdzes pa yid du 'ong ba'i dngos po la dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni yid du 'ong ba'i dngos po la dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase that which is based on a beautiful and pleasing object means that which is based on a pleasing object.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs 'di dag thams cad gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dbye bas gnyis su rnam par gzhag par bya ba'am kan nas nyon mongs pa can gyi shes pa dang / shes bya'i dbye bas so //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs 'di dag thams cad gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dbye bas gnyis su rnam par gzhag par bya ba'am kan nas nyon mongs pa can gyi shes pa dang / shes bya'i dbye bas so //
translated: All of these factors of affliction should be classified as two-fold, either as the discrimination of the apprehended object or the discrimination of the apprehending subject, or as afflicted wisdom and the object of afflicted wisdom.

original: 'di dag gnyi ga yang sngon gyi mtha' mi shes so zhes bya bas thog ma med pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag gnyi ga yang sngon gyi mtha' mi shes so zhes bya bas thog ma med pa'o //
translated: Since neither of these two is known in the beginning, they are said to be unknown in the beginning.

original: phan tshun gyi rgyu can yin pa'i phyir mthong ba'i chos dang / phyi ma pa'o //
analyzed: phan tshun gyi rgyu can yin pa'i phyir mthong ba'i chos dang / phyi ma pa'o //
translated: Since they are mutually causal, they are also said to be present in this life and in future lives.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /üîΩrnam par rtog pa snga ma ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa / rnam par rtog pa snga ma ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said:üîΩThe former discrimination... and so on.üîΩThe phrase the former discrimination refers to the discrimination of the apprehended object.

original: rnam par rtog pa ngo ma shes pa ni spro ba'i gnas kyi rgyur 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ngo ma shes pa ni spro ba'i gnas kyi rgyur 'gyur gyi /
translated: The phrase the latter discrimination refers to the discrimination of the apprehending subject.

original: yongs su shes pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: yongs su shes pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: The phrase the former discrimination is not known means that the former discrimination is not known in the beginning.üîΩThe phrase the latter discrimination is not known means that the latter discrimination is not known in the middle.üîΩThe phrase the former discrimination is not known means that the former discrimination is not known in the end.üîΩThe phrase the latter discrimination is not known means that the latter discrimination is not known in the end.

original: de la da ltar gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de la da ltar gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Now, as for the present, etc., etc.

original: da ltar gyi ste tshe 'di'o //
analyzed: da ltar gyi ste tshe 'di'o //
translated: The present is this life.

original: rnam par rtog pa yongs su ma shes pa ni de kho na ma mthong ba'o //üîΩdes de'i dmigs pa'i dngos po 'byung ba'i rgyu ste ;
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa yongs su ma shes pa ni de kho na ma mthong ba'o // des de'i dmigs pa'i dngos po 'byung ba'i rgyu ste ;
translated: The non-understanding of conceptual differentiation is the non-seeing of reality.üîΩ The cause of the arising of its objective referent is the cause of the arising of the conceptual differentiation.

original: de byung bar gyur pas rnam par rtog pa yang 'byung bas de ltar na phan tshul gyi rgyu can nyid yin no //
analyzed: de byung bar gyur pas rnam par rtog pa yang 'byung bas de ltar na phan tshul gyi rgyu can nyid yin no //
translated: Since that has arisen, the conceptual differentiation also arises. Thus, they are mutually causal.

original: de ltar 'jug par 'gyur ba'i rnam par rtog pa ldog par 'gyur ba'i thabs rab tu bstan par bya ba'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de ltar 'jug par 'gyur ba'i rnam par rtog pa ldog par 'gyur ba'i thabs rab tu bstan par bya ba'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate the method for the cessation of the conceptual differentiation that functions in this way, he says:

original: rnam pa rtog pa de ji ltar shes par 'gyur zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: rnam pa rtog pa de ji ltar shes par 'gyur zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: How is that conceptual differentiation to be understood? etc.

original: @75a * // rnam par rtog pa yongs su shes pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi sbyor ba yin no //
analyzed: @75a * // rnam par rtog pa yongs su shes pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi sbyor ba yin no //
translated: The understanding of conceptual differentiation is the application of non-conceptual intuition.

original: des na smra pa /
analyzed: des na smra pa /
translated: Therefore, he says:

original: yongs su tshal ba rnam pa bzhi dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: yongs su tshal ba rnam pa bzhi dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The fourfold thorough understanding, etc., etc.

original: de la dngos bo ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par 'jog pa ni yongs su tshol ba'o //
analyzed: de la dngos bo ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par 'jog pa ni yongs su tshol ba'o //
translated: The determination of things as they are is investigation.

original: yongs su btsal ba'i dngos po'i mthar thug pa rnam par nges pa thob pa ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su btsal ba'i dngos po'i mthar thug pa rnam par nges pa thob pa ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa'o //
translated: The attainment of certainty in the ultimate reality of things that are investigated is thorough knowledge of things as they are.

original: ming yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du nye bar yongs su rtog pa dang / rigs pas yongs su rtog pa de ni ming yongs su tshol ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ming yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du nye bar yongs su rtog pa dang / rigs pas yongs su rtog pa de ni ming yongs su tshol ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The thorough investigation of the name as it really is and the thorough investigation by reasoning is called the investigation of the name.

original: ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su tshol ba gzhan yang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su tshol ba gzhan yang rig par bya'o //
translated: The other kinds of thorough investigation should be understood in the same way.

original: ming la ming tsam du zhes bya ba ni dngos pos dben pa'i ming ngo //
analyzed: ming la ming tsam du zhes bya ba ni dngos pos dben pa'i ming ngo //
translated: The name is only a name means that the name is empty of the thing.

original: de la blos sbyar ba de ni de'i bdag nyid ma yin pa nyid du mthong ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de la blos sbyar ba de ni de'i bdag nyid ma yin pa nyid du mthong ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The mind is applied to that means that one sees that it is not that nature.

original: ming gis dben pa'i dngos po ni /
analyzed: ming gis dben pa'i dngos po ni /
translated: The thing is empty of the name

original: de'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not that nature.

original: yongs su grub pa'i dngos po tsam mthong ba ni dngos po yongs su tshol ba'o //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i dngos po tsam mthong ba ni dngos po yongs su tshol ba'o //
translated: The mere seeing of the established thing is the investigation of the thing.

original: ngo bo nyid du btags pa tsam nyid du lta ba dang / bye brag tu btags pa tsam du lta ba ni de gnyis ka yongs su tshol ba'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid du btags pa tsam nyid du lta ba dang / bye brag tu btags pa tsam du lta ba ni de gnyis ka yongs su tshol ba'o //
translated: The seeing of the mere designation of essence and the seeing of the mere designation of particular are the investigation of both.

original: de lta de ltar yongs su tshol na /
analyzed: de lta de ltar yongs su tshol na /
translated: Thus investigating,

original: ming dang dngos po shin tu tha dad par yang mthong la //
analyzed: ming dang dngos po shin tu tha dad par yang mthong la //
translated: one sees that the name and the thing are quite distinct.

original: tha dad yang dngos po gang gi ming gang yin pa de gzhan dag la shin tu 'jug par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bas rjes su 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid kyang rab tu rig par 'gyur te //
analyzed: tha dad yang dngos po gang gi ming gang yin pa de gzhan dag la shin tu 'jug par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bas rjes su 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid kyang rab tu rig par 'gyur te //
translated: And one understands the characteristic of the connection, in that the name of one thing does not apply to another.

original: de gnyi ga'i 'brel ba la brten nas ngo bo nyid dang bye brag tu btags pa yang khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de gnyi ga'i 'brel ba la brten nas ngo bo nyid dang bye brag tu btags pa yang khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: And one understands the designation of essence and particular in dependence on the connection of both.

original: de ltar na yongs su tshol ba bzhi po ni yongs su shes pa bzhi'i sbyor ba pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na yongs su tshol ba bzhi po ni yongs su shes pa bzhi'i sbyor ba pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus the four investigations should be understood as the preparation for the four knowledges.

original: ming dang dngos po tha dad par gyur na de dag gnyi ga'i 'brel pa'i dgos pa yongs su shes pa ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin yongs su shes pa dang po yin no //
analyzed: ming dang dngos po tha dad par gyur na de dag gnyi ga'i 'brel pa'i dgos pa yongs su shes pa ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin yongs su shes pa dang po yin no //
translated: If the name and the thing were different, the purpose of the connection between the two would be to know them both, which is the first correct knowledge.

original: des na smras pa /
analyzed: des na smras pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: des de ltar ming yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin yongs su shes so zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: des de ltar ming yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin yongs su shes so zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: By that, the name is known correctly as it is.

original: shin tu tha dad pa yin na yang dngos po de'i ming 'di zhes sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis des dben par mkhyen na yang /
analyzed: shin tu tha dad pa yin na yang dngos po de'i ming 'di zhes sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis des dben par mkhyen na yang /
translated: Even if they are completely different, the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas know that name of that thing as being separate from it.

original: ji srid tha snyad rjes su 'jug par 'gyur ba de srid du ming la sogs pa'i rim par de ston par mdzad @75b do ;
analyzed: ji srid tha snyad rjes su 'jug par 'gyur ba de srid du ming la sogs pa'i rim par de ston par mdzad @75b do ;
translated: However, as long as one engages in conventional usage, for that long they teach in the order of name and so on.

original: / ming gis 'du shes su byed pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: / ming gis 'du shes su byed pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it has the characteristic of being cognized by name,

original: 'du shes kyi don dang zhes bya ba ni dngos po de ming dang rgyu mtshan gyis nye bar mtshon par byed ba'i don to zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'du shes kyi don dang zhes bya ba ni dngos po de ming dang rgyu mtshan gyis nye bar mtshon par byed ba'i don to zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
translated: The meaning of perception is the meaning of the representation of that entity by name and reason.

original: ji ltar 'du shes pa bzhin du mngon par zhen par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar /
analyzed: ji ltar 'du shes pa bzhin du mngon par zhen par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar /
translated: As there is perception, so there is adherence.

original: lta ba'i don dang zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: lta ba'i don dang zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The meaning of view is stated.

original: ji ltar mngon par zhen par gyur pa de ltar tha snyad du byed do zhes bya bar nye bar 'dogs pa'i don du'o zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: ji ltar mngon par zhen par gyur pa de ltar tha snyad du byed do zhes bya bar nye bar 'dogs pa'i don du'o zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: As there is adherence, so there is conventional usage. The meaning of designation is stated.

original: de med na ming 'byung bar sbyar ba'i phyir //
analyzed: de med na ming 'byung bar sbyar ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to show that if that does not exist, name does not occur,

original: gal te gzugs la sogs par zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gal te gzugs la sogs par zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúIf there were no form, etc.‚Äù

original: 'du shes med na dngos po nye bar mtshon par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'du shes med na dngos po nye bar mtshon par mi 'gyur la /
translated: If there were no perception, there would be no representation of an entity.

original: de med na btags pa la mngon par zhen par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de med na btags pa la mngon par zhen par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If that does not exist, there would be no adherence to the designation.

original: mngon par zhen pa med na bdag nyid don la nges par 'gyur ba dang // gzhan dag la nges pa bskyed par mi nus la //
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa med na bdag nyid don la nges par 'gyur ba dang // gzhan dag la nges pa bskyed par mi nus la //
translated: If one does not cling to them, one cannot generate certainty in oneself, nor can one generate certainty in others.

original: de bzhin du bstan pa dang mnyam pa yang med par 'gyur ro zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du bstan pa dang mnyam pa yang med par 'gyur ro zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: And in the same way, the teaching would not exist.

original: de ltar na ming rnam par gzhag pa shes pa ni ming tshol bar gyur pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na ming rnam par gzhag pa shes pa ni ming tshol bar gyur pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa'o //
translated: Thus, the knowledge of the establishment of names is the thorough knowledge of the investigation of names just as it is.

original: dngos po la dngos po tsam du des yongs su btsal ba na ma 'dres pa ste mi ldan par ro //
analyzed: dngos po la dngos po tsam du des yongs su btsal ba na ma 'dres pa ste mi ldan par ro //
translated: When one investigates the thing as just a thing, one sees it as unmixed, that is, as not endowed with the name.

original: brjod du med pa'i dngos po tsam du lta ba ni ;
analyzed: brjod du med pa'i dngos po tsam du lta ba ni ;
translated: The view of the thing as just an inexpressible entity is

original: shes pa gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa gnyis pa'o //
translated: the second knowledge.

original: yongs su grub pa dang / dngos po'i ngo bo dag ni bden na yang de'i ngo bo ni ma yin te /
analyzed: yongs su grub pa dang / dngos po'i ngo bo dag ni bden na yang de'i ngo bo ni ma yin te /
translated: The perfected and the entity nature are real, but they are not the entity of that.üîΩThe view that the appearance of that is just a reflection is

original: de'i snang ba gzugs brnyan nyid dang 'bra bar yong su shes shing lta ba ni shes pa gsum pa'o //
analyzed: de'i snang ba gzugs brnyan nyid dang 'bra bar yong su shes shing lta ba ni shes pa gsum pa'o //
translated: the third knowledge.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: des de'i ngo bo nyid sprul pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: des de'i ngo bo nyid sprul pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The statement the reality of that is emanation, etc.

original: ji ltar sprul pa dang / gzugs brnyan te de'i rnam pa de dang 'dra bar sprul pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar sprul pa dang / gzugs brnyan te de'i rnam pa de dang 'dra bar sprul pa'o //
translated: is like an emanation and a reflection, that is, like an emanation that has that aspect.

original: de bzhin du dngos po'i rnam par yang gzugs brnyan dang 'dra ba kun du brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dngos po'i rnam par yang gzugs brnyan dang 'dra ba kun du brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, the aspect of an entity should be known as a reflection, which is the imagined reality.

original: de bzhin du gzugs brnyan la sogs pa rnams la sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs brnyan la sogs pa rnams la sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: In the same way, one should apply the analogy of a reflection, etc.

original: kun du brtags pa'i ngo bos dben pa mthong ba de ni shin tu zab pa'i don spyod yul du gyur pa zhes bya bar gsung pa yin no //
analyzed: kun du brtags pa'i ngo bos dben pa mthong ba de ni shin tu zab pa'i don spyod yul du gyur pa zhes bya bar gsung pa yin no //
translated: The seeing of the emptiness of the imagined reality is said to be the sphere of the profound meaning.

original: chos rnams kyi byar brag ni gnas skabs kyi khyad par gyis bsdus pa nyid do //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi byar brag ni gnas skabs kyi khyad par gyis bsdus pa nyid do //
translated: The function of entities is subsumed in the particular states.

original: de'i gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid la lta ba ni shes pa bzhi pa'o //üîΩngo bo nyid kyang gnyis su @76a * //
analyzed: de'i gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid la lta ba ni shes pa bzhi pa'o // ngo bo nyid kyang gnyis su @76a * //
translated: The view of the non-dual characteristic of that is the fourth knowledge.

original: med pa'i mtshan nyid du rig pa yin no //
analyzed: med pa'i mtshan nyid du rig pa yin no //
translated: The reality of that is also known as the non-dual characteristic.

original: de lta na yang de las 'di la bye brag bstan pa'i phyir dang / dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir bye brag tu btags pa'i tshol ba nyid la gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid ces bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang de las 'di la bye brag bstan pa'i phyir dang / dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir bye brag tu btags pa'i tshol ba nyid la gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid ces bstan pa yin no //
translated: Nevertheless, in order to teach the distinction of this from that, and in order to teach the classification, the search for designations as distinct is taught to have the characteristic of non-duality.üîΩNon-duality is neither an entity nor

original: gnyis su med pa nyid kyang dngos po yang ma yin ;
analyzed: gnyis su med pa nyid kyang dngos po yang ma yin ;
translated: a non-entity.

original: dngos po med pa yang ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya bar rtsa ba'i tshig gis yod pa dang med pa ma yin pa dang sbyar pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: dngos po med pa yang ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya bar rtsa ba'i tshig gis yod pa dang med pa ma yin pa dang sbyar pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to connect the root text with the words ‚Äúneither existent nor non-existent,‚Äù it is said:

original: dngos po de yang yod pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: dngos po de yang yod pa yang ma yin /
translated: That entity is neither existent nor

original: med pa yang ma yin te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: med pa yang ma yin te zhes bya ba la /
translated: non-existent.

original: byis pas kun du brtags pa'i bdag nyid kyi yongs su ma grub pa nyid kyi phyir yod pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: byis pas kun du brtags pa'i bdag nyid kyi yongs su ma grub pa nyid kyi phyir yod pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is not existent because of the non-establishment of the imagined nature imagined by the childish.

original: med pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: med pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not non-existent because of the existence of the dependent nature.üîΩIt is not non-existent because of the existence of the perfected nature.üîΩIt is not non-existent because of the existence of the object of non-conceptual wisdom.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul du gyur pa nyid kyis brjod du med pa'i bdag nyid du rnam par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul du gyur pa nyid kyis brjod du med pa'i bdag nyid du rnam par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not non-existent because of the existence of the inexpressible nature that exists as the object of non-conceptual wisdom.

original: de ltar gzugs la sogs pa yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar gzugs la sogs pa yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Thus, form and so on do not exist.

original: don dam par gzugs kyang gzugs su bsgrub par nus pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam par gzugs kyang gzugs su bsgrub par nus pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Ultimately, form cannot be established as form.

original: gzugs med pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs med pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it formless,

original: kun rdzob tu lag pa la sogs pa'i reg pas reg cing nom du yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu lag pa la sogs pa'i reg pas reg cing nom du yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is tangible, being touched by the contact of hands and so on, conventionally.

original: de'i phyir / gzugs su nye bar 'dogs pas zhes smras pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir / gzugs su nye bar 'dogs pas zhes smras pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is said that form is imputed in dependence on the four great elements.

original: de bzhin du bstan du yod pa la sogs pa la yang tshul 'di nyid kyis rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du bstan du yod pa la sogs pa la yang tshul 'di nyid kyis rig par bya'o //
translated: The same method should be understood for the other [aggregates], such as feeling, which are said to be tangible and so on.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa med pa nyid de de ni rnam par rtog pa'i sdug bsngal gyi spros pa skyed par byed pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa med pa nyid de de ni rnam par rtog pa'i sdug bsngal gyi spros pa skyed par byed pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to show that the absence of correct knowledge as it is gives rise to the proliferation of the suffering of conceptualization, it is said:

original: de la byis pa rnams kyi log par rtog pa rnam pa brgyad po zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de la byis pa rnams kyi log par rtog pa rnam pa brgyad po zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Regarding that, the eight types of misconceptions of the childish... and so on.

original: rnam par rtog pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu nyid du rab tu bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu nyid du rab tu bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that conceptualization is the cause of affliction,

original: log par zhes bya ba smos so //üîΩ'khor ba ni nyon mongs pa'i rtsa ba can nyid yin pa'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pas 'khor ba kun du bskyed cing /
analyzed: log par zhes bya ba smos so // 'khor ba ni nyon mongs pa'i rtsa ba can nyid yin pa'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pas 'khor ba kun du bskyed cing /
translated: he says, ‚Äúwrongly.‚Äù

original: 'khor ba yang gcig tu sdug bsngal bar ro gcig pa'i phyir sdug bsngal bskyed cing 'jug bar 'gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: 'khor ba yang gcig tu sdug bsngal bar ro gcig pa'i phyir sdug bsngal bskyed cing 'jug bar 'gyur pa yin no //
translated: Since cyclic existence is rooted in affliction, it is generated by affliction and continues to exist because it generates suffering, since cyclic existence is of one taste in suffering.

original: de ltar na re zhig rnam par rtog pa'i rtsa ba las sdug bsngal 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig rnam par rtog pa'i rtsa ba las sdug bsngal 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, he has demonstrated that suffering arises from the root of conceptualization.

original: rnam par rtog pa spangs ba'i 'gog pa las sdug bsngal 'gag par 'gyur ba bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa spangs ba'i 'gog pa las sdug bsngal 'gag par 'gyur ba bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate that suffering ceases from the cessation of conceptualization, he says,

original: gang gi tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: ‚ÄúWhen there is no conceptualization,‚Äù and so on.

original: @76b rnam par rtog pa spangs pas spros pa 'gag par 'gyur bas 'khor bar gnas par yang mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: @76b rnam par rtog pa spangs pas spros pa 'gag par 'gyur bas 'khor bar gnas par yang mi 'gyur la /
translated: Since conceptualization is eliminated, conceptual proliferation ceases, and thus one does not remain in cyclic existence.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i sbyor ba mngon par 'du byed pa'i bye brag gis mya ngan las 'das par yang mi gnas so //üîΩde lta bu ni theg pa chen po'i mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i sbyor ba mngon par 'du byed pa'i bye brag gis mya ngan las 'das par yang mi gnas so // de lta bu ni theg pa chen po'i mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pas /
translated: and the application of the Buddha-dharmas and the maturation of sentient beings, he does not even abide in nirvana.üîΩThis is the nirvana of the Mahayana, which does not abide.

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa yin no //
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa yin no //
translated: This is the nirvana of the Mahayana, which does not abide.

original: shes bya'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul gyi de kho na nyid ni /
analyzed: shes bya'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul gyi de kho na nyid ni /
translated: The reality which is the domain of the wisdom that is the purification of the obscurations of the knowable,

original: de kho na'i don gyi mchog go //
analyzed: de kho na'i don gyi mchog go //
translated: is the supreme meaning of reality.

original: de spyod yul du byas pa'i ye shes ni shes bya'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol ba'i ye shes so //
analyzed: de spyod yul du byas pa'i ye shes ni shes bya'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol ba'i ye shes so //
translated: The wisdom that takes that as its domain is the wisdom that is liberated from the obscurations of the knowable.

original: de rnam par dag pa ni sa brgyad pa nas nye bar bzung nas rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de rnam par dag pa ni sa brgyad pa nas nye bar bzung nas rig par bya'o //
translated: Its purification should be understood to begin from the eighth stage.

original: thams cad la dbang thob pa ni mdor na phyi'i dngos po la dang / nang gi bdag nyid la'o //
analyzed: thams cad la dbang thob pa ni mdor na phyi'i dngos po la dang / nang gi bdag nyid la'o //
translated: The attainment of mastery over all is, in brief, external things and the internal self.

original: de ltar phyi'i dngos po yang rnam pa gnyis la dbang thob pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar phyi'i dngos po yang rnam pa gnyis la dbang thob pa ste /
translated: Thus, mastery over external things is also twofold.

original: yod pa ma yin pa'i dngos po bskyed pa ni /
analyzed: yod pa ma yin pa'i dngos po bskyed pa ni /
translated: The generation of a nonexistent thing

original: sprul pa sna tshogs la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sprul pa sna tshogs la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: is the various emanations, etc.

original: yod pa'i dngos po gzhan du ba sgrubs pa ni yongs su bsgyur ba sna tshogs pa yang ngo zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yod pa'i dngos po gzhan du ba sgrubs pa ni yongs su bsgyur ba sna tshogs pa yang ngo zhes bya ba'o //

original: nang gi bdag nyid kyang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: nang gi bdag nyid kyang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The internal is also twofold:

original: tshe byin gyis brlabs pas dus ji srid du 'dod pa de srid du gnas pa la dbang ba ni gang yang ji srid du 'dod pa de srid du gnas pa dang zhes bya bas bstan pa yin no //üîΩdga' mgur te /
analyzed: tshe byin gyis brlabs pas dus ji srid du 'dod pa de srid du gnas pa la dbang ba ni gang yang ji srid du 'dod pa de srid du gnas pa dang zhes bya bas bstan pa yin no // dga' mgur te /
translated: The power over life, i.e., the power to remain for as long as one wishes, is indicated by ‚Äúhe remains for as long as he wishes.

original: 'dod pa bzhin dpyad nas gnod pa med bar 'chi ba la dbang thob pas 'dod pa tsam gyis tshe 'dor ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa bzhin dpyad nas gnod pa med bar 'chi ba la dbang thob pas 'dod pa tsam gyis tshe 'dor ba'o //
translated: He dies when he wishes, i.e., he casts off his life at will, because he has attained the power over death without injury, i.e., after investigating at will, without injury.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: gnod pa med par dga' mgur 'chi 'pho ba la yang ngo zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gnod pa med par dga' mgur 'chi 'pho ba la yang ngo zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúHe also dies when he wishes, without injury.

original: thams cad la dbang thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can thams cad kyi gtso bor 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: thams cad la dbang thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can thams cad kyi gtso bor 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: The bodhisattva who has obtained power becomes the chief of all sentient beings.

original: de ltar dbang thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de la ji ltar gtso bor gzung ba'i phan yon lnga bstan te /
analyzed: de ltar dbang thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de la ji ltar gtso bor gzung ba'i phan yon lnga bstan te /
translated: Thus, five benefits are shown for the bodhisattva who has obtained power, in terms of how he is to be regarded as chief.

original: nyon mongs pa rab tu zhi ba ma yin na yang gang rab tu zhi bar gyur bas gnas pa'i mchog la gnas par 'gyur ba'i rab tu zhi ba de nyon mongs pa zhi ba'i nyan thos la sogs pa la med pa'i phan yon 'di dag 'byung bar 'gyur
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rab tu zhi ba ma yin na yang gang rab tu zhi bar gyur bas gnas pa'i mchog la gnas par 'gyur ba'i rab tu zhi ba de nyon mongs pa zhi ba'i nyan thos la sogs pa la med pa'i phan yon 'di dag 'byung bar 'gyur
translated: Even though his addictions are not completely pacified, he has a pacification that is not shared by the disciples and so forth, who have completely pacified their addictions, and he abides in the highest abode.

original: ro // rig pa'i gnas thams cad la shes bya'i mthar thug pa'i shes pa gang /üîΩnyan thos la sogs pa la @77a * //
analyzed: ro // rig pa'i gnas thams cad la shes bya'i mthar thug pa'i shes pa gang / nyan thos la sogs pa la @77a * //
translated: The knowledge of the culmination of objects of knowledge in all the sciences,üîΩwhich is not shared by the disciples and so forth,

original: med pa gang thob pa de yang 'di'i phan yon yin no //
analyzed: med pa gang thob pa de yang 'di'i phan yon yin no //
translated: is also a benefit of the bodhisattva.

original: 'khor ba dang sems can rnams kyi phyin ci log gi spyod pas sdug bsngal ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i sems can thams cad kyi don la skyo bar mi 'gyur ba dang / dran pa dang bcas pa'i shes rab kyi khyad par dang ldan pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ldem po ngag thams cad la 'jug pa la nus pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'khor ba dang sems can rnams kyi phyin ci log gi spyod pas sdug bsngal ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i sems can thams cad kyi don la skyo bar mi 'gyur ba dang / dran pa dang bcas pa'i shes rab kyi khyad par dang ldan pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ldem po ngag thams cad la 'jug pa la nus pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: He is able to understand all the indirect teachings of the TathƒÅgatas, because he has the special wisdom that is accompanied by mindfulness.

original: phyir mi ldog pa nyid kyi phyir mos pa mi zlogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa nyid kyi phyir mos pa mi zlogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: He is not discouraged in his interest, because he is irreversible.

original: phas kyi rgol ba thams cad kyis bzlogs kyang mi zlogs pas brtson 'grus brtsams pa mi 'dor bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phas kyi rgol ba thams cad kyis bzlogs kyang mi zlogs pas brtson 'grus brtsams pa mi 'dor bar 'gyur ro //
translated: He does not abandon his energetic effort, because he cannot be turned back by any adversaries.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúHe is not dependent on others.‚Äù

original: gzhan gyi tshig gi rjes su mi 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi tshig gi rjes su mi 'jug pa'o //
translated: He does not follow the words of others.

original: phan yon 'di dag dang ldan pas phan yon gyi las 'di dag byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phan yon 'di dag dang ldan pas phan yon gyi las 'di dag byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Endowed with these benefits, he performs these beneficial actions.

original: dang po ni re zhig kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i mthong ba'i chos kyi bde ba khyad par can la gnas pas sems zhi ba'i phan yon 'di nyid yin no //
analyzed: dang po ni re zhig kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i mthong ba'i chos kyi bde ba khyad par can la gnas pas sems zhi ba'i phan yon 'di nyid yin no //
translated: The first is the benefit of the pacification of mind, by abiding in the special happiness of the present life, which is free from the afflictions.

original: de bzhin du kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i zhi par gnas pas bya ba rnam pa bzhi bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i zhi par gnas pas bya ba rnam pa bzhi bya ba yin te /
translated: Similarly, by abiding in the pacification which is free from the afflictions, one performs four kinds of activities.

original: rang gi don gyi dbang du byas nas rang gi rgyud yongs su smin pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi don gyi dbang du byas nas rang gi rgyud yongs su smin pa'o //
translated: With regard to one's own aim, one matures one's own continuum.

original: gang gi phyir smras pa /
analyzed: gang gi phyir smras pa /
translated: For it is said:

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su smin pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su smin pa zhes bya ba'o //

original: gzhan gyi don ni gzhan gyi rgyud yongs su smin pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don ni gzhan gyi rgyud yongs su smin pa ste /
translated: With regard to the aims of others, one matures the continuums of others.

original: gang gi phyir smras pa /
analyzed: gang gi phyir smras pa /
translated: For it is said:

original: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa zhes bya ba yin no //

original: dgongs pa can gyi tshig la mkhas pas dam pa'i chos 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: dgongs pa can gyi tshig la mkhas pas dam pa'i chos 'dzin pa'o //

original: de dbye bar bya ste /
analyzed: de dbye bar bya ste /
translated: This should be analyzed.

original: sems can thams cad kyi the tshom skyes shing skyes pa rnams gcod par byed pa nyid dang / gang yang dkon mchog gsum gyi gdung rgyud mi 'chad par 'jug par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi the tshom skyes shing skyes pa rnams gcod par byed pa nyid dang / gang yang dkon mchog gsum gyi gdung rgyud mi 'chad par 'jug par byed pa'o //
translated: It is the cutting off of the doubts of all sentient beings as they arise, and it is the entry into the lineage of the Three Jewels.

original: de dag gis ni de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i mdo sde rnams mnyan pa dang / gzung ba dang / bcang ba dang ldan pa'i bya bas yongs su mnyan par bya /
analyzed: de dag gis ni de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i mdo sde rnams mnyan pa dang / gzung ba dang / bcang ba dang ldan pa'i bya bas yongs su mnyan par bya /

original: yang dag par gzung bar bya /
analyzed: yang dag par gzung bar bya /

analyzed: yun ring du gnas par bya bar mi mthun pa'i phyogs spang bar bya'o zhes bstan pa yin no //

original: dam pa'i chos ltar bcos pa zhes bya ba la dam pa'i chos ltar bcos pa ni dam pa'i chos kyi gzugs brnyan te /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos ltar bcos pa zhes bya ba la dam pa'i chos ltar bcos pa ni dam pa'i chos kyi gzugs brnyan te /

original: gzhi bslu ba @77b nas ji skad bstan pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gzhi bslu ba @77b nas ji skad bstan pa lta bu'o //

original: yang de ni bstan pa nub par byed pa zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'i bar du gcod par byed cing 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: yang de ni bstan pa nub par byed pa zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'i bar du gcod par byed cing 'jug pa'o //
translated: It is called the disappearance of the teaching because it obstructs and interrupts the teaching.

original: de dam pa'i chos ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de dam pa'i chos ni ma yin gyi /
